Text

[William Tully]99-william was a little over three - and - twenty when [he]99-william emerged from the chrysalis stage of [[his]99-william clerkdom]179-his clerkdom and became [a Social Reformer]180-a social reformer . [His]99-william life and doings until the age of twenty - three , had given small promise of the distinction of [his]99-william future career ; from [a mild - mannered , pale - faced and under - sized boy]181-a mild - mannered , pale - faced and under - sized boy [he]99-william had developed into [a mild - mannered , pale - faced little adult]182-a mild - mannered , pale - faced little adult standing five foot five in [his]99-william boots . Educated at [a small private school in [the suburbs of [London]1-london]184-the suburbs of london]183-a small private school in the suburbs of london , [his]99-william record for conduct was practically spotless and [he]99-william once took a prize for Divinity ; further , to the surprise and relief of [[his]99-william preceptors]185-his preceptors , [he]99-william managed to scrape through the Senior Cambridge Local Examination before [he]99-william was transferred to a desk in [the office of [a London insurance company]187-a london insurance company]186-the office of a london insurance company . [[His]99-william preceptor - in - chief]188-his preceptor - in - chief , in a neatly - written certificate , assured [[his]99-william future employers]189-his future employers that [they]189-his future employers would find [him]99-william painstaking and obedient â€” and [William]99-william , for the first six years of [his]99-william engagement , lived up to the character given [him]99-william . [[His]99-william mother]190-his mother , [a sharp - eyed , masterful woman]191-a sharp - eyed , masterful woman , had brought [him]99-william up to be painstaking and obedient ; it might be said with truth that as long as [she]190-his mother lived [he]99-william did not know how to be otherwise . It is true [he]99-william disliked [[his]99-william office]192-his office superiors vaguely , for the restrictions [they]189-his future employers placed upon [his]99-william wishes â€” just as , for the same reason , [he]99-william vaguely disliked [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother ; but [his]99-william wishes being indeterminate and [his]99-william ambition non - existent , [his]99-william vague dislike never stiffened into active resentment . It would seem that the supreme effort of passing [[his]99-william Cambridge Local]194-his cambridge local had left [him]99-william mentally exhausted for a season ; at any rate , from the conclusion of [his]99-william school - days till [he]99-william made the acquaintance of [Faraday]100-faraday , [his]99-william reading was practically confined to romantic and humorous literature . [He]99-william was a regular patron of the fiction department of [the municipal lending library]195-the municipal lending library and did not disdain to spend modestly on periodicals of the type of Snappy Bits . [He]99-william was unable to spend more than modestly because [his]99-william earnings , with the exception of a small sum for fares and pocket - money , were annexed by [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother each Saturday as a matter of normal routine . The manner of [her]190-his mother annexation made discussion singularly difficult ; and if [William]99-william ever felt stirrings of rebellion over the weekly cash delivery [he]99-william was careful never to betray [them]197-them . With [[his]99-william colleagues of [the office]199-the office]198-his colleagues of the office [Tully]99-william was a negligible quantity . [He]99-william was not unpopular â€” it was merely that [he]99-william did not matter . [[His]99-william mother]190-his mother 's control of [the family]201-the family funds was no doubt in part accountable for [[his]99-william comrades]202-his comrades ' neglect of [his]99-william society ; but [his]99-william own habits and manners were still more largely to blame , since besides being painstaking and obedient [he]99-william was unobtrusive and diffident . There was once a project on foot in [the office]199-the office to take [him]99-william out and make [him]99-william drunk â€” but nothing came of it because [no one]204-no one was sufficiently interested in [William]99-william to give up an evening to the job . The crisis in [his]99-william hitherto well - ordered life came when [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother died suddenly . This was in October 1910 . [William]99-william had gone to [the office]199-the office as usual that morning , leaving [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother apparently in [her]190-his mother usual health ; [he]99-william returned in the evening to blinds already drawn down . [A neighbour ( female]208-a neighbour ( female ) was in waiting in [the sitting - room]209-the sitting - room and broke the great news with a sense of its importance and [her]208-a neighbour ( female own ; [she]208-a neighbour ( female took [William]99-william 's hand , told [him]99-william with sniffs that it was the will of [the Lord]210-the lord , and entered into clinical details . [William]99-william sat down rather suddenly when [he]99-william realized that there would be [no one]204-no one in future to annex [his]99-william weekly earnings ; then , shocked by [his]99-william lack of filial feeling , [he]99-william endeavoured to produce an emotion more suited to the solemn occasion . Disconcerted by a want of success which [he]99-william feared was apparent to [[his]99-william audience]212-his audience , [he]99-william fidgeted , dry - eyed and awkward â€” and finally , all things considered , acted well and wisely by demanding to be left alone . To [his]99-william relief the demand was accepted as reasonable and proper in the first moments of [his]99-william grief ; [the sympathizer]213-the sympathizer withdrew , wiping [her]213-the sympathizer eyes â€” unnecessarily â€” and hoping that [God]101-god would support [him]99-william . [He]99-william locked the door stealthily and stared at [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother 's armchair ; [he]99-william was a little afraid of its emptiness , [he]99-william was also shocked and excited . [He]99-william knew instinctively that more was to happen , that life from now on would be something new and different .... The arm - chair was empty ; [the masterful little woman who had borne [him]99-william , slapped [him]99-william , managed [him]99-william and cowed [him]99-william]215-the masterful little woman who had borne him , slapped him , managed him and cowed him â€” [the masterful little woman]216-the masterful little woman was dead ! There was [no one]204-no one now to whom [he]99-william was accountable ; [no one of whom [he]99-william was afraid]218-no one of whom he was afraid .... [He]99-william walked on tiptoe round [the tiny room]219-the tiny room , feeling strangely and pleasantly alive . The next day increased the sense of [his]99-william new - found importance ; [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother had died rich , as [he]99-william and [she]190-his mother understood riches . [She]190-his mother had trusted [[her]190-his mother son]221-her son in nothing , not even with the knowledge of [her]190-his mother income , and after the stinting and scraping to which [she]190-his mother had accustomed [him]99-william [he]99-william was amazed to find [himself]99-william [master of a hundred and fifty pounds a year]222-master of a hundred and fifty pounds a year , the interest on capital gradually and carefully invested . In [his]99-william amazement â€” at first incredulous â€” [he]99-william trod on air , while [his]99-william mind wandered hazily over the glorious possibilities of opulent years to come ; the only alloy in [his]99-william otherwise supreme content being the necessity for preserving ( at least until the funeral was over ) a decent appearance of dejection . [He]99-william felt , too , the need of a friend in whom to confide , [some one of [his]99-william own age and standing before [whom it would not be needful to keep up the appearance of dejection]224-whom it would not be needful to keep up the appearance of dejection and who would not be shocked at the babblings of [his]99-william stirred and exultant soul]223-some one of his own age and standing before whom it would not be needful to keep up the appearance of dejection and who would not be shocked at the babblings of his stirred and exultant soul ; and it was this natural longing for [a confidant]225-a confidant which , on the day following [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother 's funeral , led to the beginning of [his]99-william friendship with [[his]99-william fellow - clerk]227-his fellow - clerk , [Faraday]100-faraday . [The head of [his]99-william department]228-the head of his department , meeting [him]99-william in [the passage]229-the passage , had said a few perfunctory and conventional words of condolence â€” whereto [William]99-william had muttered a sheepish " Thank [you]99-william , [sir]2833-sir , "[99-william] and escaped as soon as might be . [The familiar office]230-the familiar office after [his]99-william four days ' estrangement from [it]230-the familiar office affected [him]99-william curiously and unpleasantly ; [he]99-william felt [his]99-william newly - acquired sense of importance slipping gradually away from [him]99-william , felt [himself]99-william becoming once again [the underling and creature of routine]231-the underling and creature of routine â€” [the William Tully]99-william , obedient and painstaking , who had earned from [his]99-william childhood the favourable contempt of [[his]99-william superiors]232-his superiors . It was borne in on [him]99-william as the hours went by that it was not enough to accept good fortune â€” good fortune had to be made use of ; and [he]99-william began to make plans in an irregular , tentative fashion , biting the end of [his]99-william pen and neglecting [his]99-william work . Should [he]99-william chuck [the office]199-the office ? and if [he]99-william chucked it , what then ? ... Here imagination failed [him]99-william ; [his]99-william life had been so ordered , so bound down and directed by [others]234-others , that even [his]99-william desires were tamed to the wishes of [others]234-others and left to [himself]99-william [he]99-william could not tell what [he]99-william desired . The need for sympathy and guidance became imperative ; driving [him]99-william , when [the other occupants of the room]236-the other occupants of the room had departed for lunch , to unbosom [himself]99-william to [Faraday]100-faraday . In [his]99-william longing to talk [he]99-william would have addressed [himself]99-william almost to [any one]237-any one ; but on the whole , and in spite of an entire ignorance of [his]99-william habits and character , [he]99-william was glad it was [Faraday]100-faraday who was left behind to hear [him]99-william â€” [a newcomer , recently transferred from another branch and , as [William]99-william realized ( if only half - consciously ) like [himself]99-william regarded by [[their]239-their fellow - clerks]240-their fellow - clerks as a bit of [an outsider]241-an outsider]238-a newcomer , recently transferred from another branch and , as william realized ( if only half - consciously ) like himself regarded by their fellow - clerks as a bit of an outsider . [A sallow - faced young man]242-a sallow - faced young man , dark - haired and with large hazel eyes , [he]242-a sallow - faced young man was neatly garbed as became [an insurance clerk]243-an insurance clerk ; but there was a suggestion of discomfort about [his]242-a sallow - faced young man conventional neatness , just as there was a suggestion of effort about [his]242-a sallow - faced young man personal cleanliness . [He]242-a sallow - faced young man worked hard and steadily ; taking no part in the interludes of blithesome chat wherewith [[his]242-a sallow - faced young man companions]244-his companions enlivened [their]244-his companions hours of toil and appearing to be satisfied rather than annoyed by the knowledge of [his]242-a sallow - faced young man own isolation . [He]242-a sallow - faced young man had spoken to [William]99-william but two or three times and always in the way of business â€” nor was [his]242-a sallow - faced young man profile bent over a ledger particularly suggestive of sympathy ; [William]99-william 's emotions , however , had reached exploding - point , and the door had hardly closed behind the last of [[their]239-their fellows]245-their fellows when [he]99-william blurted out , " [I]99-william say , "[99-william] and [Faraday]100-faraday raised [his]100-faraday head . " [I]99-william say , "[99-william] [William]99-william blurted again , " did [you]100-faraday know â€” [[my]99-william mother]2834-my mother 's dead ? "[99-william] " Ah â€” yes , "[100-faraday] said [Faraday]100-faraday uncomfortably ; [he]100-faraday believed [he]100-faraday was being appealed to for sympathy , and fidgeted , clearing [his]100-faraday throat ; " [I]100-faraday â€” [I]100-faraday had heard it mentioned . " [Vindex "[99-william] of The Torch]102-vindex " of the torch sighed inwardly . [He]99-william was young , ambitious , fiercely in earnest and ever on the look - out for [his]99-william Chance ; and , the wish being father to the thought , [he]99-william had momentarily mistaken [William]99-william for an embodiment of [his]99-william Chance and dreamed dreams since the morning â€” dreams of [a comrade like - minded and willing to be led , whose newly - inherited riches might be used to endow a periodical that should preach a purer and more violent rebellion even than The Torch itself]262-a comrade like - minded and willing to be led , whose newly - inherited riches might be used to endow a periodical that should preach a purer and more violent rebellion even than the torch itself . With the aid of [William]99-william 's three pounds a week â€” magnified many times over in the eyes of [his]99-william eager mind â€” [he]99-william had seen [himself]99-william casting the hated insurance behind [him]99-william and devoting [himself]99-william heart and pen to the regeneration of the State and Race by means of the Class War . And lo!â€”as a couple more searching questions revealed to [him]99-william â€” in place of [a patron]263-a patron and [comrade]264-comrade was [a nervous little nincompoop]265-a nervous little nincompoop , bewildered at finding [himself]265-a nervous little nincompoop for the first time out of leading - strings , to whom a hundred and fifty a year was wealth untold and who had never so much as heard of the Class War ! For a moment [he]99-william was more than half inclined to be angry with [the nervous little nincompoop whose blundering , egoistic attempt at confidence had induced [him]99-william to believe that the secret of [his]99-william identity had been penetrated by [an ardent sympathizer]267-an ardent sympathizer . ( It was an open secret in " advanced "[99-william] circles , though carefully guarded in [the office]199-the office]266-the nervous little nincompoop whose blundering , egoistic attempt at confidence had induced him to believe that the secret of his identity had been penetrated by an ardent sympathizer . ( it was an open secret in " advanced " circles , though carefully guarded in the office . ) Then , more justly , [he]99-william softened , recognizing that the blunder was [his]99-william own , the mistake of [his]99-william own making â€” and , pitying [William]99-william 's dropped jaw and open confusion , poured [him]99-william out a whisky and endeavoured to set [him]99-william at [his]99-william ease . That evening in the company of [Faraday]100-faraday and [his]99-william first whisky was the turning - point in the career of [William Tully]99-william . [Any man stronger than [himself]99-william]269-any man stronger than himself could at that juncture in [his]99-william life have turned [him]99-william to right or left ; a push in the wrong direction would have made of [him]99-william an idler and [a wastrel]270-a wastrel , and fate was in a kindly mood when [she]271-she placed [him]99-william mentally and morally in charge of " Vindex "[271-she] of The Torch . [She]271-she might , as [her]271-she reckless way is , have handed over [his]99-william little soul to [some flamboyant rogue or expert in small vices]272-some flamboyant rogue or expert in small vices ; instead , [she]271-she laid it in the keeping of [a man who was clean - living , charged with unselfish enthusiasm and never consciously dishonest]273-a man who was clean - living , charged with unselfish enthusiasm and never consciously dishonest . The product of a Board School Scholarship and a fiercely energetic process of self - education ( prompted in part by the desire to excel those [he]99-william despised ) [Faraday]100-faraday , when [William]99-william made [his]99-william acquaintance , was beginning to realize some of [his]100-faraday cherished ambitions , beginning , in [certain Labour and Socialist circles]274-certain labour and socialist circles , to be treated as [a man of mark]275-a man of mark . [His]100-faraday pen was fluent as well as sarcastic , and if [his]100-faraday numerous contributions to the " rebel "[275-a man of mark] press had been paid for at ordinary rates [he]100-faraday would have been [a prosperous journalist]276-a prosperous journalist . It was somewhat of a shock to [William]99-william to discover on the top of the whisky that [[his]99-william new acquaintance]277-his new acquaintance was [a Socialist]278-a socialist ; but after the first and momentary shock [he]99-william swallowed the fact as [he]99-william had swallowed the alcohol â€” not because [he]99-william liked it , but because it was something [the narrow circle of [[his]99-william mother 's friends]280-his mother 's friends]279-the narrow circle of his mother 's friends would have heartily and loudly disapproved of . This reactionary and undutiful attitude of mind was not deliberate or conscious ; on the contrary , [he]99-william would certainly have been horrified to learn that it was the dominant factor in [his]99-william existence during the first few weeks of [his]99-william emancipation from maternal supervision and control â€” urging [him]99-william to drink deeply of [Faraday]100-faraday 's brand of Socialism as it urged [him]99-william to partake with unnecessary sumptuousness of the best that [Lyons]103-lyons could provide . [He]99-william acquired the taste for [Faraday]100-faraday 's political views more thoroughly and easily than the taste for [Faraday]100-faraday 's whisky . [The man]281-the man 's authoritative and easy manner , the manner which stood [him]281-the man in good stead with [[his]281-the man audiences]282-his audiences , of assuming ( quite honestly ) that [his]281-the man statements were proven facts which [no sane human being]283-no sane human being could dispute , would have made it impossible for [William]99-william to combat [his]99-william opinions even had [his]99-william limited reading and thinking supplied [him]99-william with material for the contest . [He]99-william was impressed with [Faraday]100-faraday 's erudition no less than with [Faraday]100-faraday 's manner ; and impressed still more when , later in the evening , [a colleague of The Torch]284-a colleague of the torch dropped in for a smoke and a chat . [The pair]285-the pair talked Labour and International movements with the careless ease of [connoisseurs]286-connoisseurs and bandied the names of [politicians]287-politicians contemptuously from mouth to mouth â€” [William]99-william sitting by in a silence dazed and awed , drinking in a language that attracted by its wild incomprehensibility and suggestion . [His]99-william mind was blank and virgin for the sowing of any seed ; and under [Faraday]100-faraday 's influence [his]99-william dull , half - torpid resentment against the restrictions , physical and mental , of [his]99-william hitherto narrow life became merged in a wider sympathy with the general discomfort , in an honest and fiery little passion for Justice , Right and Progress . That , of course , was not the affair of one evening 's talk ; but even the one evening 's talk sowed the seeds . [He]99-william went away from it uncomfortably conscious that as yet [he]99-william had lived solely for [himself]99-william , never troubling [his]99-william head concerning the evils that [men like [Faraday]100-faraday]288-men like faraday were fighting to overcome . The manner of [his]99-william future living was decided for [him]99-william when [he]99-william knocked at the door of [[Faraday]100-faraday 's Bloomsbury lodging]289-faraday 's bloomsbury lodging . [His]99-william simple and awed admiration for [[his]99-william new - found friend]290-his new - found friend and faith had in all probability more than a little to do with [Faraday]100-faraday 's readiness to allow the acquaintance to continue â€” even [a rebel prophet]291-a rebel prophet is not insensible to flattery . [William]99-william became for a time [[his]99-william satellite and [pupil]293-pupil]292-his satellite and pupil , [the admiring sharer of [his]99-william schemes]294-the admiring sharer of his schemes , of [his]99-william hatreds and laudable ambitions ; [he]99-william read [Faraday]100-faraday 's vehement articles and accepted each word and line . [His]99-william very blankness of mind made [him]99-william [an apt pupil]295-an apt pupil , and within a month of [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother 's death [he]99-william was living , out of office hours , in a whirl of semi - political agitation , attending meetings and cramming [his]99-william head with pamphlets . In three months more all [his]99-william hours were out - of - office hours ; in [his]99-william enthusiasm for [his]99-william new creed and interests [his]99-william neglect of [his]99-william professional duties had become so marked that [the manager]297-the manager , after one or two warnings , called [him]99-william into [[his]99-william room]298-his room for a solemn and last reprimand . As it happened , [Faraday]100-faraday , the night before , had confided to [William]99-william the news of [his]99-william approaching appointment to the post of [organizing secretary of [the Independent Socialist Party]300-the independent socialist party]299-organizing secretary of the independent socialist party , an appointment which would entail a speedy retirement from [his]99-william hated desk in [the City]301-the city . The news , naturally , had not increased the attraction of the office for [William]99-william , in whom the spirit of revolt had already fermented to some purpose ; thus , to the infinite surprise of [[his]99-william superiors]232-his superiors , who had known [him]99-william hitherto as [the meekest of [meek little clerks]304-meek little clerks]303-the meekest of meek little clerks , the threat of dismissal failing improvement was countered by a prompt resignation as truculent as [William]99-william could make it . In fact , in the exhilaration of the moment , [he]99-william treated [the astonished representative of capitalism]305-the astonished representative of capitalism to something in the nature of a speech â€” culled principally from the writings of " [Vindex]102-vindex " of the torch . "[99-william] From that day onwards [he]99-william devoted [himself]99-william to what [he]99-william termed public life â€” a ferment of protestation and grievance ; sometimes genuine , sometimes manufactured or , at least , artificially heightened . [He]99-william was [an extremist]306-an extremist , passionately well - intentioned and with all [the extremist]307-the extremist 's , contempt for [those who balance , see difficulties]308-those who balance , see difficulties and strive to give the other side its due . [He]99-william began by haunting meetings as [a listener]309-a listener and [a steward]310-a steward ; [Faraday]100-faraday 's meetings at first , then , as [his]99-william circle of acquaintance and interest widened , any sort of demonstration that promised a sufficiency of excitement in the form of invective . [The gentlest of creatures by nature and in private life]311-the gentlest of creatures by nature and in private life , [he]99-william grew to delight in denunciation , and under its ceaseless influence [the world]312-the world divided itself into two well - marked camps ; the good and enlightened who agreed with [him]99-william , and [the fools]313-the fools and [miscreants who did not .... In short ,]314-miscreants who did not .... in short , [he]99-william became [a politician]315-a politician . As [I]0-i have said , at the outset of [his]99-william career [he]99-william modestly confined [his]99-william energies to stewarding â€” to the sale of what [propagandist bodies]316-propagandist bodies insist on describing as " literature , "[316-propagandist bodies] the taking of tickets , ushering to seats and the like ; but in a short time ambition fired [him]99-william and the fighting spirit thereby engendered led [him]99-william to opposition meetings where , on [Faraday]100-faraday 's advice , [he]99-william tried heckling [the enemy speakers]317-the enemy speakers . [His]99-william first and flustered attempts were not over - successful , but , sustained by revolutionary enthusiasm , [he]99-william refused to be crushed by failure and accompanying jeers and held doggedly on to [his]99-william purpose . Repeated efforts brought [their]318-their measure of success , and [he]99-william began to be marked by [[his]99-william comrades]202-his comrades as [a willing and valuable member]320-a willing and valuable member . Within a year , [he]99-william had found [his]99-william feet and was [a busy and full - blown speaker â€” of the species that can be relied on to turn on , at any moment , a glib , excited stream of partisan fact and sentiment]321-a busy and full - blown speaker â€” of the species that can be relied on to turn on , at any moment , a glib , excited stream of partisan fact and sentiment . [His]99-william services were in constant demand , since [he]99-william spoke for anything and everything â€” provided only [the promoters of the meeting]322-the promoters of the meeting were sufficiently violent in [their]322-the promoters of the meeting efforts to upset the prevailing order . [He]99-william had developed and was pleased with [himself]99-william ; [Faraday]100-faraday , though still [a great man in [his]99-william eyes]323-a great man in his eyes , was more of [an equal than an idol]324-an equal than an idol . [He]99-william was wonderfully happy in [his]99-william new , unrestful existence ; it was not only that [he]99-william knew [he]99-william was doing great good and that applause uplifted [him]99-william and went to [his]99-william head like wine ; as [a member of [an organization]326-an organization]325-a member of an organization and swayed by its collective passion , [he]99-william attained to , and was conscious of , an emotional ( and , as [he]99-william thought , intellectual ) activity of which as [an individual]327-an individual [he]99-william would have been entirely incapable . As [a deceased statesman]328-a deceased statesman was intoxicated with the exuberance of [his]99-william own verbosity , so [William]99-william was intoxicated with the exuberance of [his]99-william own emotions . There were moments when [he]99-william looked back on [his]99-william old life and could hardly believe [he]99-william was [the same [William Tully]99-william who once , without thought of the Social Revolution , went daily from [Camberwell]2-camberwell to [the City]301-the city and back from [the City]301-the city to [Camberwell]2-camberwell]329-the same william tully who once , without thought of the social revolution , went daily from camberwell to the city and back from the city to camberwell .... As time went on , [he]99-william was entrusted with " campaigns "[99-william] and the stirring up of revolt ; and it was a proud day for [him]99-william when a Conservative evening paper , in connection with [his]99-william share in a mining agitation , referred to [him]99-william as [a dangerous man]332-a dangerous man . [He]99-william wondered , with pity for [her]333-her blindness , what [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother would have thought if [any one]237-any one had told [her]333-her in [her]333-her lifetime that [[her]333-her son]221-her son would turn out dangerous . As a matter of course [he]99-william was [a supporter of votes for [women]338-women]337-a supporter of votes for women ; [an adherent ( equally as a matter of course ) of the movement]339-an adherent ( equally as a matter of course ) of the movement in its noisiest and most intolerant form . [He]99-william signed petitions denouncing forcible feeding and attended meetings advocating civil war , where [the civil warriors]340-the civil warriors complained with bitterness that the other side had hit [them]340-the civil warriors back ; and [his]99-william contempt for the less virulent form of suffragist was as great as [his]99-william contempt for [the Home Secretary]341-the home secretary and [the orthodox members of [the Labour Party]5-the labour party]342-the orthodox members of the labour party . It was at one of these meetings , in December 1913 , that [he]99-william met [Griselda Watkins]104-griselda . [Griselda Watkins]104-griselda , then a little under twenty - five , was [his]99-william exact counterpart in petticoats ; [a piece of blank - minded , suburban young - womanhood caught into the militant suffrage movement]343-a piece of blank - minded , suburban young - womanhood caught into the militant suffrage movement and enjoying [herself]104-griselda therein . [She]104-griselda was inclined to plumpness , had a fresh complexion , a mouth slightly ajar and suggestive of adenoids , and the satisfied expression which comes from a spirit at rest . Like [William]99-william , [she]104-griselda had found peace of mind and perennial interest in the hearty denunciation of [those who did not agree with [her]104-griselda]344-those who did not agree with her . On the night when [William]99-william first saw [her]104-griselda [she]104-griselda wore , as [a steward]310-a steward , a white dress , a sash with the colours of [her]104-griselda association and a badge denoting that [she]104-griselda had suffered for the Cause in [Holloway]6-holloway . [Her]104-griselda manner was eminently self - conscious and assured , but at the same time almost ostentatiously gracious and womanly ; it was the policy of [her]104-griselda particular branch of the suffrage movement to repress manifestations of the masculine type in [[its]346-its members]347-its members and encourage fluffiness of garb and appeal of manner . [Griselda]104-griselda , who had a natural weakness for cheap finery , was [a warm adherent of the policy]348-a warm adherent of the policy , went out window - smashing in a picture - hat and cultivated ladylike charm . [She]104-griselda introduced [herself]104-griselda to [William]99-william after the meeting with a compliment on [his]99-william speech , which had been fiery enough even for [her]104-griselda ; [they]349-they both considered the compliment graceful and for a few minutes exchanged sympathetic platitudes on martyrdom , civil war and the scoundrelly behaviour of [the Government]350-the government . Even in those first few minutes [they]349-they were conscious of attraction for [each other]351-each other and pleased to discover , in the course of [their]349-they talk , that [they]349-they should meet again next week on [another militant platform]352-another militant platform . [They]349-they met and re - met â€” at first only on [platforms]353-platforms , afterwards more privately and pleasantly . [William]99-william , when [his]99-william own meetings did not claim [him]99-william , took to following [Griselda]104-griselda about to [hers]104-griselda , that [he]99-william might listen entranced to the words of enthusiastic abuse that flowed from [her]104-griselda confident lips ; [he]99-william had heard them all before and from [speakers]354-speakers as confident , but never before had [they]354-speakers seemed so inspired and inspiring , never before had [he]99-william desired with trembling to kiss the lips that uttered them . [Griselda]104-griselda , touched as [a woman]355-a woman and flattered as [an orator]356-an orator by [his]99-william persistent presence in [her]104-griselda audience , invited [him]99-william to tea at [[[her]104-griselda aunt]357-her aunt 's house in [Balham]7-balham]358-her aunt 's house in balham ; the visit was a success , and from that evening ( in early March ) the end was a foregone conclusion . [Their]359-they friendship ripened so fast that one night at the beginning of April ( 1914 ) [William]99-william , escorting [her]104-griselda [home]247-home from a meeting , proposed to [her]104-griselda on the top of [an otherwise empty ' bus]361-an otherwise empty ' bus , and was duly and sweetly accepted . There were none of the customary obstacles in the way of [the happy pair]362-the happy pair â€” on the contrary , all was plain sailing . [William]99-william 's original income had for some years been augmented by [his]99-william earnings as [a speaker]363-a speaker , and [[Griselda]104-griselda 's parents]364-griselda 's parents had left [her]104-griselda modestly provided for . [[Her]104-griselda aunt]357-her aunt , long since converted to the Movement ( to the extent of being unable to talk of anything but forcible feeding ) , smiled blessings on so suitable a match and proceeded to consider the trousseau ; and after a little persuasion on part the wedding was fixed for July . The mating of [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda might be called an ideal mating ; [theirs]359-they were indeed two hearts that beat as one . With each day [they]359-they were happier in [each other]351-each other 's company ; [their]359-they minds as it were flowed together and intermingled joyously â€” minds so alike and akin that it would have been difficult , without hearing the voice that spoke it , to distinguish an utterance of [Griselda]104-griselda from an idea formulated by [William]99-william . [Their]359-they prominent blue eyes â€” [they]359-they both had prominent blue eyes â€” looked out upon [the world]312-the world from exactly the same point of view ; and as [they]359-they had been trained by the same influences and were incapable of forming an independent judgment , it would not have been easy to find cause of disagreement between [them]359-they . There are [men]368-men and [women]338-women not [a few who find [their]370-a few who find their complement in their contrast complement in [their]370-a few who find their complement in their contrast contrast]370-a few who find their complement in their contrast ; but of such were not [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda . [Their]359-they standard of conduct was rigid and [their]359-they views were pronounced ; those who did not share [their]359-they views and act in conformity with [their]359-they standards were outside the pale of [their]359-they liking . And this not because [they]359-they were abnormally or essentially uncharitable , but because [they]359-they had lived for so long less as [individuals]371-individuals than as [members of organizations]372-members of organizations â€” a form of existence which will end by sucking charity out of the sweetest heart alive . It was well for [them]359-they , therefore , that [their]359-they creed , like [their]359-they code of manners and morals , was identical or practically identical . It was a simple creed and [they]359-they held to it loyally and faithfully . [They]359-they believed in a large , vague and beautifully undefined identity , called by [William the People]99-william , and by [Griselda]104-griselda , [Woman]373-woman ; who in the time to come was to accomplish much beautiful and undefined Good ; and in whose service [they]359-they were prepared meanwhile to suffer any amount of obloquy and talk any amount of nonsense . [They]359-they believed that Society could be straightened and set right by the well - meaning efforts of [well - meaning souls like [themselves]359-they]374-well - meaning souls like themselves â€” aided by [the Ballot]106-the ballot , the Voice of [the People]375-the people , and [Woman]373-woman . [They]359-they believed , in defiance of the teachings of history , that Democracy is another word for peace and goodwill towards [men]368-men . [They]359-they believed ( quite rightly ) in the purity of [their]359-they own intentions ; and concluded ( quite wrongly ) that the intentions of [all persons who did not agree with [them]359-they]378-all persons who did not agree with them must therefore be evil and impure .... [They]359-they were , in short , [very honest and devout sectarians]379-very honest and devout sectarians â€” cocksure , contemptuous , intolerant , self - sacrificing after the manner of [their]359-they kind . [They]359-they held , as [I]0-i have said , to [their]359-they own opinions strongly and would have died rather than renounce , or seem to renounce , [them]380-them â€” which did not restrain [them]359-they from resenting the same attitude of mind and heart in [others]234-others . What in [themselves]359-they [they]359-they admired as loyalty , [they]359-they denounced in [others]234-others as interested and malignant stubbornness . More â€” it did not prevent [them]359-they from disliking and despising [many excellent persons whose opinions , if analysed , would have proved nearly akin to [their]359-they own]383-many excellent persons whose opinions , if analysed , would have proved nearly akin to their own . [William]99-william , for instance , would all but foam at the mouth when compulsory service in [the army]384-the army was the subject of conversation , and " militarism , "[99-william] to [him]99-william , was the blackest of all the works of the devil ; but [he]99-william was bitter , and violently bitter , against [the blackleg who objected to compulsory service in [a Trade Union]386-a trade union]385-the blackleg who objected to compulsory service in a trade union , and had spoken , times without number , in hearty encouragement of that form of siege warfare which is commonly known as a Strike . [He]99-william was [a pacifist of the type which seeks peace and ensues it]387-a pacifist of the type which seeks peace and ensues it by insisting firmly , and even to blood , that it is the other side 's duty to give way . [Griselda]104-griselda also was [a pacifist]388-a pacifist â€” when it suited [her]104-griselda and when [she]104-griselda had got [her]104-griselda way . [She]104-griselda believed in a future World - Amity , brought about chiefly by [Woman]107-woman ; meanwhile , [she]104-griselda exulted loudly and frequently in the fighting qualities of [her]104-griselda sex . Like [William]99-william , [she]104-griselda had no quarrel with [Continental nations]389-continental nations ; on the contrary , what [she]104-griselda had seen of [Continental nations]389-continental nations during a fortnight 's stay at [Interlaken]8-interlaken had inclined [her]104-griselda to look on [them]389-continental nations with favour . Like [William]99-william , [her]104-griselda combatant instincts were concentrated on antagonists nearer [home]247-home ; [she]104-griselda knew [them]392-them better and therefore disliked [them]392-them more . It is a mistake to suppose that either nations or [individuals]371-individuals will necessarily like [the people [they]395-they see most of]394-the people they see most of ; if [you]396-you must know [a man]397-a man in order to love [him]397-a man , [you]396-you seldom hate [a man with whom [you]396-you have not acquaintance]398-a man with whom you have not acquaintance . Nothing could have been more ideally peaceful than the relations of [China]9-china and [England]10-england during the Middle Ages â€” for the simple reason that [China]9-china and [England]10-england knew absolutely nothing of [each other]351-each other . In the same way , if in a lesser degree , [Griselda]104-griselda and [William]99-william had a friendly feeling for [Germany]11-germany and [the German people]400-the german people . [They]401-they had never been to [Germany]11-germany and knew nothing of [her]11-germany history or politics ; but [they]401-they had heard of [the Germans]108-the germans as [intelligent people addicted to spectacles , beer and sonatas]402-intelligent people addicted to spectacles , beer and sonatas , and established on [the banks of [the Rhine]12-the rhine]403-the banks of the rhine . And â€” [the Rhine]12-the rhine being some way off â€” [they]401-they liked [them]108-the germans . As [internationalists]404-internationalists [they]401-they had no words too strong for standing armies and [their]401-they methods ; but upon military operations against [domestic tyrants]405-domestic tyrants [they]401-they looked with less disapproval . There existed , [I]0-i believe , in the back of [their]401-they minds some ill - defined distinction between bloodshed perpetrated by [persons clad in uniform]406-persons clad in uniform and by [persons not so clad]407-persons not so clad â€” between fighting with bayonets and fighting with [bombs and brickbats]408-bombs and brickbats . [The one]409-the one was militarism and unjustifiable ; [the other heroism and holy]410-the other heroism and holy . Had [you]411-you been unkind enough to pen [them]401-they into a corner and force [them]401-they to acknowledge that there are [many born warriors out of khaki]412-many born warriors out of khaki , [they]401-they would have ended probably by declaring that [one]413-one should take arms only against tyranny and in a righteous cause â€” and so have found [themselves]401-they in entire agreement not only with [[their]401-they adversary]414-their adversary but with [the Tory Party]415-the tory party , [the German Emperor]416-the german emperor , [the professional soldier]417-the professional soldier and [poor humanity in general]418-poor humanity in general . [The elect]419-the elect , when one comes to examine [them]419-the elect , are not always so very elect . The difficulty would have been to persuade [them]419-the elect that there could be two opinions concerning a cause [they]419-the elect espoused ; [their]419-the elect little vision was as narrow as it was pure , and [their]419-the elect little minds were so seldom exhausted by thinking . Apostles of the reign of [Woman]107-woman and of International Amity , [they]419-the elect might have been summed up as the perfect type of [aggressor]420-aggressor . With regard to what used to be called culture ( before August 1914 ) , the attainments of [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda were very much on a level . [They]419-the elect read newspapers written by [persons who wholly agreed with [their]419-the elect views]421-persons who wholly agreed with their views ; [they]419-the elect read pamphlets issued , and books recommended , by societies of which [they]419-the elect were members . From these [they]419-the elect quoted , in public and imposingly , with absolute faith in [their]419-the elect statements . Of history and science , of literature and art , [they]419-the elect knew nothing , or next to nothing ; and , [their]419-the elect ignorance being mutual , neither bored [the other]246-the other by straying away from the subjects in which [both were interested ....]423-both were interested .... As [I]0-i have said , [their]419-the elect mating was an ideal mating . The period of [their]419-the elect engagement was not without its beauty ; an ever - present consciousness of [their]419-the elect mission to [mankind]424-mankind did not prevent [them]419-the elect from being blissful as [loving young couples]425-loving young couples are blissful â€” it merely coloured [their]419-the elect relations and spiritualized [them]419-the elect . One evening , not long before [their]419-the elect wedding , [they]419-the elect sat together in [Battersea Park]13-battersea park on a bench and dedicated [their]419-the elect mutual lives to the service of Progress and [Humanity]109-humanity . [They]419-the elect had invented a suitable formula for the occasion and repeated it softly , one after the other , holding [each other]351-each other 's hands . [Griselda]104-griselda 's voice trembled as [she]104-griselda vowed , in semi - ecclesiastical phraseology , that not even [her]104-griselda great love for [William]99-william should wean [her]104-griselda from [her]104-griselda life 's work ; and [William]99-william 's voice shook back as [he]99-william vowed in [his]99-william turn that not even [Griselda]104-griselda , [the woman of [his]99-william dreams]427-the woman of his dreams , should make [him]99-william neglectful of the call of Mankind and [his]99-william duty to the holiest of causes . It was a very solemn little moment ; [man]428-man and [woman]373-woman , [affianced lovers]430-affianced lovers , [they]419-the elect dedicated [themselves]419-the elect to [their]419-the elect mission , the uplifting of [the human race]431-the human race . [They]419-the elect were spared the doubts which would have assailed wiser heads as to the manner of accomplishing [their]419-the elect mission ; and as [they]419-the elect sat side by side on the bench , with [their]419-the elect hands clasped , [they]419-the elect knew [themselves]419-the elect for acceptable types and forerunners of [the world]312-the world [they]419-the elect were helping to create .... Man and [Woman]373-woman , side by side , vowed to service . " [We]419-the elect shall never forget this evening , "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda whispered as the sun dipped down in glory . " In all [our]419-the elect lives there can be nothing more beautiful than this . "[104-griselda] [She]104-griselda was right ; the two best gifts of life are love and an approving conscience . These twain , [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda , loved [each other]351-each other sincerely â€” if not with the tempestuous passion of [a Romeo]435-a romeo and [a Juliet]436-a juliet , with an honest and healthy affection ; [they]419-the elect had for [each other]351-each other an attraction which could set [their]419-the elect pulses beating and start [them]419-the elect dreaming dreams . That evening , on the bench in [Battersea Park]13-battersea park , [they]419-the elect had dreamed [their]419-the elect dreams â€” while [their]419-the elect consciences looked on and smiled . [They]419-the elect foreshadowed [[their]419-the elect home]438-their home not only as [a nest where [[they]419-the elect two]440-they two and [[their]419-the elect children]441-their children should dwell , but as a centre of light and duty â€” as [they]419-the elect understood duty and light ; a meeting - place for [the like - minded]442-the like - minded , where fresh courage could be gathered for the strife with prejudice and evil]439-a nest where they two and their children should dwell , but as a centre of light and duty â€” as they understood duty and light ; a meeting - place for the like - minded , where fresh courage could be gathered for the strife with prejudice and evil . [They]419-the elect pictured [themselves]419-the elect ( this was in June 1914 ) as what [they]419-the elect would have called Powers â€” as [a man]397-a man and [a woman working for progress]444-a woman working for progress and destined to leave [their]419-the elect mark . The sense of [their]419-the elect destiny awed and elated [them]419-the elect â€” and [they]419-the elect walked away from [Battersea Park]13-battersea park with [their]419-the elect hearts too full for speech . On the way [home]247-home a flaring headline distracted [Griselda]104-griselda temporarily from [her]104-griselda dreams . " Who 's [this Archduke]2846-this archduke that 's been assassinated ? "[104-griselda] [she]104-griselda asked . ( [Her]104-griselda morning 's reading had been confined to [The Suffragette]446-the suffragette . ) " [Austrian]110-austrian , "[99-william] [William]99-william informed [her]104-griselda . " [I]104-griselda shall go to the meeting to - morrow , "[104-griselda] [she]104-griselda announced , " and make [my]104-griselda protest . [She]104-griselda was as good as [her]104-griselda word , and the next night saw [him]99-william in [[a Cabinet Minister]450-a cabinet minister 's audience]451-a cabinet minister 's audience . From [his]99-william seat in [the arena]452-the arena ( [their]449-their seats were not together and [the pair]285-the pair had entered separately ) [his]99-william eye sought for [Griselda]104-griselda and found [her]104-griselda easily in the first row of [the balcony]454-the balcony â€” most obviously composed and with [her]104-griselda gloved hands folded on the rail . [She]104-griselda was dressed in pale blue , with a flowered toque perched on [her]104-griselda head ; [her]104-griselda blue silk blouse , in view of possibilities , was firmly connected by safety - pins with the belt of [her]104-griselda blue cloth skirt , and [her]104-griselda hair secured more tightly than usual by an extra allowance of combs . Previous experience had taught [her]104-griselda the wisdom of these measures . As usual , in accordance with the tradition of [her]104-griselda party , [she]104-griselda had insisted in [her]104-griselda costume on the ultra - feminine note ; [her]104-griselda blouse savoured of Liberty and there was a cluster of rosebuds at [her]104-griselda breast . [She]104-griselda was breathing quickly , so [her]104-griselda mouth was more open than usual ; otherwise [she]104-griselda gave no sign of mental or physical trepidation â€” save a studied indifference which might have betrayed [her]104-griselda to an eye sufficiently acute . To [William]99-william [she]104-griselda looked adorable and [his]99-william heart swelled with admiration of [her]104-griselda courage and determination to sustain [her]104-griselda in [her]104-griselda protest to the uttermost ; [he]99-william vowed to [himself]99-william to be worthy of [such a mate]455-such a mate . [He]99-william did [his]99-william best to prove [himself]99-william worthy when the critical moment came . [He]99-william waited for that moment during more than three - quarters of an hour â€” for [Griselda]104-griselda was not without confederates , and [three ladies in picture hats]456-three ladies in picture hats and [a gentleman in the garb of [a Nonconformist minister]458-a nonconformist minister]457-a gentleman in the garb of a nonconformist minister had arisen at intervals to make the running before [her]104-griselda voice rang out . All were suppressed , though not without excitement ; [two of [the ladies]460-the ladies]459-two of the ladies parted with [their]459-two of the ladies hats and [the clergyman]461-the clergyman broke a chair . [A man with a steward]466-a man with a steward 's rosette in [his]466-a man with a steward coat was stationed in the gangway close to [William]99-william ; and as the laughter the jest had provoked died away , [he]466-a man with a steward swore under [his]466-a man with a steward breath , " By [God]101-god , there 's another in [the balcony]454-the balcony ! " [Mr. Chairman]113-mr. chairman , [I]104-griselda rise to protest against [the speaker]464-the speaker 's gross insult to [the noble women who â€”]2850-the noble women who â€” â€” "[104-griselda] [A man in the seat behind]468-a man in the seat behind clapped [his]468-a man in the seat behind hands on [her]104-griselda shoulders and rammed [her]104-griselda back into [her]104-griselda chair â€” where [she]104-griselda writhed vigorously , calling [him]468-a man in the seat behind coward and demanding how [he]468-a man in the seat behind dared ! [His]468-a man in the seat behind grip , sufficiently hard to be unpleasant , roused [her]104-griselda fighting instincts and gave a fillip to [her]104-griselda conscientious protest ; in contact with actual , if not painful , personal violence , [she]104-griselda found it easier to scream , hit out and struggle . [Two stewards]469-two stewards , starting from either end of the row of chairs , were wedging [themselves]469-two stewards towards [her]104-griselda ; [she]104-griselda clung to [her]104-griselda seat with fingers and toes , and shrieked a regulation formula which the meeting drowned in opprobrium . Conscious of rectitude , the jeers and hoots but encouraged [her]104-griselda and fired [her]104-griselda blood ; and when [her]104-griselda hands were wrenched from their hold on the chair [she]104-griselda clung and clawed to the shoulder of [[her]104-griselda next - door neighbour]470-her next - door neighbour â€” [a stout and orthodox Liberal who thrust [her]104-griselda from [him]471-a stout and orthodox liberal who thrust her from him]471-a stout and orthodox liberal who thrust her from him , snorting indignation . [They]497-the warriors were married towards the end of July â€” to be exact , on the twenty - third day of the month . The wedding took place in [Balham]7-balham from [the house of [[Griselda]104-griselda 's aunt]504-griselda 's aunt]503-the house of griselda 's aunt ; the ceremony was performed by [an enlightened vicar who had consented to omit the ignoble vow of obedience]505-an enlightened vicar who had consented to omit the ignoble vow of obedience ; and [the church]506-the church was thronged to [its]506-the church doors with [comrades]507-comrades and [ardent sympathizers]508-ardent sympathizers . The advanced Press spread itself over the description of the ceremony and â€” in view of the fact that [the bridesmaids]509-the bridesmaids , six in number , had all done time for assault â€” even the Press that was not advanced considered the event worth a paragraph . [The pair]285-the pair were snapshotted on leaving [the church]506-the church with the customary direful results , and [the modest residence of [[Griselda]104-griselda 's aunt]504-griselda 's aunt]512-the modest residence of griselda 's aunt could hardly accommodate the flood of [progressive guests]514-progressive guests . There was rice and slipper - throwing and a whirl of good wishes â€” and [Griselda]104-griselda , flushed , looked pretty , and in [William]99-william 's eyes quite lovely . [They]497-the warriors left by [an afternoon train]515-an afternoon train for [Dover]15-dover and crossed the next day to [Ostend]16-ostend . [Their]497-the warriors selection of the Belgian [Ardennes]17-ardennes for a honeymoon was due to [Griselda]104-griselda 's long - standing acquaintance with [a cosmopolitan female revolutionist understood to be of Russian Polish extraction]516-a cosmopolitan female revolutionist understood to be of russian polish extraction . Owing , it was further understood , to [her]104-griselda pronounced opinions and pronounced manner of expressing them , [she]104-griselda had long ceased to be welcome in [the land that gave]517-the land that gave [her]104-griselda birth ; at any rate , [she]104-griselda avoided it studiously and existed chiefly at a series of epoch - making revolutionary meetings which [she]104-griselda addressed by turns in bad German , worse French , and worst English . [She]104-griselda wrote vehement pamphlets in all these languages and prided [herself]104-griselda on the fact that , on [the Continent]18-the continent at least , they were frequently suppressed by [the police]518-the police ; wore tartan blouses , a perennial smile , and a hat that was always askew . For some reason or another [she]104-griselda was the possessor of [a cottage in [the heart of [the Belgian Ardennes]19-the belgian ardennes]520-the heart of the belgian ardennes â€” which [she]104-griselda visited on the rare occasions when [she]104-griselda was not plying [her]104-griselda epoch - making activities in [London]1-london , [Vienna]20-vienna , or [New York]21-new york]519-a cottage in the heart of the belgian ardennes â€” which she visited on the rare occasions when she was not plying her epoch - making activities in london , vienna , or new york . A week once a year was about all the use [she]104-griselda made of it â€” reappearing after [her]104-griselda seven days ' seclusion with a brace of new pamphlets burning for the Press , and like a giant refreshed for the fight . [This estimable woman]521-this estimable woman was as good - natured as [she]104-griselda was revolutionary , and hearing that [Griselda]104-griselda was thinking of [a rural honeymoon]522-a rural honeymoon , [she]104-griselda hastened to offer [the happy couple]523-the happy couple the loan of [[her]104-griselda Belgian property]524-her belgian property , which was as secluded as heart could desire . [Griselda]104-griselda , since [her]104-griselda fortnight at [Interlaken]8-interlaken , had hankered for another stay abroad ; [she]104-griselda jumped at the offer , and [William]99-william â€” whose acquaintance with foreign parts was limited to an International Socialist Congress in Hollandâ€”-jumped gladly in unison with [her]104-griselda . [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg beamed with joy at [their]523-the happy couple delighted acceptance of [her]104-griselda offer ; [she]114-madame amberg kissed [Griselda]104-griselda , shook hands with [William]99-william and promised to make all the necessary arrangements for [their]523-the happy couple stay â€” to write to [the old woman who looked after [the cottage]526-the cottage and tell [her]114-madame amberg when to expect [them]523-the happy couple]525-the old woman who looked after the cottage and tell her when to expect them . [She]114-madame amberg babbled rhapsodically of honeymoons and the joys of [the Forest of]22-the forest of [Arden]23-arden â€” forgetting how bored [she]114-madame amberg was in [the Forest of]22-the forest of [Arden]23-arden at the end of a seven - days ' stay [there]527-there â€” and further directed [them]523-the happy couple how to reach [it]526-the cottage , looked out trains and suggested [hotels]528-hotels . [Heaven]115-heaven smiled on the opening of [their]523-the happy couple married life ; [Dover]15-dover was [a receding beauty in the distance]529-a receding beauty in the distance and [the Channel]530-the channel [a good - natured lake]531-a good - natured lake . As [[their]523-the happy couple boat]532-their boat chunked between [the long piers of [Ostend]16-ostend]533-the long piers of ostend [they]523-the happy couple held and squeezed [each other]351-each other 's hands ecstatically , the crowd collecting on the gangway side enabling [them]523-the happy couple to do so unnoticed . The consciousness of [their]523-the happy couple total ignorance of the language of [the country]535-the country gave [them]523-the happy couple an agitated moment as [they]523-the happy couple set foot on [foreign soil]536-foreign soil â€” but , taken in tow by [a polyglot porter]537-a polyglot porter , [they]523-the happy couple were safely transferred from [the quay]538-the quay to [a second - class carriage]539-a second - class carriage , with instructions to change at [Brussels]24-brussels ; and , having changed obediently , were in due course set down at [Namur]25-namur . [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg had advised [them]523-the happy couple to lodge with economy at [the Hotel de Hollande]540-the hotel de hollande near [the station]541-the station ; but [another specimen of [the polyglot porter]543-the polyglot porter]542-another specimen of the polyglot porter pounced down and annexed [them]523-the happy couple firmly for [[his]542-another specimen of the polyglot porter own more distant establishment]544-his own more distant establishment , and after a feeble resistance [they]523-the happy couple followed [him]542-another specimen of the polyglot porter meekly and were thrust with [their]523-the happy couple bags into [the omnibus]545-the omnibus lying in wait for [them]523-the happy couple . [They]523-the happy couple felt it [their]523-the happy couple duty as [the vehicle]492-the vehicle rattled [them]523-the happy couple along to make a few depreciatory and high - principled remarks on the subject of [the towering fortifications]547-the towering fortifications ; but having thus satisfied [their]523-the happy couple consciences [they]523-the happy couple relapsed into mere enjoyment of rest , novelty , a good dinner , and a view of [the lazy Meuse]30-the meuse . After dinner , when [the fortress above [them]523-the happy couple]548-the fortress above them was fading into the soft blackness of a warm summer night , [they]523-the happy couple walked arm - in - arm by [the river]549-the river and were quite unutterably happy . [They]523-the happy couple rose early in the morning to catch [the little river boat for [Dinant]27-dinant]550-the little river boat for dinant ; caught it with the aid of [[their]523-the happy couple guardian]551-their guardian , [the porter]552-the porter , and camped side by side on [its]550-the little river boat for dinant deck to enjoy the sauntering trip . [They]523-the happy couple enjoyed it so much and engrossingly that for the space of a morning [they]523-the happy couple forgot [their]523-the happy couple high principles , [they]523-the happy couple forgot even [Woman]373-woman and [Democracy]116-democracy ; [they]523-the happy couple were [tourists]554-tourists only , agape and delighted , with [their]523-the happy couple green Cook 's tickets in [their]523-the happy couple pockets . Yet , after all , [they]523-the happy couple were something more than [tourists]554-tourists ; [they]523-the happy couple were [young man]556-young man and woman who loved [each other tenderly and whose happy lives were in tune with the happy landscape]557-each other tenderly and whose happy lives were in tune with the happy landscape . Often [they]523-the happy couple forgot to look at [the happy landscape]558-the happy landscape for the joy of gazing into [each other]351-each other 's dear blue eyes . [The boat]560-the boat puffed finally to [Dinant]27-dinant , where [they]523-the happy couple stayed the night as planned ; where [they]523-the happy couple stared at [the cupola'd church]561-the cupola'd church and [the cliffs]562-the cliffs , walked to the split rock on [the road to [Anseremme]28-anseremme]563-the road to anseremme , and bought some of the gingerbread [their]523-the happy couple guide - book had told [them]523-the happy couple to buy . [They]523-the happy couple ate it next day , with no particular approval , on the final stage of [their]523-the happy couple journey , in [a train]564-a train that puffed and pottered between heights and orchards in the winding company of [a stream]565-a stream . It puffed and pottered [them]523-the happy couple at last to [[their]523-the happy couple wayside destination]566-their wayside destination â€” where [a smiling and loutish country boy]567-a smiling and loutish country boy slouched up to take possession of [them]523-the happy couple and [their]523-the happy couple modest baggage . [They]523-the happy couple understood not a word of [his]567-a smiling and loutish country boy thick - throated patois , but knew from information imparted beforehand by [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg that this was [[[their]523-the happy couple housekeeper]568-their housekeeper 's grandson and deputed to serve as [[their]523-the happy couple guide]570-their guide]569-their housekeeper 's grandson and deputed to serve as their guide . [He]567-a smiling and loutish country boy gripped a bag easily in either hand , and led the way past [the few small houses]571-the few small houses ranged neatly as [a miniature village]572-a miniature village alongside [the miniature station]573-the miniature station â€” and so by [the white road that kept the river company]574-the white road that kept the river company . After a mile or thereabout [they]523-the happy couple left [the white road]575-the white road , turning sharply to the right at [a cleft in the riverside cliff]576-a cleft in the riverside cliff and striking [a cart - track]577-a cart - track , scarcely more than a path , into [a valley twisted back among the hills]578-a valley twisted back among the hills . It was [a valley the like of which [they]523-the happy couple had never seen , which [the world]312-the world seemed to have forgotten]579-a valley the like of which they had never seen , which the world seemed to have forgotten ; a cool green vision of summer and solitary peace . [Water]29-water had cleft in [the table - land]581-the table - land above [them]523-the happy couple a passage that time had made leafy and gracious and laid aside for [their]523-the happy couple finding . Through the flat , lush pastures that divided the bold slopes there looped and tangled [a tiny brook on [its]582-a tiny brook on its way to the meuse and the sea way to [the Meuse]30-the meuse and [the sea]583-the sea]582-a tiny brook on its way to the meuse and the sea , a winding ribbon of shadow , of shimmer and reflection . Up the slopes rising steeply from [the pastures]584-the pastures there clustered tree above tree â€” so thickly set that where [the valley]585-the valley dwindled in the distance [they]523-the happy couple might have been moss on [the hill - side]586-the hill - side . There was [no one in sight]587-no one in sight and no sound but [their]523-the happy couple footsteps and the birds ; it was all a green prettiness given over to birds and [themselves]523-the happy couple . " Is n't it wonderful ? "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda said , not knowing that [her]104-griselda voice had dropped and lost its shrillness . " [I]104-griselda never thought there could be such a place . "[104-griselda] [She]104-griselda spoke the truth , if in hackneyed and unthinking phrase ; in [her]104-griselda busy and crowded little mind , the reflection of [her]104-griselda busy little life , there had been no room for visions of a deep and solitary peace . Involuntarily , as [they]523-the happy couple walked [they]523-the happy couple drew nearer together and went closely side by side ; the sweet aloofness of [the valley]585-the valley not only amazed [them]523-the happy couple , it awed [them]523-the happy couple ; [they]523-the happy couple were dimly conscious of being in contact with something which in its silent , gracious way was disquieting as well as beautiful . [Their]523-the happy couple theory and practice of life , so far , was the theory and practice of [their]523-the happy couple purely urban environment , of [crowds]589-crowds , committees and grievances and [cocksure little people like [themselves]523-the happy couple]590-cocksure little people like themselves â€” and lo , out of an atmosphere of cocksureness and hustle [they]523-the happy couple had stepped , as it seemed without warning , into one of mystery and the endless patience of [the earth]591-the earth . Out here , in this strange overpowering peace , it was difficult to be conscious of grievances political or ethical ; instead came a new , undefined and uneasy sense of personal inadequacy and shrinkage , a sense of the unknown and hitherto unallowed - for , a fear of something undreamed of in [their]523-the happy couple rabid and second - hand philosophy .... Not that [they]523-the happy couple reasoned after this fashion , or were capable of analysing the source of the tremor that mingled with [their]523-the happy couple physical pleasure , [their]523-the happy couple sheer delight of the eye ; but before [they]523-the happy couple had been in [the valley]585-the valley many hours [they]523-the happy couple sympathized in secret ( [they]523-the happy couple did not know why ) with [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg 's consistent avoidance of [its]585-the valley loveliness , saw hazily and without comprehension why , for all [her]114-madame amberg praise of its beauties , [she]114-madame amberg was so loth to dwell [there]527-there . [The place]594-the place , though [they]523-the happy couple knew it not , was a New Idea to [them]523-the happy couple â€” and therefore a shadow of terror to [their]523-the happy couple patterned and settled convictions . As such [their]523-the happy couple organized and regulated minds shrank from it at once and instinctively â€” cautiously apprehensive lest the New Idea should tamper with accepted beliefs , disturb established views and call generally for the exercise of faculties hitherto unused . [They]523-the happy couple had an uneasy foreboding â€” never mentioned aloud by either , though troublous to both â€” that long contact with solitude and beauty might end by confusing issues that once were plain , and so unfitting [them]523-the happy couple for the work of Progress and Humanity â€” for committees , agitations , the absorbing of pamphlets and the general duty of rearranging the universe . There was something , probably , in the frame of mind in which [they]523-the happy couple approached [the valley]585-the valley ; [they]523-the happy couple came of [a migratory , holiday race]596-a migratory , holiday race , and had seen green beauty before , if only fleetingly and at intervals . What [they]523-the happy couple had lacked before was the insight into beauty born of [their]523-the happy couple own hearts ' content , the wonder created by [their]523-the happy couple own most happy love .... [They]523-the happy couple followed [[their]523-the happy couple guide]570-their guide for the most part in silence , relieved that [he]570-their guide had ceased [his]570-their guide well - meaning attempts to make [them]523-the happy couple understand [his]570-their guide jargon , and speaking , when [they]523-the happy couple spoke at all , in voices lowered almost to a whisper . " What 's that ? "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda queried , still under [her]104-griselda breath . " That "[104-griselda] was a flash of blue fire ahead of [them]523-the happy couple darting slantwise over [the stream]598-the stream . Later [they]523-the happy couple learned to understand that a flash of blue fire meant kingfisher ; but for the moment [William]99-william shook [his]99-william head , nonplussed , and hazarded only , " It 's a bird . "[99-william] For half - an - hour or so it was only the birds and [themselves]523-the happy couple ; then at a turn in [the narrowing valley]599-the narrowing valley [they]523-the happy couple came in sight of cows nuzzling [the pastures]584-the pastures . [Madame Peys]117-madame peys ( [they]523-the happy couple knew at least [her]117-madame peys name ) unlocked the door and ushered [them]523-the happy couple into [the kitchen]621-the kitchen , where [the boy]622-the boy deposited [their]523-the happy couple bags . [The cottage]526-the cottage was what [any one who know [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg]624-any one who know madame amberg might have expected [[her]114-madame amberg cottage]625-her cottage to be . [It]526-the cottage was sparsely furnished , except with explosive literature ; there were very few chairs , and those few verging on decrepitude , but numerous tracts and pamphlets in divers civilized languages . [Kitchen utensils]626-kitchen utensils were conspicuous chiefly by [their]626-kitchen utensils absence , and presumably [the owner]627-the owner relied consistently on the loan of the copper stewpan which had accompanied [[her]114-madame amberg guests]628-her guests from [the farm]629-the farm . While [Madame Peys]117-madame peys made play with the stew - pan and a kettle , [the honeymoon couple]632-the honeymoon couple unpacked [their]632-the honeymoon couple bags and examined [[their]632-the honeymoon couple new domain]633-their new domain : still , to a certain extent , overawed by the silence and loneliness around it ; still , unknown to [themselves]632-the honeymoon couple , speaking more gently and with more hesitation than usual . It was the familiar tang of the books and pamphlets , with which the shelves were crammed and the floor was heaped , that first revived [their]632-the honeymoon couple quieted spirits and created a sense of [home]247-home . [Woman]107-woman and [Democracy]116-democracy , even on the backs of books , had power to act as a tonic and trumpet - call , to reflect the atmosphere of noise and controversy where alone [they]632-the honeymoon couple could breathe with comfort . With unconscious relief [they]632-the honeymoon couple turned from the window and the prospect of [the valley]585-the valley , green and untenanted , to entrench [themselves]632-the honeymoon couple against the assaults of the unknown behind the friendly and familiar volumes that had overflowed from [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg 's deal book - shelves to [Madame Amberg]114-madame amberg 's uncarpeted floor . [William]99-william in the presence of [Belfort Bax]119-belfort bax felt [his]119-belfort bax feet once more beneath [him]119-belfort bax ; [Griselda]104-griselda , recognizing a pamphlet by [Christabel Pankhurst]120-christabel pankhurst , ceased to be troubled by the loneliness around [her]104-griselda , grew animated and raised [her]104-griselda voice .... And the savoury mess which [Madame]114-madame amberg produced from [her]114-madame amberg stewpan , combined with the no less excellent coffee that followed , dispelled for the moment the sense of mystery and the shadow of the New Idea . The shadow obtruded itself more than once during the next three weeks or so ; but on the whole [they]632-the honeymoon couple managed with fair success to be in [the country]535-the country and not of [it]535-the country â€” to create in [the heart of [[their]632-the honeymoon couple immemorial valley]638-their immemorial valley]637-the heart of their immemorial valley a little refuge and atmosphere of truly advanced suburbia . [Their]632-the honeymoon couple existence in [the Ardennes valley]639-the ardennes valley was one of mutual affection and study â€” by which latter term [they]632-the honeymoon couple understood principally the reading of books [they]632-the honeymoon couple agreed with . [Their]632-the honeymoon couple daily doings fell naturally into routine ; [they]632-the honeymoon couple rose of a morning to coffee steaming on the stove ; and , having digested [their]632-the honeymoon couple breakfast , [they]632-the honeymoon couple usually proceeded to walk a little , concluding the exercise by sitting under the trees with a book which [William]99-william read aloud to [Griselda]104-griselda . [They]632-the honeymoon couple lunched sometimes in picnic fashion , sometimes at [home]247-home ; in the afternoon took another stroll or sat at [home]247-home reading , with happy little interludes of talk . On two or three days [they]632-the honeymoon couple made small excursions to [one of [the neighbouring villages]645-the neighbouring villages]644-one of the neighbouring villages ; on others [William]99-william , with a pen and a frown of importance , would establish [himself]99-william at the table after lunch was cleared away ; [he]99-william had a tract in hand on the Woman Question , and [Griselda]104-griselda gently but firmly insisted that even in the first ecstasy of [their]632-the honeymoon couple honeymoon [he]99-william should not lay it aside . "[104-griselda] [They]665-they sat until late side by side by the open window and talked in snatches of [the world]312-the world [they]665-they were going back to â€” the dear , familiar , self - important world of [the agitated and advanced]667-the agitated and advanced . " What shall [we]665-they do to - morrow , [darling]2881-darling ? "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda asked at length . [They]665-they considered the point with that object in view , and decided that should the day prove fine [they]665-they would spend it away from [the cottage]526-the cottage , taking [their]665-they lunch with [them]665-they . There was a winding path leading up through [the woods]671-the woods to [the heights which [they]665-they had not yet explored except for a short distance]672-the heights which they had not yet explored except for a short distance ; [they]665-they would start out , provisioned , soon after breakfast , to go where the path led [them]665-they , and eat [their]665-they meal on [the hill - top]673-the hill - top . Then [home]247-home to supper , settlement with [Madame]117-madame peys , and an early departure next morning .... So [they]665-they planned comfortably and without misgiving , while [the world]312-the world seethed in the melting - pot and [the Kaiser battered at LiÃ¨ge]676-the kaiser battered at liÃ¨ge . " If it 's fine , "[99-william] [William]99-william cautioned again as [they]665-they mounted the stairs to bed . " [I]99-william 've heard thunder several times in the distance , so [we]665-they may have a storm in the morning . "[99-william] There was no storm or sign of a storm in the morning . It must have passed over , [Griselda]104-griselda said ; [she]104-griselda had listened to its faint and distant mutterings for half - an - hour before [she]104-griselda fell asleep . [Their]665-they meal of coffee and new - laid eggs was waiting on the stove as usual , and [Madame Peys]117-madame peys had vanished as usual before [they]665-they came down to partake of it . [They]665-they hard - boiled more eggs while [they]665-they breakfasted , and , the meal disposed of , set to work to cut plentiful sandwiches and otherwise furnish [their]665-they basket . As [[their]665-they road]677-their road up [the hill]678-the hill did not lead [them]665-they past [the farm]629-the farm , and [Madame Peys]117-madame peys had not yet put in an appearance for the process of tidying up , [William]99-william inscribed in large round - hand on an envelope the word " Sorti , "[99-william] as a sign to [[their]665-they housekeeper]568-their housekeeper that the preparation of a midday meal was unnecessary ; and having placed the announcement on the kitchen table , duly weighted with a saucer , [he]99-william took the basket on one arm , [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife on the other , and set out . [They]665-they met not [a soul]682-a soul that morning as [they]665-they mounted [the winding little path]683-the winding little path â€” somewhat slowly , for the winding little path was not only longer than [they]665-they had expected but very steep in places . Further , the day was hot even under the trees , and [they]665-they rested more than once before [they]665-they reached [their]665-they goal , [the heights that crowned [the valley]585-the valley]684-the heights that crowned the valley ; rested with [their]665-they backs against a beech - trunk , and talked of [themselves]665-they and what interested [them]665-they â€” of meetings past and to come , of the treachery of [the Labour Party]686-the labour party , of the wickedness of [the Government]350-the government and the necessity for terrifying [[its]686-the labour party members]347-its members by new and astounding tactics .
