[They]665-they did so in the customary fashion , ate well and heartily , and although [they]665-they allowed an unhurried interval for digestion were even less enthusiastic about [their]665-they uphill walk than [they]665-they had been before partaking of lunch . " Do n't [you]99-william think [we]665-they 've about been far enough ? "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda suggested . " [They]2900-they must have started in rather a hurry , "[99-william] [he]99-william commented . The comment was justified by the disordered appearance of [the room]778-the room , suggesting a departure anything but leisurely and packing anything but methodical . There was an arm - chair upturned by the hearth where the ashes of the wood fire still glowed and reddened in places , but all the other chairs had vanished . The heavy table was still in the centre of [the room]778-the room , but a smaller one had gone , and several pans were missing from the row that shimmered on the wall opposite the fireplace . The canary 's cage and the clock on the mantelpiece had departed ; and the china cupboard standing wide open was rifled of part of its contents â€” apparently a random selection . On the floor in one corner was a large chequered table - cloth knotted into a bundle and containing , judging by [its]780-its bulges , a collection of domestic objects of every shape known to [the housewife]781-the housewife . It lay discarded at the foot of the stairs like a bursting and badly cooked pudding ; [its]780-its formidable size and unwieldy contour accounting in themselves for [the household]782-the household 's decision to abandon it ... " [William]99-william , "[104-griselda] [she]104-griselda said in a queer little whisper , " what 's that ? "[104-griselda] " What ? "[99-william] [He]99-william looked where [she]104-griselda pointed , and [she]104-griselda felt [him]99-william thrill , as [she]104-griselda [herself]104-griselda had thrilled when [her]104-griselda hand went out to [his]99-william arm ; [neither]649-neither spoke as [they]791-their went towards the end of [the garden]760-the garden , instinctively hushing [their]791-their footsteps ... The soft earth beyond the gooseberry bushes had been heaped into a long mound , and the solitary pullet was clucking and pecking at the side of a new - made grave . [They]791-their stood looking down at [it]793-it in silence â€” dumb and uneasily fearful in the presence of a mystery beyond [their]791-their powers of fathoming . [The empty , untidy house behind [them]791-their]794-the empty , untidy house behind them was suddenly a threat and a shadow ; so was the loneliness and all - enclosing silence of [the valley]585-the valley ... The damp garden earth was still fresh and black from its turning ; [whoever lay under it]796-whoever lay under it could have lain but an hour or two ; and , lest the unmistakable shape of the mound should fail to indicate what [it]793-it covered , [some one]2838-some one had laid on it a red spray torn from a rose - bush and with a stick and a knot of string had fashioned a cross for the head . Two crossed hazel shoots and a handful of roses betokened that a spirit had returned to the God Who gave [it]793-it . As [they]791-their stood at the graveside in the peace of the evening , the constant mutter of distant guns sent a low - spoken threat along [the valley]585-the valley ; but [they]791-their were too much engrossed in [their]791-their thoughts and surroundings to give it ear or heed , and it was the pullet who roused [them]791-their from [their]791-their stupor of dumb astonishment . Encouraged by [their]791-their stillness , [she]799-she drew near , surveyed [the mound]800-the mound and with a flap of [her]799-she clipped wings alighted under the cross . [William]99-william instinctively bent forward to " shoo "[799-she] [her]799-she away , and as [she]799-she fled protesting to [a safer neighbourhood]801-a safer neighbourhood [the husband and wife]802-the husband and wife for the first time moved and spoke . " What can have happened ? "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda whispered . " Do [you]99-william think â€” â€” [William]99-william , [you]99-william do n't think there has been a murder ? "[104-griselda] [William]99-william shook [his]99-william head , though not with excess of confidence . " There 's the cross , "[99-william] [he]99-william objected , " and the roses . [A murderer]2903-a murderer would hardly put roses â€” â€” "[99-william] " [I]104-griselda do n't know , "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda whispered back . " [You]99-william hear of [criminals]2904-criminals doing such strange things â€” and perhaps it was done hastily , in a quarrel , and [the murderer]2905-the murderer repented at once .... For all [we]2906-we know that paper on [our]2906-we kitchen table may be a confession .... [I]99-william wonder whose grave it is â€” if it 's one of [the Peys]117-madame peys . "[99-william] [William]99-william reminded [her]104-griselda of the absence of [the farm - yard]803-the farm - yard stock â€” and [she]104-griselda admitted that [a family seeking to elude justice]804-a family seeking to elude justice would hardly be so foolish as to attempt to conceal [itself]804-a family seeking to elude justice from [the police]518-the police in the company of seven cows , [two cart - horses]806-two cart - horses and an entire colony of poultry . Nor , when [untrodden woods]807-untrodden woods lay around [them]808-they , would [they]808-they call attention to the crime by placing the grave of [[their]808-they victim]809-their victim in a prominent position in [the garden]760-the garden ; while it was difficult to think of [[the Peys]117-madame peys family]811-the peys family , as [they]808-they had known [them]811-the peys family , as [murderers]812-murderers and accomplices of [murderers]812-murderers : [the old lady]609-the old lady so cheery and shrewd , [[her]609-the old lady son]221-her son and [[his]221-her son wife]654-his wife so unintelligibly friendly , and [Philippe]121-philippe so loutishly good - natured . For a while a gruesome fascination held [them]808-they to the side of the grave â€” and then [Griselda]104-griselda quivered and said suddenly , " Let 's go [home]247-home . "[104-griselda] [They]808-they walked away softly and closed the gate softly behind [them]808-they ; and , once [they]808-they were well beyond [it]817-it , instinctively quickened [their]808-they footsteps . [They]808-they walked arm - in - arm , speaking little , on [their]808-they way back to [the cottage]526-the cottage , and it was not until [they]808-they were almost on the threshold of [[their]808-they solitary homestead]819-their solitary homestead that it struck [them]808-they that perhaps [they]808-they would only be fulfilling [their]808-they legal duty by informing [the local authorities]820-the local authorities of the presence of the new - made grave . [They]808-they discussed the idea , considered it , and after discussion rejected it : for one thing , there was the language difficulty , for another the natural shrinking of [the foreigner]821-the foreigner from entangling [himself]821-the foreigner in unknown processes of law â€” involving possible detention for the purpose of giving evidence . [They]808-they decided that it would be better for the present to await events , and hope for the return of [some member of [the vanished family]823-the vanished family]822-some member of the vanished family . In after days , when after events had given [him]821-the foreigner a clue , [William]99-william framed [his]99-william solution to the mystery of the grave and [the empty farmhouse]824-the empty farmhouse â€” a solution which perhaps was not correct as to detail but was certainly right in substance . [Some fleeing Belgian , wounded to death]825-some fleeing belgian , wounded to death , had found strength to outrun or outride [the Uhlan]122-the uhlan , and seeking a refuge in [the hidden valley]826-the hidden valley had brought [his]99-william news to [the farmhouse]827-the farmhouse , and died after giving it utterance . [Those who heard it]828-those who heard it had buried [him]99-william in haste , and straightway fled from [the invader]829-the invader â€” fled clumsily , with horse and cart and cattle , leaving [their]828-those who heard it scribbled , unreadable warning to [the absent tenants of [the cottage]526-the cottage]830-the absent tenants of the cottage . Whether [they]808-they fled far and successfully , or whether [they]808-they were overtaken and in due course held fast behind the barrier of flesh and iron that shut off [the German]123-the german and [his]123-the german conquests from [the rest of [the civilized world]833-the civilized world]832-the rest of the civilized world â€” that [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda never knew . In the meantime , unfurnished with any clue , unknowing of the wild fury that in its scathing of [the civilized world]833-the civilized world was shattering [their]808-they most cherished illusions , [they]808-they sought in vain for an explanation , and â€” without putting the fact into words â€” lit the lamp earlier than usual and took care to bolt the door . Usually it was fastened only on the latch , so that [Madame]117-madame peys could let [herself]117-madame peys in with the early morning ; but to - night the darkness was unfriendly and [the lonely valley]835-the lonely valley held [they]808-they knew not what of threatening . [Griselda]104-griselda , uneasily pondering on other matters , had no mind to give to the experiment of an omelette , and [their]808-they supper was plain boiled eggs â€” boiled hard while [she]104-griselda sat with wrinkled brow , unheeding of the flight of minutes . While [they]808-they supped , [their]808-they ears were always on the alert for a footstep or a hail from without ; and perhaps for that reason [they]808-they noticed as [they]808-they had never noticed before the faint ghostly noises of [the country]535-the country â€” the night - calling bird and the shiver of leaves when the air stirred and sighed . [They]808-they talked with effort and frequent pause , and with now and again a glance thrown sideways at the open window and the forest blackness behind it ; there were no blinds to the windows , and but for the still , heavy heat [they]808-they would have fastened the shutters and barred out the forest blackness . Perhaps [they]808-they would have borne with the heat of [a closed room]837-a closed room had not both been ashamed to confess [their]808-they fear of the window . In both [their]808-they minds was the sense of being very far removed from humanity , the knowledge that between [them]808-they and humanity was [a lonely path]838-a lonely path and [a house]839-a house with [its]839-a house doors set open â€” [a house deserted and half dismantled with a nameless grave before [it]839-a house]840-a house deserted and half dismantled with a nameless grave before it . Unimaginative as [they]808-they both were , [they]808-they pictured the grave in the darkness with its roughly tied cross and its handful of wilting rosebuds . [They]808-they went [upstairs]255-upstairs earlier than usual , chiefly because [they]808-they felt more comfortable when the windows below were fastened . [William]99-william , coming last with the candle , took the added precaution of turning the key in the door at the foot of the stairs ; and [Griselda]104-griselda , though [she]104-griselda made no remark , heard the click of the lock with a secret throb of relief . [Upstairs]255-upstairs [they]808-they began by a little pretence of undressing â€” and then [Griselda]104-griselda , with [her]104-griselda hair down [her]104-griselda back , sat close to [William]99-william , with [his]99-william coat off , and [they]808-they held hands and talked in undertones in the intervals of listening for a footstep . The footstep never came ; but it was not until close upon midnight that â€” knowing the early habits of [the former tenants of [the farm]629-the farm]843-the former tenants of the farm â€” [they]808-they gave up all hope of hearing it and began to discuss [their]808-they plans for the following day , on the presumption that [they]808-they must leave [the cottage]526-the cottage and remove [their]808-they luggage alone . Such unaided removal meant an earlier uprising than [they]808-they had counted on â€” since if [Madame]117-madame peys did not prepare [their]808-they breakfast [they]808-they needs must prepare it [themselves]808-they ; and this misfortune realized , [they]808-they decided to sit up no longer . [They]808-they went to bed , but left the candle burning â€” as [they]808-they said to each other , lest [one of [the Peys family]811-the peys family]846-one of the peys family should knock [them]808-they up during the night . Neither slept much , partly from nervous uneasiness and partly from fear of oversleeping ; but if [they]808-they had guessed what a day would bring forth , [neither]649-neither would have slept at all . [They]808-they had left [their]808-they bedroom windows uncurtained , that the morning light might waken [them]808-they , and [they]808-they were hardly later than the August sun in opening [their]808-they eyes on [the world]312-the world . Though [they]808-they had slept but little , and by snatches , [they]808-they turned out of bed without regret ; the flood of sunlight brought warmth into [their]808-they hearts and the shadowy horror of the night before was lifted with the mists of [the valley]585-the valley ; but all the same [the place]594-the place , once only faintly mysterious , was now actively malicious and distasteful , was tainted with a lurking dread . Thus to [their]808-they pleasure at the thought of noise and [London]1-london was added relief at the prospect of escape from a solitude grown fearful since yesterday . [They]808-they dressed with haste and rising spirits ; and it was with undisguised joy that [they]808-they collected [their]808-they few possessions and stuffed them into [their]808-they hold - alls . [William]99-william , whose toilet and preparations for the journey were completed in advance of [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's , descended first to [the kitchen]621-the kitchen , where , in the continued and regretted absence of [[their]808-they housekeeper]568-their housekeeper , [he]99-william struggled valiantly with the making of breakfast while [Griselda]104-griselda finished [her]104-griselda packing . The meal so prepared fell short of complete success ; coffee as brewed by [William]99-william was not the same beverage as coffee prepared by [Madame Peys]117-madame peys , nor were its tepid attractions enhanced by the absence of [their]808-they usual and plentiful ration of milk . Thanks to the defection of [the Peys family]811-the peys family , [they]808-they were not only milkless but eggless ; and such remains of bread and butter as [they]808-they could find in the cupboard were the only accompaniment to [William]99-william 's suggestion of coffee . In the circumstances there was but little temptation to risk the loss of [the Brussels train]856-the brussels train by lingering over the table and less than five minutes sufficed for [their]808-they simple meal . Having despatched it , [they]808-they strapped [their]808-they hold - alls and stepped out briskly on [their]808-they way to [the station]541-the station and [home]247-home â€” the sun still low on [the eastward ridge of [the valley]585-the valley]859-the eastward ridge of the valley and the dew still heavy on the grass . [They]808-they hardly turned to look back at [the cottage]526-the cottage , so glad were [they]808-they to leave [it]526-the cottage behind [them]808-they ; and in the elation of [their]808-they spirits [they]808-they sped down [the path]862-the path with a quite unnecessary haste . [They]808-they were escaping from nature and solitude , and [their]808-they hearts sang cheerily of [Bloomsbury]4-bloomsbury . When [they]808-they rounded the bend in the path that brought [them]808-they within sight of [the farm]629-the farm [their]808-they first thought was that [the missing family]864-the missing family had returned ; for outside the gate were three horses , standing riderless and with heads near together . There was something reassuring in the sight of the beasts as [they]865-they stood in the sunlight shifting and flicking [their]865-they tails , something that gave the lie to the terrors of the night before ; the presence of horses betokened the presence of [men]368-men , and the presence of [men]368-men dissipated the sense of mystery that had brooded over [an empty house with a nameless grave in [its]868-an empty house with a nameless grave in its garden garden]868-an empty house with a nameless grave in its garden . "[99-william] Further , [he]99-william had lived in surroundings where [the soldier]877-the soldier was robbed of [his]877-the soldier terrors ; to [him]99-william [the wearer of the king]892-the wearer of the king 's uniform was not only [a person to whom [you]894-you alluded at Labour meetings with the certainty of raising [a jeer]895-a jeer]893-a person to whom you alluded at labour meetings with the certainty of raising a jeer , but [a target at whom strikers threw brickbats and bottles with energy and practical impunity]896-a target at whom strikers threw brickbats and bottles with energy and practical impunity . Thus handicapped it could hardly be looked on as [a formidable adversary]899-a formidable adversary ... and [William]99-william , without a thought of fear , stared [the field - grey horseman]900-the field - grey horseman in the eyes . "[104-griselda] At this juncture [one of [the men in field - grey]921-the men in field - grey]920-one of the men in field - grey seized [William]99-william by the collar and proceeded to turn out [his]99-william pockets â€” extracting from [their]922-their recesses a purse , a pipe , a handkerchief , a fountain pen , and a green - covered Cook 's ticket . " [London]1-london , "[99-william] [he]99-william ejaculated suddenly , pronouncing the vowels in un - English fashion as O 's . " [London]1-london ! There was an answering hail from [the farmhouse kitchen]925-the farmhouse kitchen , whence issued promptly [a fattish young man]926-a fattish young man with a mug in [his]926-a fattish young man hand , and a helmet tilted on [his]926-a fattish young man nose . With [him]926-a fattish young man [the assailants of [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda]927-the assailants of william and griselda entered into rapid and throaty explanations ; whereat [Heinz]126-heinz nodded assentingly as [he]126-heinz advanced down [the garden path]928-the garden path to the gate , surveying [the captives]929-the captives with interest and a pair of little pigs'-eyes . Having reached the gate [he]126-heinz leaned over it , mug in hand , and looked down at [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda . " English , "[126-heinz] [he]126-heinz said in a voice that was thicker than it should have been at so early an hour of the morning ; " English â€” [you]2921-you come from [London]1-london ? ... "[126-heinz] [He]126-heinz suited the action to the word and drained [his]126-heinz mug ; and having drained it till it stood upright upon [his]126-heinz nose , proceeded to throw it over [his]126-heinz shoulder to shatter on the brick path . Whether from natural good temper or the cheering effect of potations [his]126-heinz face was wreathed in an amiable smile as [he]126-heinz crossed [his]126-heinz arms on the bar of the gate and continued to address [[his]126-heinz audience]212-his audience â€” " [We]2926-we shall take [you]931-his grey - clad companions to [[our]2926-we officer]2932-our officer and [you]931-his grey - clad companions will be [prisoners]2933-prisoners , and if [you]931-his grey - clad companions are [spies]2934-spies [you]931-his grey - clad companions will be shot . "[126-heinz] There was something so impossible about the announcement that [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda felt [their]212-his audience courage return with a rush . Moreover , though the words of [Heinz]126-heinz were threatening the aspect of [Heinz]126-heinz was not ; [his]126-heinz fat young face with its expansive and slightly inebriated smile was ridiculous rather than terrifying , even under the brim of a helmet . [William]99-william , thankful for the English acquired during the two years ' hairdressing in [the Harrow Road]2923-the harrow road , admonished [him]126-heinz with a firmness intended to sober and dismay . " This is not a time for silly jokes . [I]126-heinz am afraid that [you]126-heinz do not realize the seriousness of the situation . [I]126-heinz shall feel it [my]126-heinz duty to make a full report to [[your]126-heinz superiors]2935-your superiors â€” when [you]126-heinz will find it is no laughing matter . [[My]126-heinz wife]2936-my wife and [I]126-heinz , proceeding quietly to [the station]541-the station , have been grossly and violently assaulted by [[your]126-heinz two companions]2938-your two companions . [We]2939-we gave [them]2938-your two companions no provocation , and the attack was entirely uncalled for . [I]126-heinz repeat , [I]126-heinz shall feel it [my]126-heinz duty to report [their]2938-your two companions conduct in the very strongest terms . "[126-heinz] [He]126-heinz felt as [he]126-heinz spoke that the reproof would have carried more weight had it been delivered in a standing position ; but [his]126-heinz head still reeled from the stinging cuff it had received and [he]126-heinz felt safer where [he]126-heinz was â€” on the ground . "[99-william] [His]99-william manner was pardonably irritated , and if [he]99-william had not judged it imprudent [he]99-william would have refused point - blank to answer this purposeless catechism . Whatever the joke it appealed also to [[his]99-william comrades , who , once it was imparted between [Heinz]126-heinz 's paroxysms]938-his comrades , who , once it was imparted between heinz 's paroxysms , joined [their]938-his comrades , who , once it was imparted between heinz 's paroxysms exquisite mirth to [his]99-william own . " A War . The Greatest that ever was . What do [you]2952-you think of that , [[you]2952-you damn little fools]2954-you damn little fools ? "[99-william] There are statements too large as there are statements too wild for any but the unusually imaginative to grasp at a first hearing . Neither [William]99-william nor [Griselda]104-griselda had ever entertained the idea of a European War ; it was not entertained by [any of [[their]942-they friends]943-their friends]941-any of their friends or [their]942-they pamphlets . Rumours of war [they]942-they had always regarded as foolish and malicious inventions set afloat in the interest of Capitalism and Conservatism with the object of diverting attention from Social Reform or the settlement of the Woman Question ; and to [their]942-they ears , still filled with the hum of other days , the announcement of [Heinz]126-heinz was even such a foolish invention . Nor , even had [they]942-they given [him]126-heinz credence , would [they]942-they in these first inexperienced moments have been greatly perturbed or alarmed ; [their]942-they historical ignorance was so profound , [they]942-they had talked so long and so often in terms of war , that [they]942-they had come to look on the strife of nations as a glorified scuffle on the lines of a Pankhurst demonstration . Thus [Griselda]104-griselda , taught by [The Suffragette]446-the suffragette , used the one word " battle "[446-the suffragette] for [a small street row]945-a small street row and the fire and slaughter of [Eylau]48-eylau â€” or would have so used it , had [she]104-griselda known of the slaughter of [Eylau]48-eylau . And that being the case , [Heinz]126-heinz 's revelation of ruin and thunder left [her]104-griselda calm â€” disappointingly so . " [I]104-griselda think , "[104-griselda] [she]104-griselda said loftily , in answer to [his]126-heinz question , " that [you]126-heinz are talking absolute nonsense . [Their]948-the three grey mounted men heads were whirling and [their]948-the three grey mounted men hearts throbbing with rage ; but [they]948-the three grey mounted men choked back [its]950-its verbal expression and stumbled down [the valley path]951-the valley path â€” in the clutch of brute force and with [their]948-the three grey mounted men world crumbling about [them]948-the three grey mounted men . It was a most unpleasant walk â€” or rather trot ; [they]948-the three grey mounted men were bruised , [they]948-the three grey mounted men were aching from the handling [they]948-the three grey mounted men had received , and [their]948-the three grey mounted men breath came in sobs from the pace [they]948-the three grey mounted men were forced to keep up . Did [they]948-the three grey mounted men slacken it even for an instant and fall level with the walking horses , [Heinz]126-heinz shouted an order to " Hurry , [[you]948-the three grey mounted men swine]2959-you swine ! "[126-heinz] and flashed up [his]126-heinz threatening sword ; whereupon , to keep out of its painful and possibly dangerous reach , [they]948-the three grey mounted men forced [themselves]948-the three grey mounted men to a further effort and broke into a shambling canter . The sweat poured off [them]948-the three grey mounted men as [they]948-the three grey mounted men shambled and gasped , casting anxious glances at the horses ' heads behind [them]948-the three grey mounted men ; and [their]948-the three grey mounted men visible distress , [their]948-the three grey mounted men panting and [their]948-the three grey mounted men impotent anger , was a source of obvious and unrestrained gratification to [Heinz]126-heinz and [[his]126-heinz jovial companions]952-his jovial companions . [They]948-the three grey mounted men jeered at [the captives]929-the captives ' clumsy running and urged [them]929-the captives to gallop faster . When [Griselda]104-griselda tripped over a tussock and sprawled [her]104-griselda length on the grass , [they]948-the three grey mounted men applauded [her]104-griselda downfall long and joyously and begged [her]104-griselda to repeat the performance . The jeers hurt more than the shaking , and [she]104-griselda staggered to [her]104-griselda feet with tears of wretchedness and outraged dignity running openly down [her]104-griselda nose â€” seeking in vain for that sense of moral superiority and satisfaction in martyrdom which had always sustained [her]104-griselda en route to [the cells of [Bow Street]49-bow street]954-the cells of bow street . [She]104-griselda hated [the three men who jeered at [her]104-griselda miseries and could have killed [them]955-the three men who jeered at her miseries and could have killed them with pleasure with pleasure]955-the three men who jeered at her miseries and could have killed them with pleasure ; every fibre of [her]104-griselda body was quivering with wrath and amazement . Neither [she]104-griselda nor [William]99-william could speak â€” [they]956-they had no breath left in [them]956-they to speak ; but every now and then as [they]956-they shambled along [they]956-they turned [their]956-they hot faces to look at [each other]351-each other â€” and saw , each , a beloved countenance red with exertion and damp with perspiration , a pair of bewildered blue eyes and a gasping open mouth .... So [they]956-they trotted down [the valley]585-the valley , humiliated , dishevelled , indignant , but still incredulous â€” while [their]956-they world crumbled about [them]956-they and [Europe]128-europe thundered and bled . Looking back on the morning in the month of August , nineteen hundred and fourteen , when [he]99-william made [his]99-william first acquaintance with war as [the soldier]877-the soldier understands it , [William Tully]99-william realized that fear , real fear , was absent from [his]99-william heart until [he]99-william witnessed the shooting of [the hostages]960-the hostages . Until that moment [he]99-william had been unconvinced , and , because unconvinced , unafraid ; [he]99-william had been indignant , flustered , physically sore and inconvenienced ; but always at the back of [his]99-william mind was the stubborn belief that the pains and indignities endured by [himself]99-william and [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife would be dearly paid for by [the perpetrators]962-the perpetrators . [He]99-william could conceive as yet of no state of society in which Law and the bodily immunity of [the peaceful citizen]963-the peaceful citizen was not the ultimate principle ; and even the sight of [a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward on [the road]731-the road by [the river]549-the river had not convinced [him]99-william of war and the meaning of war . [They]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward came on the trudging torrent of [men]368-men as [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward debouched from [the valley]585-the valley on to [the main road]969-the main road ; and [[their]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward captors]970-their captors halted [them]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward on the grass at [the roadside]971-the roadside until [the close grey ranks]972-the close grey ranks had passed . [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda were thankful for the few minutes ' respite and breathing - space ; [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward wiped [their]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward hot faces and [Griselda]104-griselda made ineffectual attempts to tidy [her]104-griselda tumbled hair . [She]104-griselda was reminded by [her]104-griselda pressing need of hairpins that [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward had left [their]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward bags on the scene of [their]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward misfortune , outside the farmhouse gate ; [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward conversed about the loss in undertones , and wondered if the bags would be recovered . [They]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward were not without hopes , taking into account the loneliness of [the neighbourhood]973-the neighbourhood .... When [the battalion]974-the battalion , with its tail of [attendant grey carts]975-attendant grey carts , had passed , [Heinz]126-heinz ordered [them]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward forward again â€” and [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward moved on , fifty yards or so behind the last of [the grey carts]976-the grey carts , and trusting that [their]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward goal was at hand . " If [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward 're only taking [us]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward as far as [the village]720-the village , "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda panted hopefully . [They]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward were â€” to [the familiar little village with [[its]977-the familiar little village with its miniature railway station between the river and the cliff miniature railway station between [the river]549-the river and [the cliff]980-the cliff]978-its miniature railway station between the river and the cliff]977-the familiar little village with its miniature railway station between the river and the cliff . [The column of infantry]981-the column of infantry plodded dustily through and past [it]977-the familiar little village with its miniature railway station between the river and the cliff , but [Heinz]126-heinz followed [the rear - guard]982-the rear - guard only halfway down [the street]983-the street before [he]126-heinz shouted to [[his]126-heinz prisoners]984-his prisoners to halt . [They]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward halted â€” with an alacrity born of relief and a sense of the wisdom of prompt obedience to orders â€” before [an unpretentious white building with a sentry stationed on either side of the door]985-an unpretentious white building with a sentry stationed on either side of the door . [Heinz]126-heinz swung [himself]126-heinz down from [his]126-heinz horse and went into [the house]641-the house , leaving [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda in charge of [[his]126-heinz comrades]202-his comrades and standing at the side of [the road]731-the road . [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda looked about [them]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward . [They]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward had passed through [the place]594-the place several times and were accustomed enough to [its]594-the place usual appearance to be aware of the change that had come over [it]594-the place . [The rumbling grey carts behind which [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward had tramped]990-the rumbling grey carts behind which they had tramped were already at [the end of [the village]720-the village]991-the end of the village ; [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward could see all the sunlit length of [the street]983-the street and take stock of the new unfamiliar life which filled [it]983-the street from end to end . It was a life masculine and military ; an odd mixture of iron order and disorder ; of [soldiers on duty]994-soldiers on duty and [soldiers]2883-soldiers taking [their]2883-soldiers ease . [The street]983-the street itself was untidy and littered as [they]964-a long grey battalion of infantry plodding dustily westward had never seen [it]983-the street before ; [its]983-the street centre had been swept clear , so that traffic might pass unhindered , but the sides of [the road]731-the road were strewn with a jetsam of fragmentary lumber . [A country cart that had lost a wheel]998-a country cart that had lost a wheel sat clumsily in front of [the church]506-the church near a jumble of broken pottery , and a chair with its legs in the air was neighboured by trusses of straw . All down [the street]983-the street the doors stood widely open â€” here and there [a house with starred or shattered windows]1001-a house with starred or shattered windows looked unkempt and forlornly shabby . [One]413-one was [a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five and might have been [a local tradesman â€” nearly bald and with drooping moustaches , rather like a stout little seal]1086-a local tradesman â€” nearly bald and with drooping moustaches , rather like a stout little seal . Essentially an ordinary and unpretentious creature , [he]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five was obviously aiming at dignity ; [his]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five chin was lifted at an angle that revealed the measure of the roll of fat that rested on [his]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five collar , and [he]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five walked almost with a strut , as if [he]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five were attempting to march . Afterwards [William]99-william remembered that [he]99-william had seen on [the little man]1087-the little man 's portly stomach some sort of insignia or ribbon ; at the time it conveyed nothing to [him]1085-a short and rotund little man who might have been sixty to sixty - five , but [he]99-william was told later that it was the outward token of [a mayor]1088-a mayor . [Her]1097-the respectable woman in black grief was animal , alike in its unrestraint and its terrible power of expression ; convention fell away from [her]1097-the respectable woman in black ; in [her]1097-the respectable woman in black tidy dress and with [her]1097-the respectable woman in black dowdy hat slipping to one shoulder [she]1097-the respectable woman in black was [primitive woman crooning over [[her]1097-the respectable woman in black dying mate]1100-her dying mate ....
