[The soldier]877-the soldier â€” [he]877-the soldier had stripes on [his]877-the soldier sleeve and seemed [a person of authority]1113-a person of authority â€” held a handkerchief dangling from [his]877-the soldier hand ; and , seeing it , [the grizzled - haired captive]1114-the grizzled - haired captive removed [his]1114-the grizzled - haired captive steel - rimmed eyeglasses . " Do n't look , "[99-william] said [William]99-william under [his]99-william breath . " [Griselda]104-griselda , do n't look . "[99-william] For the first time mortal fear had seized [him]99-william by the throat and shaken [him]99-william . [He]99-william knew now that [he]99-william stood before death itself , and the power to inflict death , and [his]99-william heart was as water within [him]99-william . [[His]99-william wife]654-his wife was beside [him]99-william â€” and when [he]99-william realized ( as [he]99-william did later on with shame ) that the spasm of terror in those first moments of comprehension had been stronger than the spasm of pity , [he]99-william excused it by the fact of [her]654-his wife presence . [His]99-william fear in its forecast of evil took tangible shape . [Griselda]104-griselda at [his]99-william elbow had [her]104-griselda eyes and [her]104-griselda mouth wide open ; [she]104-griselda was engrossed , fascinated â€” and [he]99-william was afraid , most horribly afraid , that in [her]104-griselda amazement , [her]104-griselda righteous pity , [she]104-griselda might say or do something that would bring down wrath upon [them]1116-them . [He]99-william remembered how bold [she]104-griselda had been in the face of [a crowd]1117-a crowd , how uplifted by sacred enthusiasm ! ... [He]99-william plucked [her]104-griselda by the sleeve when [he]99-william whispered to [her]104-griselda not to look â€” but [she]104-griselda went on staring , wide - eyed and wide - mouthed , for the first time unresponsive to [his]99-william touch and the sound of [his]99-william voice . [They]1118-they bandaged the eyes of [the two prisoners]1119-the two prisoners â€” [the rotund pompous little mayor]1120-the rotund pompous little mayor and [the man who might have been [a schoolmaster]1092-a schoolmaster]1121-the man who might have been a schoolmaster . All [his]99-william life [William]99-william remembered the look of [the rotund mayor]1123-the rotund mayor with a bandage covering [him]1123-the rotund mayor from forehead to nose - tip and [his]1123-the rotund mayor grey moustache quivering beneath it â€” [a man most pitifully afraid to die , yet striving to die as the situation]1124-a man most pitifully afraid to die , yet striving to die as the situation demanded . And [he]99-william remembered how , at the moment the bandage was knotted on [the mayor]1125-the mayor 's head , there stepped up to [him]99-william quietly [the stout old woman who had stood praying on the further side of [the road]731-the road]1126-the stout old woman who had stood praying on the further side of the road with [her]1126-the stout old woman who had stood praying on the further side of the road eyes fixed upon the door . [She]1126-the stout old woman who had stood praying on the further side of the road held up a little crucifix and pressed it to the quivering grey moustache .... [Griselda]104-griselda clutched [William]99-william by the wrist and [he]99-william thought [she]104-griselda was going to cry out . " Do n't , [darling]2881-darling , do n't ! "[99-william] [he]99-william whispered . " Oh , [darling]2881-darling , for both [our]2963-our sakes ! "[99-william] ... [He]99-william did not know whether it was [his]99-william appeal or [her]104-griselda own terror and amazement that restrained [her]104-griselda from speech â€” but [she]104-griselda stood in silence with [her]104-griselda fingers tightened on [his]99-william wrist . [He]99-william wished [she]104-griselda would look away , [he]99-william wished [he]99-william could look away [himself]99-william ; [he]99-william tried for an instant to close [his]99-william eyes , but the not - seeing was worse than sight , and [he]99-william had to open them again . As [he]99-william opened [them]1128-them [a car]1129-a car roared by raising a smother of dust ; but as the cloud of its passage settled [he]99-william saw that [the two blindfolded men]1130-the two blindfolded men were standing with [their]1130-the two blindfolded men backs to a blank wall â€” a yellow - washed , eight - foot garden wall with the boughs of a pear - tree drooping over it . It was opposite the yellow - washed wall , across [the road]731-the road , that the file of [soldiers]2883-soldiers was drawn up ; [the captives]929-the captives were facing the muzzles of [their]929-the captives rifles and [the red - faced boy - officer]1134-the red - faced boy - officer had stationed [himself]1134-the red - faced boy - officer stiffly at the farther end of the file . The dust settled and died down â€” and there followed ( so it seemed to [William]99-william ) an agony of waiting for something that would not happen . Long beating seconds ( three or four of [them]1130-the two blindfolded men at most ) while [two men]1135-two men stood upright with bandaged eyes and rifles pointed at [their]1135-two men hearts ; long beating seconds , while a bird fluted in the pear - tree â€” a whistle - note infinitely careless .... And then ( thank [God]101-god for it ! ) a voice and a report that were as one .... [The man with the grizzled hair]1136-the man with the grizzled hair threw out an arm and toppled with [his]1136-the man with the grizzled hair face in the dust ; [the mayor]1125-the mayor slid sideways against the wall with the blood dribbling from [his]1125-the mayor mouth . Fundamentally [William]99-william was no more of [a coward]1138-a coward than [the majority of [[his]99-william fellow - men]1140-his fellow - men]1139-the majority of his fellow - men , and , put to it , [he]99-william would have emulated [the shivering little mayor]1141-the shivering little mayor and tried to strut gamely to [his]99-william end ; it was as much sheer bewildered amazement as the baseness of bodily terror that had [him]99-william by the throat when [he]99-william saw [the hostages]960-the hostages done to death â€” sickening and shaking [him]99-william and , for the moment , depriving [him]99-william of self - control . Never before , in all [his]99-william twenty - eight years , had [he]99-william seen [a man]397-a man come to [his]99-william end ; so far death had touched [him]99-william only once , and but slightly , by the unseen passing of [a mother [he]99-william had not loved]1144-a mother he had not loved ; thus the spectacle of violent and bloody dying would of itself have sufficed to unnerve and unman [him]99-william . To the natural shrinking from that spectacle , to [his]99-william natural horror at the slaying of [helpless men]1145-helpless men , to [his]99-william pity and physical nausea was added the impotent , gasping confusion of [the man whose faith has been uprooted , who is face to face with the incredible]1146-the man whose faith has been uprooted , who is face to face with the incredible . Before [his]99-william eyes had been enacted the impossible â€” the ugly and brutal impossible â€” and beneath [his]99-william feet the foundations of [the earth]591-the earth were reeling . The iron - mouthed guns and the marching columns which had hitherto passed [him]99-william as a dusty pageant took life and meaning in [his]99-william eyes ; they were instruments of the ugly impossible . There was meaning too in [the lonely grave]1148-the lonely grave and in [the lonely house]1149-the lonely house â€” whence [men]368-men had fled in terror of such scenes as [his]99-william eyes had witnessed . So far , to [him]99-william , the limit of human savagery had been the feeding through the nose of [divers young women who , infected with the virus of martyrdom , demanded to be left to die]1151-divers young women who , infected with the virus of martyrdom , demanded to be left to die â€” and now [he]99-william had witnessed the killing of [men who desired most greatly to live]1152-men who desired most greatly to live . At the time [he]99-william did not â€” because [he]99-william could not â€” analyse either the elements of the situation or [his]99-william own attitude towards it ; but [he]99-william knew afterwards , vaguely but surely , that in that one bewildering and ruthless moment the heart of [his]99-william faith was uprooted â€” [his]99-william faith in that large vague entity [the People]375-the people , in the power of Public Opinion and Talk , in the power of the Good Intention .... Until that moment [he]99-william had confounded the blunder with the crime , the mistaken with the evilly intentioned . It had not seemed to [him]99-william possible that [a man]397-a man could disagree with [him]397-a man honestly and out of the core of [his]99-william heart ; it had not seemed to [him]99-william possible that [the righteous]1155-the righteous could be righteous and yet err . [He]99-william knew now , as by lightning flash , that [he]99-william , [Faraday]100-faraday , [a thousand others]1156-a thousand others , throwing scorn from a thousand platforms on the idea of a European War , had been madly , wildly , ridiculously wrong â€” and the knowledge stunned and blinded [him]99-william . [They]1157-they had meant so well , [they]1157-they had meant so exceedingly well â€” and yet [they]1157-they had prophesied falsely and fact had given [them]1157-they the lie . Until that moment [he]99-william had been in what [he]99-william called politics [the counterpart of [the Christian Scientist]1159-the christian scientist]1158-the counterpart of the christian scientist , despising and denying the evil that now laughed triumphant in [his]99-william face . With its triumph perforce [he]99-william was converted . War was : [men]368-men were shot against walls . [Converted]1161-converted , though as yet [he]99-william knew not to what form of unknown faith . [He]99-william did not see what became of the two dead bodies â€” whither [they]1162-they were taken or by whom [they]1162-they were buried â€” for [they]1162-they had barely fallen to the ground and [his]99-william eyes were still closed that [he]99-william might not look on the blood that was dribbling from [the mayor]1125-the mayor 's moustache when a hand tapped [him]99-william smartly on the shoulder and [he]99-william found [Heinz]126-heinz standing beside [him]99-william . [He]99-william had a glimpse of [men moving round the bodies]1164-men moving round the bodies , a glimpse of [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's face staring and sickly , another of a passing motor - cycle , and then [Heinz]126-heinz turned [him]99-william to the door where [the sentries]1166-the sentries stood on guard . With [[his]99-william captor]1167-his captor 's hand on [his]99-william shoulder [he]99-william went into [the low white house]1168-the low white house , along a little passage on [the ground floor]1169-the ground floor and into [a room on the right , at the back of [the house]641-the house]1170-a room on the right , at the back of the house ; [Griselda]104-griselda coming after [him]99-william , still staring and white - faced and likewise with a hand on [her]104-griselda shoulder . In [the room]778-the room â€” large and sunny with windows looking on to [a garden]1173-a garden â€” was [a man in uniform and spectacles writing at a table]1174-a man in uniform and spectacles writing at a table , and , erect and complacent beside [him]99-william , [the fattish moustachioed officer who had watched the execution from the doorstep]1175-the fattish moustachioed officer who had watched the execution from the doorstep . [He]1175-the fattish moustachioed officer who had watched the execution from the doorstep was lighting a cigar with a hand that did not tremble . [William]99-william and [Griselda]104-griselda were escorted by [[their]1166-the sentries guards]1176-their guards into the middle of [the room]778-the room and planted there , standing in front of [him]99-william . After what [he]99-william had seen , and with the memory of [Heinz]126-heinz 's threats , [William Tully]99-william believed most firmly that [he]99-william too was about to die ; and with the conviction there filled [his]99-william heart ( as it would have filled the heart of [any honest lover]1178-any honest lover ) a great and intolerable pity for [Griselda]104-griselda , [[his]99-william new - made wife]1179-his new - made wife . [She]104-griselda , [the woman]1180-the woman , would be left where [he]99-william , [the man]281-the man , would be taken â€” and [he]99-william dared not turn [his]99-william head towards [her]104-griselda lest [he]99-william might see [her]104-griselda face instinct with the agony of the coming parting , lest , foreseeing and resisting it , [she]104-griselda should fling [her]104-griselda arms about [him]99-william and croon over [him]99-william as [the sallow - faced woman in respectable black]1182-the sallow - faced woman in respectable black had crooned over the head of [[her]104-griselda man]1101-her man . [Her]104-griselda meanings , the meanings of [a woman unknown]1184-a woman unknown , had torn at [his]99-william inmost heart ; how should [he]99-william bear it when [Griselda]104-griselda , [[his]99-william darling]1185-his darling , clung fast to [him]99-william and cried in vain for pity ? ... That [he]99-william might not see [Griselda]104-griselda 's face even with the tail of an eye [he]99-william stared hard and steadily over [the officer]1186-the officer 's shoulder . [He]99-william never forgot the wall - paper beyond the well - filled grey uniform ; it was dingy mud and orange as to ground with a ponderous pattern of clumped and climbing vegetables . In one spot , opposite the window , where a blaze of sunlight struck it , the mud and orange was transfigured to shining gold â€” and [William]99-william knew suddenly that [he]99-william had never seen sunlight before . For the first time [he]99-william saw it as vivid glory from heaven â€” when [his]99-william eyes ( as [he]99-william thought ) would soon close on its splendour for ever . Not only [his]99-william sight but [his]99-william every sense was alert and most sharply intense ; on a sudden the thudding of guns in the distance was threateningly nearer at hand , and , in the interval between the gun - bursts , a wasp beating up and down the window - pane filled [the room]778-the room with a spiteful humming . It was while [he]99-william stood waiting for the doom [he]99-william believed to be certain , while [the German captain]1188-the german captain looked [him]99-william up and down and addressed curt unintelligible questions to [those who had made [him]99-william [[their]1188-the german captain prisoner]1190-their prisoner]1189-those who had made him their prisoner â€” that there stirred in the breast of [William Tully]99-william the first faint sense of nationality . [He]99-william did not recognize it as such , and it was not to be expected that [he]99-william should , since [his]99-william life for the last few strenuous years had been largely moulded on the principle that the love of one 's country was a vice to be combated and sneered at . If [you]1191-you had told [him]99-william a short day earlier that the thought of the soil [he]99-william was born on could move and thrill and uplift [him]99-william , [he]99-william would have stared and despised [you]1191-you as [a jingo , that most foolish and degraded of survivals]1192-a jingo , that most foolish and degraded of survivals ; yet with [his]99-william eyes ( as [he]99-william thought ) looking their last on the blazing gold that was sunlight , with the sword suspended over [his]99-william trembling head , something that was not only [his]99-william pitiful love for [Griselda]104-griselda , something that was more than [his]99-william decent self - respect , fluttered and stirred within [him]99-william and called on [him]99-william to play [the man]281-the man . It bade [him]99-william straighten [his]99-william back before [men of an outlandish race]1194-men of an outlandish race , it bade [him]99-william refrain from pleading and weakness before [those who were not of [his]99-william blood]1195-those who were not of his blood ; and for the first time for many years [he]99-william thought of [himself]99-william as [a national]1196-a national , [a man of the English race]1197-a man of the english race . Not consciously as yet and with no definite sense of affection for [England]10-england or impulse to stand by [her]104-griselda and serve [her]104-griselda ; but with a vague , unreasoning , natural longing for [home]247-home and the narrow things of [home]247-home . It mattered not that [the [England]10-england [he]99-william longed for]1200-the england he longed for was small , suburban , crowded and noisily pretentious ; [he]99-william craved for it in the face of death , as other men crave for [[their]1201-their spacious fenlands]1202-their spacious fenlands or the sweep of [[their]1201-their open downs]1203-their open downs . [England]10-england as [he]99-william knew [her]104-griselda called [him]99-william , not with the noisy call of yesterday , but in a voice less strident and more tender ; [he]99-william knew now that it was dreadful to die away from [her]104-griselda . Instinctively , thinking on [London]1-london , [he]99-william drew [himself]99-william up to the height of [his]99-william five foot five and â€” as [the mayor]1125-the mayor had done before [him]99-william â€” [he]99-william lifted [his]99-william chin in would - be defiance and dignity . There â€” with the attempt to subdue the trembling flesh and defy brute insolence and tyranny â€” the resemblance between [the two men]1205-the two men 's cases ended . For the time being [William]99-william ran no risk of a violent and bloody ending ; there was no further need of an example and [he]99-william had offended [the conqueror]1206-the conqueror only by [his]99-william poor little presence . Further â€” though [he]99-william expressed [his]99-william enjoyment of it less noisily and emphatically than [[his]99-william three subordinates]1207-his three subordinates had done â€” the humour of [[his]99-william prisoner]1208-his prisoner 's situation appealed to [[Heinz]126-heinz 's superior officer]1209-heinz 's superior officer almost as much as it had appealed to [Heinz]126-heinz [himself]126-heinz . [He]99-william grinned perceptibly as [he]99-william questioned [the couple]1210-the couple in [his]99-william somewhat halting English ; chuckled audibly when [they]1210-the couple confirmed [[his]99-william subordinate]1211-his subordinate 's statement as to [their]1210-the couple complete ignorance of the European upheaval ; and when [he]99-william had elicited the fact that [the hapless pair]1212-the hapless pair had been spending [their]1212-the hapless pair honeymoon in [the secluded valleys of [Ardennes]17-ardennes]1213-the secluded valleys of ardennes [he]99-william removed [his]99-william cigar from [his]99-william moustachioed lips that [he]99-william might chuckle long and unhindered . " Honeymoon , "[99-william] [he]99-william repeated , [his]99-william stout shoulders trembling with merriment . " In [a nice , quiet place]2964-a nice , quiet place , wiz [no one]204-no one to interrupt zee kissings . Never mind â€” [you]2966-you will have a very good honeymoon with [us]1212-the hapless pair and [you]2966-you will very soon be able to go back to [England]10-england . Just so soon as [the Sherman Army]50-the sherman army shall have been [there]527-there . [You]2966-you should be very pleased that [you]2966-you are safe with [us]1212-the hapless pair : it is more dangerous to be in [London]1-london . "[99-william] [William]99-william , with [his]99-william nerves tuned up to face [a firing party]1214-a firing party , withered miserably under heavy jocularity . [He]99-william knew instinctively that [his]99-william life was saved to [him]99-william ; but the assurance of safety was conveyed in a jeer , and at the moment ( so oddly are [we]1215-we made ) the jeer hurt more than the assurance of safety relieved [him]99-william . [He]99-william had mastered [his]99-william anguish and strung [himself]99-william up â€” to be treated as a figure of fun ; [the spectacled clerk at the writing - table]1216-the spectacled clerk at the writing - table was laughing so heartily that [he]1216-the spectacled clerk at the writing - table had to remove [his]1216-the spectacled clerk at the writing - table glasses and wipe them before [he]1216-the spectacled clerk at the writing - table continued [his]1216-the spectacled clerk at the writing - table labours . [William]99-william tingled all over with helpless rage as [Griselda]104-griselda tingled beside [him]99-william . But yesterday [he]99-william would have told [you]1217-you loftily that both [he]99-william and [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife were inured to public , above all to official , ridicule ; but it is one thing to brave ridicule with [an approving audience in the background]1219-an approving audience in the background , another to face it unapplauded , uncrowned with the halo of the martyr .... [They]1220-they reddened and quivered whilst incomprehensible witticisms passed between [the captain]1221-the captain and [[his]99-william clerk]1222-his clerk . It was an intense relief when a nod and a brief order signified that the jest was sufficiently enjoyed and [their]1220-they audience with [the captain]1221-the captain at an end . [They]1220-they were too thankful even to resent the roughness with which [Heinz]126-heinz collared [[his]126-heinz man]1224-his man while [[his]126-heinz comrade]913-his comrade collared [Griselda]104-griselda . One of the features of the interview that struck [William]99-william later on was this â€” during all the long minutes that it lasted [Griselda]104-griselda had spoken no words . For once the tumult and amazement of [her]104-griselda soul was beyond [her]104-griselda glib power of expression and it was only as [they]1220-they came into the open air that â€” for the first time since [she]104-griselda had seen [the hostages]960-the hostages die â€” [she]104-griselda unclosed [her]104-griselda lips and spoke . " What are [they]1220-they going to do with [us]1220-they ? "[104-griselda] [she]104-griselda asked . [Her]104-griselda voice was husky and uncertain , and the words came out in little jerks . [William]99-william gave the question no answer : for one thing because [his]99-william ignorance of [their]1220-they destiny was as thorough as [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's ; for another because speech , by reason of [Heinz]126-heinz 's firm grip on [his]126-heinz collar , was so difficult as to be almost impossible . [The man]281-the man had [his]281-the man knuckles thrust tightly between shirt and skin ; [William]99-william purpled and gasped as [he]99-william trotted down [the street]983-the street with a collar stud pressing on [his]99-william windpipe . Behind [him]99-william when [he]99-william started came [Griselda]104-griselda and [[her]104-griselda guard]1230-her guard ; as [he]99-william could not twist [his]99-william head to look over [his]99-william shoulder [he]99-william had no suspicion that [the couples]1231-the couples had parted company , and it was not until [[his]99-william captor]1167-his captor turned [him]99-william sharply to the right down [a by - road]1233-a by - road leading to [the station]541-the station that [he]99-william discovered , in rounding the corner , that [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife and [[her]104-griselda escort]1236-her escort were no longer following in [his]99-william footsteps . The momentary sidelong glimpse [he]99-william caught of [the road]731-the road gave [him]99-william never a sight of [Griselda]104-griselda ; [she]104-griselda had vanished without word or sign . For a moment [he]99-william could hardly believe it and walked on stupidly in silence ; then , the stupor passing , [his]99-william terror found voice and [he]99-william clamoured . " Where 's [[my]99-william wife]2936-my wife ? "[99-william] [he]99-william cried out and writhed instinctively to free [himself]99-william . [His]99-william reward was a tightening of [the German]123-the german 's strangle - hold , some most hearty abuse and some even heartier kicks . Under the punishment [he]99-william lost [his]99-william foothold and would have fallen but for [Heinz]126-heinz 's clutch upon [his]99-william collar ; when the punishment was over [he]99-william was brought up trembling and choking . In that moment [he]99-william suffered the fiercest of torments , the fire of an ineffectual hate . [He]99-william hated [Heinz]126-heinz and could have torn [him]126-heinz ; but [he]99-william had been taught the folly of blind wrestling with the stronger and , for [Griselda]104-griselda 's sake , [he]99-william swallowed [his]99-william fury and cringed . " Where is [she]104-griselda ? "[99-william] [he]99-william begged most humbly and pitifully as [Heinz]126-heinz thrust [him]99-william forward again . " For mercy 's sake tell [me]126-heinz what [you]99-william have done with [[my]126-heinz wife]2936-my wife â€” with [[my]126-heinz wife]2936-my wife ? ... If [you]99-william will only let [me]126-heinz know where [she]2936-my wife is ? That 's all â€” just to let [me]126-heinz know . "[126-heinz] [He]99-william was answered by the silence of contempt and a renewed urge along [the road]731-the road ; [he]99-william obeyed because [he]99-william could do no other , whimpering aloud in the misery of this new and sharpest of misfortunes . As [he]99-william pled and whimpered terrible thoughts came hurrying into [his]99-william brain ; all things were possible in these evil times and among [these evil men]1239-these evil men â€” and there was a dreadful , hideously familiar phrase anent " licentious soldiery "[99-william] : a phrase that had once been just a phrase and that was now a present horror beating hard in [his]99-william burning head . [He]99-william stumbled on with the tears running down [his]99-william cheeks , and discovered suddenly that [he]99-william was whispering under [his]99-william breath the name of [God]101-god â€” all things else having failed [him]99-william . [He]99-william did not realize that [he]99-william was sobbing and shedding great tears until halfway along [the road]731-the road when [a German soldier]1241-a german soldier met [them]1242-them . [The man]281-the man as [he]99-william passed turned [his]281-the man head to laugh at the sight of a face grotesque and distorted in its wretchedness ; whereupon there flared up again in [William]99-william that new sense of blood and breed and with it an instant rush of shame that [he]99-william had wept before [these â€” Germans]1244-these â€” germans ! [He]99-william gulped back [his]99-william tears , strove to stiffen [his]99-william face and clenched [his]99-william hands to endure . [He]99-william had need in the hours that came after of all [his]99-william powers of endurance alike of body and of mind . The day that already seemed age - long was far from being at its height when [Griselda]104-griselda was taken away from [him]99-william and all through the heat till close upon sundown [he]99-william was put to hard physical toil . Level with [the village]720-the village the railway line had been torn up and [the little wayside station]1246-the little wayside station was a half - burnt mass of wreckage ; [a detachment of [retreating Belgians]1248-retreating belgians]1247-a detachment of retreating belgians had done [their]1247-a detachment of retreating belgians best to destroy [it]1246-the little wayside station , had derailed an engine and [half a dozen trucks]1249-half a dozen trucks and done such damage as time allowed to a stretch of the permanent way . In [its]1246-the little wayside station turn [a detachment of Germans]1250-a detachment of germans was hard at work at removal of the wreckage and repairs to [the line]1251-the line ; and into [their]1250-a detachment of germans service [they]1250-a detachment of germans had pressed [such villagers]1252-such villagers as had not fled at [their]1250-a detachment of germans approach . [A cowed , unhappy band]1253-a cowed , unhappy band [they]1253-a cowed , unhappy band toiled and sweated , dug , carried loads and levelled the broken soil ; some stupidly submissive , some openly sullen to [[their]1253-a cowed , unhappy band captors]970-their captors , some pitiably eager to please : [all serfs for the time being]1255-all serfs for the time being and all of [them]1253-a cowed , unhappy band ignorant of what the next hour might bring forth of further terror or misfortune . To [this captive little company [William Tully]99-william]1256-this captive little company william tully was joined , handed over by [Heinz]126-heinz to [its taskmaster]1257-its taskmaster â€” to become of [them]1253-a cowed , unhappy band all the most pitiable , because for the first time in all [his]99-william days set to bend [his]99-william back and use [his]99-william muscles in downright labour of the body . What to [others]234-others was merely hardship , to [him]99-william became torment unspeakable ; [he]99-william wearied , [he]99-william sweated , [he]99-william ached from head to heel . When [he]99-william pulled at heavy wreckage [he]99-william cut [his]99-william soft clumsy fingers ; when [he]99-william dragged a load or carried it [he]99-william strained [his]99-william unaccustomed back . [His]99-william hands bled and blistered and the drops of perspiration poured off [him]99-william ; when [he]99-william worked slowly because of [his]99-william weariness or lack of skill , authority made no allowance for either and a blow often followed a curse . Sometimes incomprehensible orders were shouted at [him]99-william and [he]99-william would run to obey confusedly , for fear of the punishment meted out without mercy to [the dilatory]1259-the dilatory â€” guessing at what was required of [him]99-william , sometimes rightly and sometimes wrongly . The day remained on [his]99-william mind as an impression of muddled terror and panic intense and unceasing . When [he]99-william thought [he]99-william was not being watched [he]99-william would lift [his]99-william head from [his]99-william toil and strain [his]99-william eyes this way and that in the hope of a glimpse of [Griselda]104-griselda . Unspeakably greater than [his]99-william fear for [himself]99-william was the measure of [his]99-william fear for [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife . [He]99-william knew that somewhere [she]654-his wife must be held by force in the same way that [he]99-william was held , otherwise [she]654-his wife would have sought [him]99-william out long ere this , and , even if not allowed to approach or speak would have managed to see [him]99-william and make [him]99-william some sign that [his]99-william heart might be set at rest . [His]99-william brain was giddy with undefined horror and once or twice [he]99-william started and raised [his]99-william head imagining that [Griselda]104-griselda was calling to [him]99-william . Once when [he]99-william looked up [his]99-william eye caught [the bluff]1261-the bluff towering over [the valley]585-the valley and [he]99-william remembered with an incredulous shock that it was only yesterday that [he]99-william and [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife , stretched out on [the turf]1264-the turf , had watched the galloping of the ants of [soldiers beneath it]1265-soldiers beneath it â€” that it was not a day since [they]1266-they had listened indifferently to the mutter of guns in the distance and talked with superior detachment of manoeuvres and the folly of militarism . Side by side on [the short - cropped turf]1267-the short - cropped turf [they]1266-they had watched unmoved and listened without misgiving . Only yesterday â€” nay , only this morning when the sun rose â€” [the world]312-the world was [the world]312-the world and not hell . [He]99-william knew though , engrossed by [his]99-william private agony , [he]99-william did not give it much heed , that all the afternoon there was heavy traffic on [the road]731-the road that ran through [the village]720-the village , traffic going this way and that ; now and again through the clatter of the work around [him]99-william its rumble came to [his]99-william ears . [Noisy cars]1272-noisy cars went by and heavy guns , [regiments of infantry]1273-regiments of infantry and once or twice a company of swift - moving horse that sped westward in a flurry of dust . As the hot , industrious hours crawled by even [his]99-william terror for [Griselda]104-griselda was swallowed up in the numbing and all - pervading sense of bodily exhaustion and ill - being , in the consciousness of throbbing head , parched mouth and miserable back . At midday when [the captives]929-the captives were doled out a ration of meat and bread [he]99-william lay like a log for the little space during which [he]99-william was allowed to rest ; and , resting , [he]99-william dreaded from the bottom of [his]99-william soul the inevitable call back to work . With it all was the hopeless , the terrifying sense of isolation ; [he]99-william was removed even from [[his]99-william fellow - sufferers]1275-his fellow - sufferers , held apart from [them]1275-his fellow - sufferers not only by the barrier of [their]1275-his fellow - sufferers alien speech but by [his]99-william greater feebleness and greater physical suffering . Only once during those sun - smitten and aching hours did [he]99-william feel [himself]99-william akin to [any of [the men around [him]99-william]1277-the men around him]1276-any of the men around him â€” when [a flat - capped , sturdy young German soldier]1278-a flat - capped , sturdy young german soldier , taking pity on [his]99-william manifest unfitness for the work , muttered some good - natured , incomprehensible encouragement and handed [him]99-william a bottle to drink from . The sharp taste of beer was a liquid blessing to [William]99-william 's dry tongue and parched throat ; [he]99-william tilted the bottle and drank in great gulps till [he]99-william choked ; whereat [the flat - capped German boy - soldier]1279-the flat - capped german boy - soldier laughed consumedly but not unkindly . It must have been well on in the afternoon â€” for the shadows were beginning to lengthen though the sun burned hotly as ever â€” when over the noises of the toil around [him]99-william and over the rumble of traffic on [the road]731-the road the persistent beat of guns became loud enough to make itself noticeable . All day [William]99-william had heard it at intervals ; during [his]99-william brief rest at midday it had been frequent but distant ; now it had spurted into sudden nearness and was rapid , frequent , continuous . [A little group of [[his]99-william fellow - toilers]1282-his fellow - toilers]1281-a little group of his fellow - toilers looked up from [their]1281-a little group of his fellow - toilers work as [they]1281-a little group of his fellow - toilers heard the sound , drew closer together and exchanged mutterings till an order checked [them]1281-a little group of his fellow - toilers sharply ; and even after the order was rapped out [one square - shouldered , brown - faced countryman]1283-one square - shouldered , brown - faced countryman continued to stare down [the valley]585-the valley with stubbornly determined eyes . [William]99-william 's eyes followed [the countryman]1285-the countryman 's , and for a moment saw nothing but what [he]99-william had seen before â€” [cliffs]1286-cliffs , [the river]549-the river and the hot blue sky , without a feather of cloud to it ; then , suddenly , away down [the valley]585-the valley , there puffed out a ball of white smoke , and before it had faded another . [The man with the stubborn eyes]1289-the man with the stubborn eyes grunted something beneath [his]1289-the man with the stubborn eyes breath and turned again to [his]1289-the man with the stubborn eyes work ; [William]99-william , continuing to gaze curiously at the bursting puffs , was reminded of [his]99-william duties by a louder shout and the threat of a lifted arm . [He]99-william , too , bent again and with haste to [his]99-william work ; to look up furtively as the thunder deepened and see always those bursts of floating cloud down [the valley]585-the valley or against the hot horizon . [He]99-william knew , or rather guessed , in after days when [his]99-william sublime ignorance of all things military had been tempered by the newspapers , by daily war - talk and by actual contact with [the soldier]877-the soldier , that the sudden appearance of those bursting puffs had indicated some temporary and local check to [the advancing German divisions]1292-the advancing german divisions , that [a French or Belgian force]1293-a french or belgian force must have pushed or fought its way across [the triangular plateau between [the Meuse]30-the meuse and [its]30-the meuse tributary]1294-the triangular plateau between the meuse and its tributary ; must have driven before [them]1292-the advancing german divisions [the Germans]108-the germans in the act of occupying [it]1294-the triangular plateau between the meuse and its tributary , must have brought up [their]108-the germans guns and commanded for the moment [a stretch of [the lateral valley]1296-the lateral valley]1295-a stretch of the lateral valley and [the line of communications along [it]1296-the lateral valley]1297-the line of communications along it . [It]1298-it was not left long in unmolested possession thereof ; nearer guns answered it swiftly from all directions , from [other heights]1299-other heights and from [the valley]585-the valley ; shells whined overhead , from time to time the ground shook , and it dawned upon [William]99-william , as [he]99-william looked and listened , that what [he]99-william saw was a battle . At first [he]99-william was more impressed by the thought than [he]99-william was by the actuality â€” since the effects of the conflict were not in the beginning terrible . True there was something threatening in the near - by thudding of [a German battery]1301-a german battery when first it made itself heard . But such harm as it inflicted was unseen by [William]99-william , and for the space of an hour or so it drew no returning fire and [the village]720-the village stood untouched and undamaged . But as the evening drew in the thunder deepened and quickened ; both sides , it would seem , had brought up [reinforcements]1303-reinforcements , and guns opened fire from new and unexpected places , from heights , from behind [garden walls]1304-garden walls . Down [the road along which [William]99-william had been urged with ungentleness by [Heinz]126-heinz [a gun - team]1306-a gun - team]1305-the road along which william had been urged with ungentleness by heinz a gun - team clattered and jingled at breakneck speed ; [it]1306-a gun - team pulled up close to [the railway line]1041-the railway line , not fifty yards from the spot where [the prisoners]1308-the prisoners were working in the shadow of a clump of young trees ; the gun was placed swiftly in position , the horses were led away and after a momentary interval [the men]1309-the men began to fire â€” steadily , swiftly , on the order . [William]99-william watched [them]1309-the men with [his]99-william mouth wide open till reminded smartly of [his]99-william idleness ; [they]1309-the men were so swift , precise and machine - like . It required an effort of the imagination to remember what [they]1309-the men were doing . " Killing , "[99-william] [he]99-william said to [himself]99-william , " [those men]2971-those men are killing ! "[99-william] And [he]99-william found [himself]99-william wondering what [their]1309-the men faces looked like while [they]1309-the men killed ? Whether [they]1309-the men liked doing it ? ... [He]99-william supposed later ( when that first ignorance of things military was a little less sublime ) that the firing from [the immediate neighbourhood of [the village]720-the village]1310-the immediate neighbourhood of the village had at first inflicted but little damage on [the opposing forces on]1312-the opposing forces on [the heights]1313-the heights ; at any rate it remained practically unanswered till close upon sunset , [the French or Belgian gunners]1314-the french or belgian gunners concentrating [their]1314-the french or belgian gunners fire upon enemies nearer , more aggressive , or more vulnerably placed . Perhaps ( [he]99-william never knew for certain ) [they]1309-the men had got the better , for the time being , of [those other more aggressive or more vulnerable opponents]1315-those other more aggressive or more vulnerable opponents ; perhaps [they]1309-the men had received reinforcements which had enabled [them]1309-the men to push higher up [the valley]585-the valley or had at last been punished by a fire hitherto ineffectual ; whatever the cause , as the sun grew red to the westward , a first shell screamed on to [the dusty road]1317-the dusty road outside [the village]720-the village and burst in a pother of smoke and flying clods . [William]99-william heard the burst and saw the cloud rise ; [he]99-william was still round - eyed when another shell screamed overhead to find its billet in a garden wall a few yards behind [the battery]1319-the battery , scattering the stones thereof and splintering the boughs of an apple - tree . A shower of broken fragments came pattering about [the station]541-the station ; [William]99-william was perhaps too much stupefied by pain and weariness to understand the extent of [his]99-william danger but [several of [[his]99-william fellows]1322-his fellows]1321-several of his fellows stirred uneasily and two of [them]1321-several of his fellows threw down [their]1321-several of his fellows spades and started in headlong flight . [They]1309-the men were brought up swiftly by the threat of a bayonet in [their]1309-the men path ; one of [them]1309-the men came back sullenly dumb , [the other]246-the other whimpering aloud with a hand pressed to [his]246-the other face . [William]99-william saw that [his]99-william cheek was bleeding where a flying fragment had caught it . [He]99-william was looking at [the man]281-the man as [he]99-william nursed [his]99-william torn face and bemoaned [himself]99-william when a third shell struck what remained of [the station roof]1325-the station roof . [William]99-william did not know whether [he]99-william fell on [his]99-william face instinctively or was thrown by the force of the explosion ; [he]99-william remembered only that as [he]99-william scrambled to [his]99-william feet , half - deafened and crying for help , [he]99-william saw through a settling cloud of dust the disappearing backs of [some three or four men who were all of [them]1326-some three or four men who were all of them running away from him running away from [him]99-william]1326-some three or four men who were all of them running away from him . [He]99-william was seized with a mortal terror of being left alone in this torment of thunder and disaster ; [he]99-william believed [he]99-william must be hurt , perhaps hurt to the death , and a pang of rage and self - pity went through [him]99-william at the thought of [his]99-william desertion by [[his]99-william fellows]1322-his fellows . [He]99-william started after the vanishing backs , calling out to [them]1322-his fellows to wait , abusing and appealing , and stumbling over ruin as [he]99-william ran . [The distant gunners]1328-the distant gunners had found [[their]1328-the distant gunners enemies]1329-their enemies ' range , and [he]99-william had not made half a dozen yards when [he]99-william ducked to the threat of another shell that burst , as [he]99-william thought , close beside [him]99-william . [He]99-william cringed and shivered for a moment , covering [his]99-william eyes with [his]99-william hands ; then , finding [himself]99-william uninjured , darted off at an angle , still shielding [his]99-william eyes and gasping out , " [God]101-god , oh [God]101-god â€” for mercy 's sake , [oh God]2972-oh god ! "[99-william] [He]99-william knew in every fibre of [his]99-william trembling body that [he]99-william was about to die , and [his]99-william prayer was meant not only for [himself]99-william but for [Griselda]104-griselda . As [he]99-william ran on blindly , an animal wild and unreasoning , a hand caught [him]99-william above the ankle and [he]99-william screamed aloud with rage and terror at finding [himself]99-william held fast . " Let [me]99-william go , "[99-william] [he]99-william cried struggling ; then , as the hand still gripped , bent down to wrest [himself]99-william free and looked into a face that [he]99-william knew â€” [a young plump face with a budding moustache surmounted by a flat German cap]1330-a young plump face with a budding moustache surmounted by a flat german cap . It was twisted now into a grin of agony , but all the same [he]99-william recognized the face of [[the German boy]1331-the german boy - soldier who had dealt kindly with [him]99-william that afternoon in the matter of the bottle of beer]1332-the german boy - soldier who had dealt kindly with him that afternoon in the matter of the bottle of beer . [He]1331-the german boy was lying on [his]1331-the german boy back and covered from the middle downwards with a litter of broken beam and ironwork blown away from the ruin of [the station]541-the station . The effect of the recognition on [William]99-william was curiously and instantly sobering ; [he]99-william was no longer alone in the hell where the ground reeled and [men]368-men ran from [him]99-william ; [he]99-william was no longer an animal wild and unreasoning , but [a man with a definite human relationship to [the boy]622-the boy lying broken at [his]99-william feet]1335-a man with a definite human relationship to the boy lying broken at his feet . [He]99-william began to lift the wreckage from the crushed legs and talked as [he]99-william did so , forgetting that [the wounded man]1337-the wounded man in all likelihood understood not a word of [his]99-william English . " All right , [I]1338-i 'll get it off , [I]1338-i 'll help [you]622-the boy . [You]622-the boy were good to [me]1338-i giving [me]1338-i a drink , so [I]1338-i 'll stay and help [you]622-the boy . Otherwise [I]1338-i ought n't to wait , not a minute â€” [you]622-the boy see , [I]1338-i must look for [[my]1338-i wife]2936-my wife . [My]1338-i first duty is to [her]2936-my wife â€” [she]2936-my wife 's [[my]1338-i wife]2936-my wife and [I]1338-i do n't know where [she]2936-my wife is . But [I]1338-i wo n't leave [you]622-the boy like this because of what [you]622-the boy did for [me]1338-i this afternoon . "[1338-i] [He]1338-i wrenched and tugged at the shattered and entangled wreckage till [the boy]622-the boy shrieked aloud in [his]622-the boy torment â€” the cry terrified [William]99-william and [he]99-william desisted , wringing [his]99-william hands . " [I]1338-i 'm sorry , [I]1338-i 'm sorry , but [I]1338-i could n't help it . [God]101-god knows [I]1338-i did n't mean to hurt [you]622-the boy and if [I]1338-i could be gentler [I]1338-i would , but it 's so damnably , damnably heavy . Oh God , if [some one]2838-some one would come and help [me]1338-i , if [someone]2976-someone would only come ! [You]622-the boy see it 's so heavy [I]1338-i ca n't move it without hurting [you]622-the boy . "[1338-i] [He]1338-i explained and apologized to ears that heard not for [the boy]622-the boy had fainted in [his]622-the boy pain ; [his]622-the boy deep unconsciousness made extrication easier and [William]99-william tugged again at the lumber until [he]99-william had tugged it away . One of [the wounded man]1337-the wounded man 's leg 's was a wrenched and bloody mass ; [William]99-william shuddered at the sight , looked down stupidly at the dead white face and wondered what was to be done â€” then , feeling that something must at least be tried , put [his]99-william arms round the inert body and strove to lift [it]1342-it from the ground . The only results were breathlessness on [his]99-william part and a groan from [the unconscious German]123-the german . [William]99-william dropped [him]622-the boy instantly on hearing the groan , trembling at the idea of inflicting yet more suffering , torn by the thought of [Griselda]104-griselda , longing to go and yet ashamed to leave [the boy - soldier without aid]1343-the boy - soldier without aid . [He]99-william might have hesitated longer but a for fresh explosion and crash of falling masonry ; it was followed by a long - drawn screaming intolerable to hear â€” an Aie , Aie , [Aie of unspeakable bodily pain]1344-aie of unspeakable bodily pain . With a sudden sense of being hunted , being driven beyond endurance , [William]99-william turned and shook [his]99-william impotent fists in the direction of the unseen guns . " Ca n't [you]1345-you stop one moment ? "[99-william] [he]99-william screamed idiotically , hating [them]1345-you and dancing with rage . " Ca n't [you]1345-you stop , [[you]1345-you devils]2977-you devils â€” [[you]1345-you devils]2977-you devils ! Do n't [you]1345-you see [I]99-william 'm only trying to help [him]99-william ? "[99-william] If [he]99-william had ever made any distinction between [friend]1346-friend and [enemy artillery]1347-enemy artillery , [he]99-william had lost all idea of it now ; the guns for the moment were a private persecution of [himself]99-william , and [he]99-william was conscious only of being foully and brutally bullied by monstrous forces with whom [he]99-william argued and at whom [he]99-william cursed and spat . It was the sight of what had once been a horse that brought [him]99-william again to [his]99-william senses . [His]99-william eye fell on it as [he]99-william danced in [his]99-william mad ineptitude at the side of [the helpless German]1348-the helpless german ; it had been one of [the team that galloped a gun down [the by - road]1350-the by - road]1349-the team that galloped a gun down the by - road and was now [a pulp of raw flesh , crushed bone , and most hideously scattered entrail]1351-a pulp of raw flesh , crushed bone , and most hideously scattered entrail . [He]99-william stared for a moment at the horror , incredulous and frozen â€” then sickened , turned and ran from it in a passion of physical loathing . For a minute or two [he]99-william ran [he]99-william knew not whither â€” straight ahead , anywhere to be away from the horror ; then , as [his]99-william shuddering sickness passed , there rushed back the thought of [Griselda]104-griselda , and [he]99-william reproached [himself]99-william that [he]99-william had halted even for a moment and even for a purpose of mercy ; all [his]99-william energies both of mind and body were turned to the finding of [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife . [They]1353-they must die , [he]99-william was sure of it ; [he]99-william prayed only that [they]1353-they died together . The way [he]99-william had taken lay outside [the walled gardens between [the village]720-the village and [the railway line]1041-the railway line]1354-the walled gardens between the village and the railway line ; and as [he]99-william ran [he]99-william called herâ€”"Griselda , [Griselda!"â€”in]131-griselda!"â€”in[99-william] a voice that [he]99-william hardly caught [himself]99-william , so persistent was the uproar of the guns . When [he]99-william fled from the neighbourhood of the dismembered horse [he]99-william had left behind [him]99-william [the path leading directly to [the main street of [the village]720-the village]1358-the main street of the village]1357-the path leading directly to the main street of the village â€” which it was [his]99-william aim to reach since there [he]99-william had last seen [Griselda]104-griselda . Seeking another way to [it]1360-it , [he]99-william halted when [he]99-william came to a door in the wall , wrestled with the latch and flung [himself]99-william angrily against it ; it resisted , locked , and [he]99-william ran on again , still panting out [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's dear name . Twenty yards further on [he]99-william came to another door in the wall and this time it opened to [his]99-william hand . In [the garden beyond]1362-the garden beyond was no sign of the chaos that had overwhelmed [his]99-william world since the morning . An orderly border of orderly flowers , espaliered walls and a tree or two ruddy with apples ; and on [a shaven plot of the greenest grass]1363-a shaven plot of the greenest grass an empty basket chair with beside it a white cat reposing with [her]1364-her paws tucked under [her]1364-her chin . The white cat may have been deaf , or [she]1364-her may have been merely intrepid ; whatever the cause [her]1364-her nerves were unaffected by the fury of conflict and [she]1364-her dozed serenely under shell - fire , the embodiment of comfortable dignity . [She]1364-her opened a warily observant eye when [William]99-william rushed into [[her]1364-her garden]1365-her garden ; but being a well - fed cat , and accustomed to deference , [she]1364-her took no further precaution . [She]1364-her stirred not even when [he]99-william hurried past [her]1364-her to [[her]1364-her dwelling - house]1366-her dwelling - house , and as [he]99-william entered [it]1366-her dwelling - house by an open window [her]1364-her nose descended to rest on [her]1364-her folded paws . [The room [he]99-william ran into through the open window]1367-the room he ran into through the open window left no impression on the mind of [William Tully]99-william ; [it]1367-the room he ran into through the open window was dark after the sunlight outside , and [he]99-william supposed [it]1367-the room he ran into through the open window must have been empty . [He]99-william went rapidly along [the short passage beyond]1368-the short passage beyond [it]1367-the room he ran into through the open window , making for the front door ; [he]99-william met [no one]204-no one , heard [no one]204-no one , and [his]99-william fingers were touching the latch when [he]99-william saw , through an open door to the right of [him]99-william , the figure of [a kneeling woman]1371-a kneeling woman . [She]1371-a kneeling woman was stout , dressed in black and grey - headed and [she]1371-a kneeling woman knelt leaning on a chair in the middle of the polished floor ; [her]1371-a kneeling woman eyes were closed , [her]1371-a kneeling woman lips moved , and [her]1371-a kneeling woman hands were clasped under [her]1371-a kneeling woman chin . The sound of [William]99-william 's feet did not reach [her]1371-a kneeling woman through the tumult of fighting without , nor did [he]99-william stay to disturb [her]1371-a kneeling woman . When [he]99-william lived in [the world]312-the world and not hell it would have seemed to [him]99-william strange and unfitting that [he]99-william should intrude on [an old woman]1373-an old woman 's privacy and secret prayer ; now nothing was strange , nothing unfitting or impossible .... [He]99-william supposed that [she]1371-a kneeling woman was [[the white cat]1374-the white cat 's mistress]1375-the white cat 's mistress , noted without emotion that [her]1371-a kneeling woman cheeks were wet with tears and thought vaguely that [her]1371-a kneeling woman face was familiar , that [he]99-william had seen it somewhere before . Afterwards it came to [him]99-william that [he]99-william had seen it when [the hostages]960-the hostages died in the morning , that it was [she]1371-a kneeling woman who had prayed in [the road]731-the road with folded hands and pressed [her]1371-a kneeling woman crucifix to [the mayor]1125-the mayor 's long grey moustache . [He]99-william wondered , then , what became of [her]1371-a kneeling woman and [her]1371-a kneeling woman well - fed indifferent cat . That was afterwards , many weeks afterwards ; for the time being [he]99-william had no interest to give [her]1371-a kneeling woman , [his]99-william thoughts were only of [Griselda]104-griselda and the means by which [she]1371-a kneeling woman might be found . [His]99-william plan , so far as it could be called a plan , was to run from [house]1015-house to [house]1015-house in [the village street]1381-the village street until [he]99-william came to [the place where [she]1371-a kneeling woman was captive]1382-the place where she was captive ; but when [he]99-william stepped into [the road]731-the road it was to find it impossible of passage by reason of [the men]1309-the men and vehicles that choked [the stretch in front of [him]99-william]1385-the stretch in front of him . Almost opposite the door [he]99-william came through , [a motor - ambulance]1386-a motor - ambulance , going eastward with its load , had collided with [an ammunition wagon]1387-an ammunition wagon going west , thus bringing to a standstill [more ammunition wagons]1388-more ammunition wagons and [a battery of horse - artillery]1389-a battery of horse - artillery , its foremost ranks thrown back in confusion by a threatening skid of [the ambulance]1390-the ambulance . There was much whistling , and shouting of orders in the attempt to reform and clear [the road]731-the road ; horses reared from the suddenness with which [they]1392-they were pulled up and [men]368-men ran to [their]368-men heads to steady [them]1392-they . While the locked wheels were wrestled with , a bandaged bloody face peered round the tail of [the ambulance]1390-the ambulance ; the press swayed to and fro , filling [the road]731-the road from side to side , and [William]99-william , unable to move , flattened back against the door from which [he]99-william had issued , out of reach of the wicked heels of a restive horse . For the first moment [he]99-william expected [some one]2838-some one to seize and arrest [him]99-william , and had [he]99-william not unthinkingly closed the door behind [him]99-william [he]99-william would have beat a hasty retreat ; but there was bloodier and busier work on hand than the corraling of [stray civilians]1397-stray civilians , and [no man]1398-no man touched or questioned [him]99-william as [he]99-william pressed [himself]99-william against the neat green - painted door . Struggling with [their]1399-them own most urgent concerns , not [a soldier]2909-a soldier so much as noticed [him]99-william ; and it was borne in on [William]99-william that if the wicked heels had caught [him]99-william and kicked [his]99-william life out , [not a man]1401-not a man would have noticed that either . Further down [the street]983-the street was a cloud of slowly rising black smoke â€” and suddenly through it a banner of flame leaped up and waved triumphantly ; one of [the tidy two - storied houses]1403-the tidy two - storied houses had been set afire by a shell . As [William]99-william watched the resplendent flare the crowd round [the two vehicles]1404-the two vehicles composed itself into something like order , and [the ambulance]1390-the ambulance â€” [its driver]1406-its driver , by the excited movements of [his]1406-its driver mouth , still shouting out angry explanations â€” was backed from the path of [the advancing troops]1407-the advancing troops and thrust crippled against the wall . The guns on one side of [the road]731-the road , [the wagons on the other]1409-the wagons on the other stirred forward â€” at first slowly , then , as the line straightened itself out , with a rattle of increasing speed . As [they]1399-them passed [the house]641-the house afire the smoke rolled down on [them]1399-them and hid [them]1399-them from [William]99-william 's sight . With the conviction that [no one]204-no one was heeding [his]99-william comings and goings , a certain amount of assurance came back to [William Tully]99-william , and as the way cleared before [him]99-william [he]99-william set off down [the street]983-the street without any attempt at concealment . By [house]1015-house to [house]1015-house visitation [he]99-william sought for [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife through [the village]720-the village ; it was there [she]654-his wife had been taken from [him]99-william , and [he]99-william thrust back the deadly suspicion that [she]654-his wife need not have remained in the place where [she]654-his wife had disappeared from [his]99-william sight . There was not a closed door in the length of [the street]983-the street , and nowhere was [his]99-william entrance barred ; the call to arms had temporarily cleared [the houses of [the invaders]1419-the invaders quartered in [them]1418-the houses of the invaders quartered in them]1418-the houses of the invaders quartered in them , and [he]99-william ran from one doorway to another unhindered , calling on [Griselda]104-griselda as [he]99-william entered , looking into [every room]1420-every room , and then out to repeat the process . [The two first houses]1421-the two first houses were empty from garret to [cellar]1422-cellar , but with signs of having been left , recently and hurriedly , by [the soldiers billeted therein]1423-the soldiers billeted therein ; odds and ends of military kit were scattered about , chairs overturned and left lying ; and in [one room]1424-one room , [a kitchen]1425-a kitchen , on a half - extinguished fire , a blackened frizzle of meat in a frying - pan filled the air with a smell of burning . [The third house]1426-the third house [he]99-william thought likewise empty ; [downstairs]1427-downstairs there was the same litter â€” overthrown furniture and food half eaten on the table ; but opening the door of [an upper room]1428-an upper room [he]99-william came on [a woman with [three children]1430-three children]1429-a woman with three children . [The woman]1180-the woman started to [her]1180-the woman feet as the door opened , [a child]259-a child hugged to [her]1180-the woman bosom and other two clinging to [her]1180-the woman skirt ; and [William]99-william had a passing impression of [a plump , pallid face with lips apart and wide , wet eyes , half - imploring and half - defiant]1433-a plump , pallid face with lips apart and wide , wet eyes , half - imploring and half - defiant . One of [the children]1434-the children was crying â€” its mouth was rounded in a roar â€” but [you]1435-you heard nothing of its vigorous plaint for the louder din without . [William]99-william made a gesture that [he]99-william meant to be reassuring , shut the door and ran back into [the street]983-the street . [He]99-william went in and out desperately , like [a creature hunted or hunting]1437-a creature hunted or hunting ; and , having drawn blank in [house]1015-house after [house]1015-house , the deadly thought refused to be thrust and kept under . If [they]1440-they had taken [her]1429-a woman with three children away , [she]1429-a woman with three children might be ... anywhere ! [East or west]1441-east or west , gone in any direction , and leaving no clue for [her]1429-a woman with three children following . Anywhere in [a blind incomprehensible world]1442-a blind incomprehensible world , where [men]368-men killed [men]368-men and might was right , and life , as [he]99-william knew it from [his]99-william childhood up , had ended in an orgy of devilry ! [He]99-william went on running from [house]1015-house to [house]1015-house , while shells screamed and burst and guns clattered by , and [no man]1398-no man gave heed to [his]99-william running or the tumult and torture of [his]99-william fears . [Upstairs]255-upstairs and down and out again â€” [upstairs]255-upstairs and down and out . [He]99-william was nearing the end of [the street]983-the street when [he]99-william found [her]1429-a woman with three children at last ; in [the upper back room of [a little white house some yards beyond [the building]251-the building in flames , and not far from the spot where [they]1454-they had seen [the hostages]960-the hostages die]1452-a little white house some yards beyond the building in flames , and not far from the spot where they had seen the hostages die]1451-the upper back room of a little white house some yards beyond the building in flames , and not far from the spot where they had seen the hostages die . [She]1429-a woman with three children was alone and did not move when [he]99-william flung the door open ; crouched in a corner with [her]1429-a woman with three children head on [her]1429-a woman with three children knees , [she]1429-a woman with three children neither saw nor heard [him]99-william . For an instant it seemed to [him]99-william that [his]99-william strength would fail [him]99-william for gladness , and [he]99-william staggered and held to the door ; as the giddiness passed [he]99-william ran to [her]1429-a woman with three children , babbling inaudible relief , and pulled the hands from [her]1429-a woman with three children face . [He]99-william had an instant 's glimpse of it , white and tear - marked , with swollen lips and red eyes ; then , as [his]99-william arms went round [her]1429-a woman with three children and [he]99-william had [her]1429-a woman with three children up from the floor , it went down on [his]99-william shoulder and was hidden . [He]99-william felt [her]1429-a woman with three children clinging to [him]99-william , trembling against [him]99-william , sobbing against [him]99-william while [he]99-william held [her]1429-a woman with three children â€” and all [his]99-william soul was a passion of endearment and thankfulness .... So for a minute or two â€” perhaps longer â€” [they]1456-they clung to [each other]351-each other , reunited : until [William]99-william , [his]99-william sense of [their]1456-they peril returning , sought to urge [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife to the door . [She]1429-a woman with three children came with [him]99-william for a step or two , [her]1429-a woman with three children head still on [his]99-william shoulder ; then , suddenly , [she]1429-a woman with three children shivered and wrestled in [his]99-william arms , thrust [him]99-william from [her]1429-a woman with three children , rushed back to the end of [the room]778-the room and leaned against it , shaking with misery . [Her]1429-a woman with three children arm was raised over [her]1429-a woman with three children hidden face and pressed against the wall ; and [he]99-william saw what [he]99-william had not seen before , that the sleeve was torn and the flesh near the wrist bruised and reddened . [He]99-william saw also â€” [his]99-william eyes being opened â€” that it was not only [her]1429-a woman with three children hair that was tumbled ; all [her]1429-a woman with three children dress was disordered and awry . There was another tear under the armpit where the sleeve had given way and the white of [her]1429-a woman with three children underlinen showed through the gap .... [His]99-william heart cried out to [him]99-william that [she]1429-a woman with three children had struggled merely as [a captive]1460-a captive , had been restrained by brute force from escaping â€” but [his]99-william own eyes had seen that [she]1429-a woman with three children turned from [him]99-william as if there was a barrier between [them]1461-them , as if there was something to hide that yet [she]1429-a woman with three children wished [him]99-william to know .... For a moment [he]99-william fought with the certainty , and then it came down on [him]99-william like a storm : for once in [his]99-william life [his]99-william imagination was vivid , and [he]99-william saw with the eyes of [his]99-william mind as clearly as with the eyes of [his]99-william body . All the details , the animal details , [her]1429-a woman with three children cries and [her]1429-a woman with three children pitiful wrestlings ; and the phrase " licentious soldiery "[99-william] personified in the face of [the man who had been [[Griselda]104-griselda 's gaoler]1463-griselda 's gaoler]1462-the man who had been griselda 's gaoler . After that [he]99-william could not remember what [he]99-william felt or how long [he]99-william stood in the middle of [the room]778-the room , oblivious of danger and staring at [her]1429-a woman with three children heaving shoulders and the tumbled hair that covered them ; but it seemed to [him]99-william that [he]99-william talked and moved [his]99-william hands and hated â€” and did not know what to do . "[99-william] [He]99-william told [her]1429-a woman with three children [he]99-william thought so , that now was the time when [they]1465-they might slip away unnoticed â€” trying to encourage [her]1429-a woman with three children by the assumption of a greater confidence than [he]99-william felt . [Fortune]132-fortune favoured [them]1465-they , however , and the assumption of confidence was justified ; though the bombardment had slackened as suddenly as it had begun , [the remnant of [German soldiery]1469-german soldiery left in [the place]594-the place]1468-the remnant of german soldiery left in the place was still too much occupied with its own concerns to interfere with [a couple of civilians seeking safety in the rear of [the fire - zone]1472-the fire - zone]1471-a couple of civilians seeking safety in the rear of the fire - zone , and [no one]204-no one paid any heed to [them]1465-they as [they]1465-they made [their]1465-they way along [the street]983-the street . [They]1465-they turned inevitably westward â€” away from the guns â€” down [the road]731-the road [they]1465-they had come that morning : [two hunted , dishevelled little figures]1476-two hunted , dishevelled little figures , keeping well to the wall and glancing over [their]1465-they shoulders . [The crush of wagons , of guns]1477-the crush of wagons , of guns and [men]368-men , had moved forward and out of [the village]720-the village , which , for the moment , seemed clear of all but [non - combatants]1480-non - combatants â€” save for [the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in [his]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust dust]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust . [An ambulance]1482-an ambulance was discharging [its]1482-an ambulance load at [a building]1483-a building whence waved [the Red Cross]133-the red cross , and near at hand , but out of sight , a battery was thudding regularly ; but of [the few uniformed figures in [the street]983-the street]1484-the few uniformed figures in the street itself there was none whose business it was to interest [himself]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust in [their]1465-they movements . [They]1465-they hurried on , clinging to [each other]351-each other and hugging the wall â€” except when a heap of fallen brickwork , [a derelict vehicle]1487-a derelict vehicle or other obstacle forced [them]1465-they out into [the road]731-the road . [They]1465-they were almost at the entry of [the village]720-the village when [they]1465-they came upon such an obstacle : the upper part of [one of [the endmost houses]1491-the endmost houses]1490-one of the endmost houses had evidently been struck by a shell , for a large slice of roof and outside wall had crumbled to the pathway below . It had crumbled but recently , since the dust was still clouding thickly above [the ruin]1492-the ruin and veiling [the roadway]1493-the roadway beyond [it]1492-the ruin ; hence , as [they]1465-they skirted [its]1492-the ruin borders , it was not until [he]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust was actually upon [them]1465-they that [they]1465-they were aware of [a motor - cyclist]1494-a motor - cyclist speeding furiously out of the dusk . The roar of the battery a few yards away had drowned the whirr of [his]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust machine , and [Griselda]104-griselda was almost under it before [she]104-griselda had warning of its coming . [The stooping rider]1495-the stooping rider yelled and swerved , but not enough to avoid [her]104-griselda ; [she]104-griselda went down , flung sideways , while [the cyclist]1496-the cyclist almost ran on to the heap of rubble on [his]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust right â€” then , recovering [his]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust balance , dashed forward and was lost in the dusk . Save for that momentary swerve and stagger , [he]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust had passed like a bolt on [his]1481-the ubiquitous cyclist who dashed backwards and forwards in his dust errand , leaving [Griselda]104-griselda crumpled in [the road]731-the road at [William]99-william 's feet . To [his]99-william mind , no doubt , a mishap most luckily avoided . [Griselda]104-griselda lay without moving , [her]104-griselda face to the dust , and for one tortured moment [William]99-william thought the life beaten out of [her]104-griselda ; but when [he]99-william raised [her]104-griselda , [her]104-griselda lips moved , as if in a moan , and as [he]99-william dragged [her]104-griselda for safety to the side of [the road]731-the road [she]104-griselda turned [her]104-griselda head on [his]99-william arm . [He]99-william laid [her]104-griselda down while [he]99-william ran for water from [the river]549-the river ; panted to its brim , soaked [his]99-william handkerchief for lack of a cup , brought it back and pressed it to [her]104-griselda forehead . [Her]104-griselda eyes , when [she]104-griselda opened them , were glazed with pain and [her]104-griselda lips drawn tightly to [her]104-griselda teeth ; when [he]99-william wanted to raise [her]104-griselda to a sitting position [she]104-griselda caught [his]99-william hand thrust it from [her]104-griselda and lay with [her]104-griselda white face working . So [she]104-griselda lay , for minutes that seemed hours , with [[her]104-griselda husband]787-her husband kneeling beside [her]104-griselda .... [Men]368-men passed [them]1502-them but stayed not ; and once , when [William]99-william looked up , [a car]1129-a car was speeding by with [helmeted officers inside [it]1129-a car]1504-helmeted officers inside it â€” too intent on [their]1502-them own hasty business of death to have so much as a glance to spare for [a woman in agony of bodily pain]1505-a woman in agony of bodily pain and [a man in agony of mind]1506-a man in agony of mind . The night had come down before [Griselda]104-griselda was able to move . With its fall the near - by battery was silenced and the distant thunder less frequent ; so that [William]99-william was able to hear [her]104-griselda when [she]104-griselda spoke and asked [him]99-william to lift [her]104-griselda . [He]99-william sobbed for joy as [he]99-william lifted [her]104-griselda , gently and trembling lest [he]99-william hurt [her]104-griselda ; [she]104-griselda sat leaning on [his]99-william arm , breathing painfully and telling [him]99-william in jerks that it was [her]104-griselda side that pained [her]104-griselda most â€” [her]104-griselda left side and [her]104-griselda left arm , but most of all [her]104-griselda side . At first [she]104-griselda seemed dazed and conscious only of [her]104-griselda sufferings â€” whimpered about [them]1507-them pitifully with intervals of silence â€” but after ten minutes or so [she]104-griselda caught [his]99-william sleeve and tugged it . " Let 's get away . Help [me]104-griselda up ! "[104-griselda] [He]99-william suggested that [she]104-griselda should rest a little longer , but [she]104-griselda urged [him]99-william with trembling , " Let 's get away ! "[104-griselda] and [he]99-william had perforce to raise [her]104-griselda . In spite of the fever for flight that had taken possession of [her]104-griselda [she]104-griselda cried out as [he]99-william helped [her]104-griselda to [her]104-griselda feet and stood swaying with [her]104-griselda eyes shut and [her]104-griselda teeth bitten hard together . " [You]99-william must n't press [my]1508-they side â€” [I]1508-they ca n't bear it . Behind [them]1508-they at first was the red light from [burning houses]1511-burning houses ; but as [they]1508-they crawled onwards the darkness of [the valley]585-the valley closed in on [them]1508-they until , in the sombre shadow of [the cliff]980-the cliff , [William]99-william could only distinguish [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's face as a whitish patch upon [his]99-william shoulder . When [she]104-griselda groaned , as [she]104-griselda did from time to time , [he]99-william halted to give [her]104-griselda relief , but [she]104-griselda would never allow [him]99-william to stand for more than a minute or two ; after a few painful breaths there would come the tug of [her]104-griselda fingers at [his]99-william coat that was the sign to move forward again . Once or twice [she]104-griselda whispered to know if [any one]237-any one were coming after [them]1508-they , and [he]99-william could feel [her]104-griselda whole body a - quiver with fear at the thought . Barred in by [cliff to right]1516-cliff to right and [river]1517-river to left , [they]1508-they kept perforce to [the road]731-the road â€” or , rather , to [the turf that bordered [it]731-the road]1519-the turf that bordered it . The traffic on [the road]731-the road itself had not ceased with the falling of night ; [cars]1521-cars were coming up and guns were coming up and [the valley]585-the valley was alive with [their]1508-they rumble â€” and at every passing [Griselda]104-griselda shrank and [her]104-griselda fingers shivered in [their]1508-they grip upon [William]99-william 's sleeve . " It 's [all cliff]2980-all cliff â€” and [the river on the other side]2981-the river on the other side . "[99-william] [She]104-griselda had known it without asking ; there was nothing for it but to drag [herself]104-griselda along . To both the distance was never - ending ; [Griselda]104-griselda 's terror of recapture communicated itself to [[her]104-griselda husband]787-her husband , and [he]99-william shivered even as [she]104-griselda did at the rattle of [a passing car]1525-a passing car . Instinctively [they]1508-they kept to the shadow , stumbling in its blackness over [the uneven ground below [the cliff]980-the cliff]1526-the uneven ground below the cliff . Once , when [a couple of [patrolling horsemen]1529-patrolling horsemen]1528-a couple of patrolling horsemen halted near [them]1508-they in [the roadway]1493-the roadway , [they]1508-they crouched and held [their]1508-they breath during an eternity of dreadful seconds while [they]1508-they prayed that [they]1508-they had not been noticed . It seemed to [William]99-william that [his]99-william heart stopped beating when one of [the horsemen]738-the horsemen walked [his]99-william beast a yard or two nearer and flashed a light into [their]1508-they faces ; but [the man]281-the man , having surveyed [them]1508-they , turned away indifferently and followed [[his]281-the man comrade]913-his comrade down [the road]731-the road .
