" [The woods]671-the woods , "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda whispered . [They]1508-they turned into [the woods]671-the woods and took cover ; and , with a yard or two , the blackness under the trees had closed in on [them]1508-they , blotting out all things from sight . [They]1508-they halted because [they]1508-they could see to walk no further . " Let [me]104-griselda down , "[104-griselda] [Griselda]104-griselda said â€” and [[her]104-griselda husband]787-her husband knew by the gasp in [her]104-griselda voice that [she]104-griselda was at the end of [her]104-griselda powers of endurance . [He]787-her husband explored with an outstretched hand for a tree trunk and lowered [her]104-griselda gently to the ground with [her]104-griselda back supported against it ; [she]104-griselda panted relief as [he]787-her husband sat down beside [her]104-griselda and groped for [her]104-griselda fingers in the darkness .... So [they]1508-they sat holding to [each other]351-each other and enveloped in thickest night . The guns had died down altogether , and the rumble from [the road]731-the road , though almost continuous was dulled â€” so that [William]99-william could hear [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's uneven breathing and the stealthy whisper of the trees . [He]99-william sat holding [Griselda]104-griselda 's hand and staring into the blackness , [a man]397-a man dazed and confounded ; who yesterday was [happy lover]1544-happy lover and [self - respecting citizen and to - day]1545-self - respecting citizen and to - day had suffered stripes , been [slave and fugitive]1546-slave and fugitive , learned the evil wrought on [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife . Thinking on it afterwards , [he]99-william wondered that [he]99-william had closed an eye ; yet [he]99-william had sat in the darkness but a very few minutes when , swiftly and without warning , [he]99-william fell into a heavy sleep . [He]99-william woke with the blaze of the eastern sun in [his]99-william eyes , and on the first sensation of bewilderment at finding [his]99-william bed was moss , came a rush of remembrance and with it self - reproach â€” [he]99-william had slept while [Griselda]104-griselda suffered . [He]99-william knelt and bent over [her]104-griselda as [she]104-griselda lay still asleep , huddled on [her]104-griselda right side ; [her]104-griselda face was flushed , [her]104-griselda lips were cracked , and [she]104-griselda was breathing in heavy little snorts . As [he]99-william knelt and gazed the thunder of yesterday broke out in the distance , and [Griselda]104-griselda stirred and woke moaning . [Her]104-griselda first cry was for water , and in the insistence of [her]104-griselda thirst [she]104-griselda was oblivious of everything but [her]104-griselda burning need to slake it ; [he]99-william broke cover and ran to [the stream]598-the stream , some fifty yards away , soaked [his]99-william handkerchief and made a tight cup of [his]99-william hands . The cup was a failure , and the little that was left in it when [he]99-william reached [Griselda]104-griselda was spilled when [she]104-griselda tried to drink ; but the dripping handkerchief [she]104-griselda sucked at eagerly and gave back for another soaking . [He]99-william was about to break cover to wet it again when [he]99-william caught sight first of one , then of [half - a - dozen horsemen]1549-half - a - dozen horsemen entering [the valley by the gap]1550-the valley by the gap ; and shrank back , cowering , into the friendly shelter of the tree - trunks â€” sick with uncertainty as to whether or no [they]1549-half - a - dozen horsemen had seen [him]99-william . [He]99-william judged not when [he]99-william saw [them]1549-half - a - dozen horsemen dismount and picket [their]1549-half - a - dozen horsemen horses ; and having watched [them]1549-half - a - dozen horsemen long enough to see that [they]1549-half - a - dozen horsemen were making preparations for a meal , [he]99-william turned and crept back to [Griselda]104-griselda . The terror of yesterday came down on [her]104-griselda when [she]104-griselda heard [his]99-william whispered news . A moment before [she]104-griselda had seemed incapable of movement , [lain]134-lain crumpled on [her]104-griselda side and repulsed , with a feverish pettishness , [his]99-william efforts to stir and raise [her]104-griselda ; now [she]104-griselda clung to [him]99-william and struggled to [her]104-griselda feet , even pain forgotten in the passion for instant flight . So , holding together , [they]1551-they fled again : fled crawling , [they]1551-they knew not whither . Two instincts guided [them]1551-they and directed [their]1551-they stumbling footsteps : the instinct to leave far behind [them]1551-they the threat of the guns and the instinct to keep out of sight . Thus [they]1551-they held to [the woods above [the valley of silence]1536-the valley of silence]1552-the woods above the valley of silence , avoiding all paths that led out into the open ; [their]1551-they direction , roughly , was southward â€” though [they]1551-they did not know it â€” and [they]1551-they dragged a mile , or even less , where [a man in health]1554-a man in health might make five . When [they]1551-they had gone some few hundred yards [they]1551-they struck [the trickle of [a hill - side rivulet]1556-a hill - side rivulet on its way to join [the stream]598-the stream in [the valley]585-the valley]1555-the trickle of a hill - side rivulet on its way to join the stream in the valley . At the sound of its babble [Griselda]104-griselda cried out and tried to hasten , and , when [they]1551-they came to it , slipped down till [she]104-griselda could thrust [her]104-griselda face into the water and drink like [the sun - parched Israelites who marched with [Gideon]135-gideon]1559-the sun - parched israelites who marched with gideon . [They]1551-they drank , [they]1551-they dabbled in it , bathed hands and feet , and [Griselda]104-griselda washed [her]104-griselda broken side â€” touching it gingerly and not daring to pull away the linen that the blood had caked to the flesh . After that [William]99-william helped [her]104-griselda to [her]104-griselda feet and [they]1551-they dragged on further . If [they]1551-they found water in abundance , [they]1551-they found but little to eat ; and though [Griselda]104-griselda made no complaint of hunger , as the hours went by it gnawed at [[her]104-griselda husband]787-her husband 's vitals . At first [their]1551-they path lay chiefly through beechwoods bare of undergrowth , and [they]1551-they had been an hour or two on [their]1551-they way before [they]1551-they came to blackberry bushes . Upon these [William]99-william fell , tearing [his]99-william hands on the thorns by [his]99-william eager stripping of the bushes ; [Griselda]104-griselda would hardly touch them , but [he]99-william shovelled them into [his]99-william mouth and ate long and voraciously . [He]99-william had toiled much the day before and eaten little â€” a scanty breakfast and the scraps of bread and meat allotted by [[his]99-william captors]1066-his captors at midday â€” and , shovel as [he]99-william might , the berries were a poor substitute for the meal [he]99-william craved and dreamed of . That was a meal which floated before the eye of [his]99-william mind as phantom ham and eggs , phantom cuts from the joint , thick slabs of well - buttered bread ; something solid that [a man]397-a man could set [his]397-a man teeth in and gnaw till [his]397-a man stomach was satisfied . [He]99-william was ashamed of the way in which food and the longing for food possessed [him]99-william â€” so that there were moments when the phantom joint was more present to [his]99-william mind than [Griselda]104-griselda or the fear of death itself . To the phase of violent and savage hunger succeeded , with hours , a giddy dreaminess , the result of growing exhaustion . As the day wore on and exhaustion increased , [his]99-william mind , like [his]99-william body , refused to work connectedly ; [his]99-william feet often stumbled and [he]99-william was incapable of consecutive thought . Once [he]99-william found [himself]99-william sitting with [Griselda]104-griselda under a beech - tree , holding [her]104-griselda fingers and considering how [they]1563-they had come [there]527-there and why [they]1563-they had got to go on ; and wandering off into vague recollection of the story of [a knightly lover who had carried [[his]99-william mistress]1566-his mistress long miles through [a forest]1567-a forest in [his]99-william arms]1565-a knightly lover who had carried his mistress long miles through a forest in his arms . The details of the story escaped [his]99-william memory and [he]99-william sought for them with pettish insistence ; with perhaps at the back of [his]99-william mind some idea , born of brain - fag , that , did [he]99-william but remember them , [he]99-william could do the same service for [Griselda]104-griselda . [He]99-william had soon lost all sense of direction ; but the instinct to hide never left [him]99-william , and once or twice , when the wood seemed to be opening out , [he]99-william drew [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife back to the solitude under the trees . With the passing of the hours [their]1563-they rests by the way grew longer ; [Griselda]104-griselda was able to keep [her]104-griselda feet for a few minutes only before [she]104-griselda muttered or signed a request for another halt . Whereat [William]99-william would lower [her]104-griselda to the ground where [she]104-griselda propped [herself]104-griselda against a tree - trunk or lay huddled and silent with closed eyes . At one such halt [he]99-william fell suddenly and helplessly asleep ; perhaps [Griselda]104-griselda did the same , for though the sun was high when [he]99-william sat [him]99-william down [the woods]671-the woods were heavy with blue dusk when [she]104-griselda roused [him]99-william by a tugging at [his]99-william sleeve . [She]104-griselda was craving again for water ; [her]104-griselda lips were cracked for the want of it . [They]1563-they rose and went blindly in search â€” halting every few minutes as much to strain [their]1563-they ears for the longed - for ripple as to give [Griselda]104-griselda strength . More than once [she]104-griselda was at failing point ; so much so that [he]99-william suggested [she]104-griselda should lie down while [he]99-william hunted further for [a stream]565-a stream . [She]104-griselda refused , trembling at the idea of being left alone â€” unreasonably , but perhaps wisely , since [William]99-william , astray in [the darkening woods]1571-the darkening woods , might well have had difficulty in finding [his]99-william way to [her]104-griselda again . The dusk was more than dusk before [they]1563-they found what [they]1563-they sought ; it was actual darkness of night descending to cover [the earth]591-the earth . [They]1563-they had halted perforce more than once when [Griselda]104-griselda could go no further ; but always [her]104-griselda thirst burned [her]104-griselda , and [she]104-griselda rose and struggled forward again . [She]104-griselda was past speaking when [they]1563-they came on [a clearing]1573-a clearing , and then on [a stream]565-a stream that ran through [it]1573-a clearing , of which [they]1563-they were only aware when [they]1563-they trod into the marshy ground at its brim . [She]104-griselda drank heavily , lay inert and seemed to sleep . Perhaps because [he]99-william had slept for so long in the afternoon [[her]104-griselda husband]787-her husband was more wakeful ; for hours [he]99-william sat with [his]99-william eyes wide and [his]99-william chin propped on [his]99-william hands . After nightfall had come silence from the guns and at first the only sounds were forest sounds â€” night - bird talk and the lapping of unseen water at [his]99-william feet . Later [Griselda]104-griselda was restless and became conversational , talking rapidly and brokenly in a delirium of pain and fever and paying no heed to [his]99-william efforts to answer and calm [her]104-griselda . [Her]104-griselda mind , uncontrolled , had returned to a familiar channel ; [she]104-griselda was back in [the world]312-the world that had crumbled but yesterday , waging war as [she]104-griselda understood it till [she]104-griselda saw [the hostages]960-the hostages die . The Great Civil War that [you]1578-you fought with martyrdoms , with protests at meetings and hammers on plate - glass windows â€” [he]99-william could hear [she]104-griselda was back in the thick of it incoherently addressing [an audience]1579-an audience . Snatches of old - time denunciation â€” [Asquith]136-asquith , [McKenna]137-mckenna , the sins of [the Labour Party]686-the labour party â€” and , emerging from a torrent of incomprehensibility , the names of [the Leaders of the Movement]1581-the leaders of the movement . [He]99-william listened , crouched in the darkness , [a starving fugitive]1582-a starving fugitive â€” who had seen [men dismembered and done to death]1583-men dismembered and done to death in a war that was not civil ; and suddenly , crouched and starving in the darkness , [he]99-william began to laugh out loud . [He]99-william remembered â€” quite plainly [he]99-william remembered â€” a letter written to the daily Press to point out with indignation that [one of [the Leaders of the Movement]1581-the leaders of the movement]1584-one of the leaders of the movement had been hurt in the ankle in the course of the Great Civil War .... [He]99-william only laughed briefly ; the echo of [his]99-william own voice frightened [him]99-william , and its cackle died swiftly away . In the grave black silence it sounded like a blasphemy , and [he]99-william told [himself]99-william excusingly that [he]99-william had not been able to help it . With rest and cessation of movement [his]99-william brain worked more easily ; and with the passing of [his]99-william first savage hunger [he]99-william was no longer preoccupied with the needs of [his]99-william empty stomach . [He]99-william considered the situation , dispassionately and curiously detached from it ; deciding , with an odd lack of emotion , that to - morrow could not be as to - day . Whatever the need , [Griselda]104-griselda could walk no further ; [he]99-william , for [his]99-william part , was incapable of dragging [her]104-griselda ; when the light came [they]1586-they must just sit and wait . [His]99-william mind refused to trouble itself with details of what would happen if [they]1586-they sat and waited too long . Looking back at that night it seemed to [him]99-william that [he]99-william was not able to feel very much ; [his]99-william capacity for emotion was exhausted , even as [his]99-william body . When [Griselda]104-griselda stirred or groaned [he]99-william tried to shift [her]104-griselda more comfortably , when [she]104-griselda gasped for water [he]99-william helped [her]104-griselda to bend down and drink ; but the power of imaginative terror had left [him]99-william for the time being , and [he]99-william no longer trembled and sickened at [her]104-griselda suffering as [he]99-william had done when [she]104-griselda was first struck down . [He]99-william fell into a doze in the last hours of night , and when [his]99-william eyes opened the sky was a pearly grey . [He]99-william could see a wide stretch of [it]1587-it over the tree - tops ; for at the spot to which [they]1586-they had wandered in the uncertainty of darkness the grouping of the trees was less close than it had been , and there was a suggestion of open space beyond [them]1586-they . [Griselda]104-griselda lay sleeping or unconscious , with [her]104-griselda knotted hair straying on [her]104-griselda face ; [he]99-william smoothed it away as [he]99-william knelt beside [her]104-griselda , took [her]104-griselda hand and called [her]104-griselda by name . [She]104-griselda gave no answer , and did not even stir when [he]99-william kissed [her]104-griselda . The power of imaginative terror had returned to [him]99-william , and [he]99-william asked [himself]99-william whether [she]104-griselda were dying ? ... [He]99-william knelt beside [her]104-griselda for a few minutes , fondling [her]104-griselda hand and whispering , imploring [her]104-griselda to speak â€” and then , in a mingled curse and appeal , stretched [his]99-william arms above [his]99-william head towards heaven . The effort and emotion exhausted [him]99-william ; [he]99-william collapsed both bodily and mentally , slipped back to the grass beside [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife and lay with [his]99-william face to the ground . What roused [him]99-william was the sound of [a man]397-a man 's voice near [him]99-william ; not words , but a grunt of surprise unmistakably human . [He]99-william lifted [his]99-william head and saw gazing at [him]99-william from [the opposite bank of [the brook]1591-the brook]1590-the opposite bank of the brook [the man who had uttered the grunt]1592-the man who had uttered the grunt . [A man carrying a pail , very filthy and many days unshorn ; with a peaked cap flattened on the back of [his]397-a man head]1593-a man carrying a pail , very filthy and many days unshorn ; with a peaked cap flattened on the back of his head , a dark muddied coat and loose trousers that had once been red . [His]397-a man face , for all its grime and its black sprouts of beard , was reassuring in its interest ; what [he]397-a man said was gibberish to [William]99-william 's ears , but the sound of it kindly and inquiring , and , when [William]99-william shook [his]99-william head and pointed to [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife , [he]99-william set down [his]99-william unfilled pail on the grass and waded across [the shallow stream]1595-the shallow stream . [He]99-william looked at [Griselda]104-griselda , touched [her]104-griselda torpid hand gently and muttered more friendly gibberish ; finishing by a pat on [William]99-william 's shoulder before [he]99-william waded back to [the further bank]1596-the further bank , filled [his]99-william pail to the brim and walked away with it . [He]99-william turned to fling back a last gesture of promise before [he]99-william vanished among the trees , leaving [William]99-william to stare after [him]99-william , motionless and dumb , and waiting for something , [he]99-william knew not what , to happen . What happened , after an interval , was the reappearance of [the pail - bearer]1597-the pail - bearer , this time minus [his]1597-the pail - bearer pail , but accompanied , in its stead , by [a comrade]1598-a comrade . [The comrade]1599-the comrade was scarcely less filthy and similarly clad ; [the twain]1600-the twain emerged from between the trees , splashed across [the brook]1591-the brook and exchanged rapid gibberish while [they]1600-the twain stood and looked down at [Griselda]104-griselda . Finally , [one of [them]1600-the twain]1602-one of them , addressing [himself]1602-one of them to [William]99-william , pointed to somewhere on [the opposite bank]1603-the opposite bank and nodded with intent to encourage ; whereupon [the pair of [them]1600-the twain]1604-the pair of them lifted [Griselda]104-griselda , made a seat of [their]1600-the twain arms and carried [her]104-griselda . [William]99-william followed [them]1600-the twain , lurching from weakness as [he]99-william walked ; and after [they]1600-the twain had gone about a couple of hundred yards [the little procession]1068-the little procession came out on to [a highway]1606-a highway where [a hooded car , as dirty as]1607-a hooded car , as dirty as [its]1607-a hooded car , as dirty as guardians , was drawn up at the side of [the road]731-the road . On the floor of [the car]1609-the car [the two men]1205-the two men placed [Griselda]104-griselda , laying [her]104-griselda down gently and arranging , with kind , dirty hands , some empty sacks as a makeshift couch and a coat as a makeshift pillow . That done , [they]1205-the two men signed to [William]99-william to climb in beside [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife , and one of [them]1205-the two men , noticing [his]99-william feebleness , lent a hand to [him]99-william over the tailboard , while [the other]246-the other provided [him]99-william with a hunk of bread and a large tin mug of red wine . [His]99-william hunger returned with the taste of food , and [he]99-william ate with a ravenous enjoyment , gulping down bread and wine together ; before [he]99-william had finished gulping [the car]1609-the car had started and was rattling over [the road]731-the road , [he]99-william knew not whither . [Woods]1615-woods went by [them]1615-woods and open spaces ; [they]1615-woods spanned [rivers]1616-rivers , climbed [hills]1617-hills and descended again into [valleys]1618-valleys . Sometimes [the roads]1619-the roads were rough , and at the jolting of [the car]1609-the car [Griselda]104-griselda would whimper and cry out â€” whereat [William]99-william would try to soothe [her]104-griselda with assurance that the worst was over , [they]1621-they were safe and would soon be in comfort . [He]99-william did not know if [she]104-griselda understood ; [she]104-griselda never spoke coherently and hardly ever opened [her]104-griselda eyes . For the first wooded mile or two [they]1621-they had [the road]731-the road to [themselves]1621-they ; after that [they]1621-they came across other traffic , the greater part of it heading in the same , mostly southerly , direction . It was varied traffic , mechanical , horse and foot : guns and [other cars]1623-other cars , some signed with the Geneva cross ; now [a cavalry patrol]1624-a cavalry patrol , now [a dusty detachment of infantry]1625-a dusty detachment of infantry ; and , intermingled with [soldier stragglers]1626-soldier stragglers , [little groups of non - military wayfarers]1627-little groups of non - military wayfarers , in [carts]1628-carts and tramping afoot . All these grew more frequent as the miles went under [them]1621-they ; so frequent as to hinder [their]1621-they progress , and finally , when [they]1621-they neared [their]1621-they destination , bring the pace of [the car]1609-the car to a crawl . [[Their]1621-they destination]1630-their destination â€” [William]99-william never knew [its]1630-their destination name â€” was [a white - walled village , whereof [the one long street]1632-the one long street was crowded with the traffic of [humanity]1633-humanity]1631-a white - walled village , whereof the one long street was crowded with the traffic of humanity ; the same kind of traffic [they]1621-they had passed on [the road]731-the road , but thickened and impeded by much that was stationary in horses , in [men]368-men and in [vehicles]1636-vehicles . [The car]1609-the car jolted half - way along [the stone - paved street]1638-the stone - paved street and came to a standstill in the company of [three or four others]1639-three or four others ; [its guardians]1640-its guardians descended and one of [them]1640-its guardians â€” [the pail - bearer]1597-the pail - bearer â€” looked over the tail and nodded in friendly - wise to [William]99-william before [he]99-william hurried away . There was a few minutes ' wait , during which nothing personal happened â€” only the confused sound of voices , the confused sound of movement flowing incessantly , movement of feet , wheels and engines ; and then [the man who had nodded from the tail of [the car]1609-the car]1642-the man who had nodded from the tail of the car came back , [others]234-others with [him]1642-the man who had nodded from the tail of the car â€” [dirty soldiers like unto [himself]1642-the man who had nodded from the tail of the car]1645-dirty soldiers like unto himself . [One of these]1646-one of these spoke to [William]99-william , choosing [his]99-william words with precision ; and when [he]99-william shook [his]99-william head and answered , " [I]99-william am English , "[99-william] there was talk and much gesticulation . ( It struck [him]99-william later that [they]1647-they took [him]99-william for [a Flemish - speaking Belgian]1648-a flemish - speaking belgian and perhaps had tried [him]99-william with a word or two of the language . ) To the accompaniment of talk and gesticulation the tailboard of [the car]1609-the car was let down and [William]99-william , by sign , was invited to set foot on the ground ; whereafter [Griselda]104-griselda was also lifted out and laid by the roadside on a truss of hay which [some one]2838-some one had procured for the purpose . There [she]104-griselda lay for another ten minutes or so , unaware of [her]104-griselda surroundings while the stream of humanity flowed by [her]104-griselda â€” [William]99-william , hunched beside [her]104-griselda on the hay , wondering dumbly what would happen to [them]1647-they next . [He]99-william knew [himself]99-william among [friends]1651-friends and was no longer afraid ; but all initiative had left [him]99-william , all power of action and idea . [He]99-william had a dull hope that [some one]2838-some one was bringing [a doctor]1653-a doctor ... meanwhile [he]99-william could do nothing but wait and obey , and when [[his]99-william good Samaritan]1654-his good samaritan , [the filthy little soldier]1655-the filthy little soldier , came back and tapped [him]99-william on the shoulder , [he]99-william rose , passively responsive . [The man]281-the man signed to [him]99-william that [they]1647-they should lift [Griselda]104-griselda between [them]1647-they ; [he]99-william obeyed with infinite difficulty , panting at the effort , and together [they]1647-they carried [her]104-griselda some yards down [the street]983-the street to [a cart that stood pulled up and waiting]1658-a cart that stood pulled up and waiting â€” [a long , most un - English - looking country cart with [a man]397-a man perched in front and inside [two women]1661-two women , many bundles , some ducks and a goat]1659-a long , most un - english - looking country cart with a man perched in front and inside two women , many bundles , some ducks and a goat . [One of [the women]1663-the women]1662-one of the women was shrivelled and helpless with years ; [her]1662-one of the women head in a handkerchief and [her]1662-one of the women gnarled fingers holding to [her]1662-one of the women knees , [she]1662-one of the women sat huddled against the protesting goat , a lump of bent , blear - eyed old age . [[Her]104-griselda companion]1664-her companion in discomfort â€” possibly [[her]104-griselda daughter]1665-her daughter â€” was [a stout , elderly peasant woman]1666-a stout , elderly peasant woman , [the counterpart in petticoats of [the grizzled - haired man who guided [a solid grey farmhorse]1669-a solid grey farmhorse]1668-the grizzled - haired man who guided a solid grey farmhorse]1667-the counterpart in petticoats of the grizzled - haired man who guided a solid grey farmhorse . [She]104-griselda made room for [Griselda]104-griselda , talking rapidly the while , in the straw at the bottom of [the cart]1670-the cart â€” thrusting ducks and bundles to one side of [the vehicle]492-the vehicle with [her]104-griselda knotted and energetic hands ; perhaps [she]104-griselda was striving to explain to [William]99-william that it was impossible to accommodate [another passenger]1672-another passenger and that [he]99-william must follow on foot . [She]104-griselda may have been friend or [acquaintance of [the dirty Samaritan]1674-the dirty samaritan]1673-acquaintance of the dirty samaritan , for , as [the cart]1670-the cart moved off at a foot 's pace , [she]104-griselda waved to [him]99-william in friendly guise ; the dirty Samaritan , for [his]99-william part , clapping [William]99-william on the back , pointing after [the cart]1670-the cart and showing [his]99-william teeth in a final grin of encouragement . In the days that followed [William]99-william often regretted that [he]99-william had not known how to thank [him]1674-the dirty samaritan for the bounty of [his]99-william overflowing charity . [He]99-william walked after [the cart]1670-the cart as it lumbered through [the village]720-the village and out of [it]720-the village . Nourishment and the sense of relief had given back some of [his]99-william strength ; thus [he]99-william was able , if with difficulty , to keep up with the plodding of the solid grey farmhorse â€” often brought to a standstill , moreover , by the traffic that cumbered [the road]731-the road . Sometimes the standstill was a long one , accompanied by confusion and shouting ; there was a point where a stream of [fugitives flowing southward]1680-fugitives flowing southward met [reinforcements hurrying north]1681-reinforcements hurrying north â€” and a flock of panic - stricken sheep , caught between the two , charged backwards and forwards , to the yells of [[their]1682-their sweating drivers]1683-their sweating drivers and the anger of [a captain of cavalry]1684-a captain of cavalry . At almost [every cross - roads]1685-every cross - roads [the stream]598-the stream was swollen by a fresh rivulet of [fugitives]1687-fugitives â€” refugees human and animal ; thus at such junctions the pace was slower and a halt frequently called for . When it came [William]99-william dropped down with thankfulness ; sometimes lying torpid till [the cart]1670-the cart moved on , sometimes satisfying hunger and quenching thirst with fruit from the regiments of orchard trees that lined the sides of [the road]731-the road . [The stout peasant woman]1690-the stout peasant woman was more kindly than a hard face promised . [She]1690-the stout peasant woman was careful and troubled about many things â€” the old wreck of humanity , [her]1690-the stout peasant woman live - stock , the safety of [herself]1690-the stout peasant woman and [her]1690-the stout peasant woman bundles â€” and [she]1690-the stout peasant woman had lost [[her]1690-the stout peasant woman home]1691-her home and [her]1690-the stout peasant woman livelihood ; but [she]1690-the stout peasant woman found time to think of [Griselda]104-griselda and do what [she]1690-the stout peasant woman could for [her]104-griselda . [She]1690-the stout peasant woman arranged [her]1690-the stout peasant woman straw pillow , wiped the dust from [her]1690-the stout peasant woman face , and from time to time raised [her]1690-the stout peasant woman that [she]1690-the stout peasant woman might hold a cup to [her]1690-the stout peasant woman lips . Somewhere about midday [she]1690-the stout peasant woman attended to the general needs ; [the cart]1670-the cart was halted and [she]1690-the stout peasant woman doled out a ration all round â€” hunks of bread chopped from a yard of loaf and portions of a half - liquid cheese . [William]99-william was not forgotten , and shared with [the rest of [the party]1694-the party]1693-the rest of the party ; [they]1693-the rest of the party ate with the cart drawn up in [a field a little way from [the road]731-the road]1695-a field a little way from the road ; the horse grazing , the goat tethered to one of the wheels , [the peasants]1697-the peasants and [William]99-william sitting on the ground and [Griselda]104-griselda lying in [her]104-griselda straw . [William]99-william climbed up beside [her]104-griselda and coaxed a little wine between [her]104-griselda lips ; [she]104-griselda had swallowed hardly a mouthful when [she]104-griselda turned [her]104-griselda head aside and pushed the mug feebly away . [He]99-william was not sure if [she]104-griselda responded when [he]99-william spoke to [her]104-griselda and stroked [her]104-griselda hand ; [she]104-griselda muttered once or twice but it was only a sound to [his]99-william ears . For a moment â€” perhaps it was the raw , red wine that had mounted to [his]99-william head â€” there came over [him]99-william a sort of irritation at [her]104-griselda long and persistent silence . [She]104-griselda must know what it meant to see [her]104-griselda suffer and have no word ; [he]99-william felt [she]104-griselda might have tried to rouse [herself]104-griselda to the extent of one little smile of comfort . The afternoon was as the morning â€” a weary journeying whereof [he]99-william knew not the goal . [The grey horse]1698-the grey horse plodded , [the women]1663-the women sat hunched amid [their]1663-the women bundles , and [William]99-william tramped on [his]99-william blistered feet at the tail of [the creaking cart]1700-the creaking cart ; when [he]99-william looked ahead [the road]731-the road , as far as [his]99-william eye could reach , was dotted with [fugitive tramps]1702-fugitive tramps and [fugitive vehicles]1703-fugitive vehicles â€” and when [he]99-william looked back there were [others]234-others following in [their]234-others tracks . For the most part , however , [he]99-william looked neither back nor forward but trudged with [his]99-william eyes on the ground through the whitened grass at the roadside . No rain had fallen for many days and [the road]731-the road was deep in dust ; it hung heavy in the air and when [a car]1129-a car went by it rose in clouds like smoke . The trees were thick with it , and [every man]1707-every man 's garments were powdered by its uniform grey . More than once [their]1708-their way led [them]1708-their through [a village]1709-a village â€” which might have been always [the same village]1710-the same village , so alike was [its]1709-a village aspect and [its]1709-a village doings . Always [some of [the houses]1712-the houses]1711-some of the houses would be closed and some in the act of emptying ; in each and all was the same scene of miserable haste , of [loading carts]1713-loading carts , of [families]1714-families , scared and burdened , setting out on [their]234-others flight to [the southward]1715-the southward . It was a scene that grew so familiar to [William]99-william that , staggering with the weight of [his]99-william own weariness , [he]99-william hardly turned [his]99-william head to watch it ; it affected [him]99-william only by the halts it caused , by the need of manoeuvring through [a crowd]1117-a crowd . Cut off from [[his]99-william fellows]1322-his fellows by the lack of intelligible speech , [he]99-william trudged on like an animal at the tail of [the cart]1670-the cart , ignorant as an animal of what the next hours might bring [him]99-william . There were moments when it seemed to [him]99-william that [he]99-william was asleep and would surely waken ; when [he]99-william put out [his]99-william hand to touch something and feel that it resisted and was real â€” a dusty axle , a gate , a wall , the dusty bark of a fruit - tree . And there were other moments when the now was real , and [he]99-william seemed to have newly wakened from the dream of a world impossible â€” of [streets]1719-streets and [stations]1720-stations and meals that came regularly , of life that was decent and reasonable and orderly , with [men like unto [himself]99-william]1721-men like unto himself .... Late in the afternoon [he]99-william started and lifted [his]99-william head in sudden trembling recognition of a sound reminiscent , and because reminiscent beloved â€” the near - by whistle of [a passing engine]1722-a passing engine , the near - by clank of [a train]564-a train . The note of the whistle , the sight of a long line of [trucks]1724-trucks â€” but a field's - breadth away behind a fence â€” brought a rush of hope to [his]99-william heart and a rush of tears to [his]99-william eyes . [His]99-william soul thrilled with the promise of [them]1725-they ; after the vagabond horror of the last few days [they]1725-they stood for decency , for civilization , for a means of escape from hell . [His]99-william eyes followed [the train]2869-the train with longing as [it]2869-the train snorted over [a level meadow]1727-a level meadow and wound out of sight behind [a hill]1728-a hill â€” followed [it]2869-the train with longing , with something that was almost love . A mile or two further [they]1725-they passed [a level crossing]1729-a level crossing and soon after came again on [a village]1709-a village . [It]1709-a village was larger than any [they]1725-they had so far traversed , and in ordinary times must have been of a prosperous importance ; now many of [its]1709-a village windows were bolted and shuttered , denoting the flight of inhabitants whom [others]234-others were preparing to follow . The sun was red in the west when [they]1725-they reached [its]1709-a village outskirts . It was when [they]1725-they were about halfway along [the wide paved street]1732-the wide paved street that there came a loud cry from [the cart]1670-the cart â€” so loud and so sudden that [the driver]1734-the driver pulled at [his]1734-the driver horse . The cry had come from [the hard - faced peasant woman who was leaning over [Griselda]104-griselda]1735-the hard - faced peasant woman who was leaning over griselda . The life in [William]99-william stood still as [he]99-william saw [her]1735-the hard - faced peasant woman who was leaning over griselda face , and [she]1735-the hard - faced peasant woman who was leaning over griselda had to beckon to [him]99-william twice before [he]99-william moved to climb into the cart ; [she]1735-the hard - faced peasant woman who was leaning over griselda gave [him]99-william a hand as [he]99-william climbed and half jerked [him]99-william over the bundles .... [Griselda]104-griselda had died very quietly in the straw at [the bottom of [the cart]1670-the cart]1736-the bottom of the cart . Some one , [he]99-william thought , kept [him]99-william back from the body while [they]1738-they lifted [it]99-william down from the cart ; there was a stir and bustle and [three or four people]1739-three or four people gathered round , hiding it for a moment from [his]99-william sight . [One]413-one , [he]99-william remembered , had [the goat by the horns]1741-the goat by the horns and was trying to drag it aside ; the goat was refractory , kicked and bleated and made itself the centre of a scuffle . Afterwards [he]99-william pushed through [them]1738-they all and stood looking down at [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife . As [he]99-william looked at [her]654-his wife â€” limp , with glazed eyes and fallen jaw â€” there swam before [his]99-william memory a pitiful vision of [the dear Griselda [he]99-william had married]1743-the dear griselda he had married . [He]99-william saw [her]654-his wife â€” this huddle of rags and dirt â€” in [her]654-his wife wedding garments , fussed and dainty , with [her]654-his wife bouquet tied with suffragette ribbons . [He]99-william remembered the expression , self - conscious and flushing , wherewith [she]654-his wife had given [her]654-his wife hand that [he]99-william might place the ring on [her]654-his wife finger ; and how , when [they]1744-they were first alone as [man]428-man and [wife]1746-wife , [he]99-william had taken the hand that wore the ring and kissed it till [she]654-his wife drew it away . [He]99-william looked down stupidly while [the bystanders]1751-the bystanders whispered and stared . That [he]99-william might not see its curious and pitying faces [he]99-william pressed a hand over [his]99-william eyes . [He]1759-he who had touched [him]99-william wore the garb of [a priest]1760-a priest ; was stout , not over - well washed or brushed , but kindly of manner and countenance . " [[My]99-william wife]2936-my wife is dead , "[99-william] [he]99-william told [her]1763-a woman who had caught his words and now pushed through the bystanders ; and , hearing [himself]99-william say the words aloud , [he]99-william burst into a passion of sobbing . " [I]1789-the housekeeper wish [I]1789-the housekeeper could help [you]99-william , "[1789-the housekeeper] [she]1789-the housekeeper said with [her]1789-the housekeeper back towards [him]99-william . " [I]1789-the housekeeper know nothing seems any good at such a time , but if there is anything [you]99-william want â€” â€” "[1789-the housekeeper] [She]1789-the housekeeper was giving [him]99-william more than [she]1789-the housekeeper knew by [her]1789-the housekeeper presence , by speaking in [their]1791-their common tongue ; the sound of the familiar , comprehensible English was as the breaking of an iron barrier between [him]99-william and [the rest of mankind]1792-the rest of mankind . [She]1789-the housekeeper was talking to [him]99-william â€” talking , not mouthing and making strange noises . [He]99-william was back in [the world]312-the world where [you]1794-you spoke and [[your]1794-you fellows]1795-your fellows understood [you]1794-you , where [you]1794-you were human â€” intelligent , intelligible â€” not [an animal guided by nod and beck or driven to labour by blows]1796-an animal guided by nod and beck or driven to labour by blows . Comprehensible speech meant not only sympathy , but the long - denied power of complaint â€” and the pent and swollen misery of [his]99-william last few days was relieved by a torrent of words . [She]1789-the housekeeper stood and listened while [he]99-william sobbed and talked incoherently . There was small plan or sequence about [his]99-william tale â€” [he]99-william went backwards and forwards in it , started afresh and left gaps ; but [she]1789-the housekeeper realized that [he]99-william was telling it not for [her]1789-the housekeeper benefit , but for [his]99-william own relief , let [him]99-william pour [himself]99-william out and refrained from interruption even when [his]99-william talk was most entangled . [She]1789-the housekeeper took it as a good sign when at last [he]99-william paused and looked up to ask of [her]1789-the housekeeper what it all meant , what had happened , and where [he]99-william was now ? [She]1789-the housekeeper told [him]99-william , as briefly as might be , what [Heinz]126-heinz had told [him]99-william â€” of a world in upheaval and nations at grips with [each other]351-each other ; the same story if not from the same point of view . [She]1789-the housekeeper added that [he]99-william was now on [French soil]1798-french soil ( which [he]99-william had not guessed ) [some miles from [the Belgian frontier]1800-the belgian frontier]1799-some miles from the belgian frontier , and that it would be possible , [she]1789-the housekeeper hoped , to make the journey onward by rail . [The French]138-the french were falling back and [the district]1801-the district had been warned of the likelihood of enemy occupation ; [she]1789-the housekeeper supposed that the needs of [the army]384-the army had absorbed the local rolling - stock , for there had been [no passenger train]1803-no passenger train on [[their]384-the army small branch line]1804-their small branch line that day . [The authorities]1805-the authorities , however , had promised one to [Paris]42-paris in the morning and [she]1789-the housekeeper , [herself]1789-the housekeeper , was waiting in the hope of obtaining a seat . [She]1789-the housekeeper hesitated and broke off at the sound of shuffling feet in [the passage outside]1806-the passage outside â€” slow feet and uncertain , as of [men who carried a burden]1807-men who carried a burden . [William]99-william heard the sound likewise and , guessing its meaning , would have risen and gone to the door ; but [she]1789-the housekeeper kept [him]99-william to [his]99-william seat with a hand on [his]99-william shoulder and [he]99-william obeyed the touch because , at the moment , it was easier to obey than to resist . [He]99-william sat and trembled , twisting [his]99-william fingers , while the shuffling died away into momentary silence , followed by trampling and the closing of a door as [the burden - bearers]1808-the burden - bearers went out .... Then silence again , a much longer silence , till [the stout priest]1809-the stout priest entered [the room]778-the room , moving quietly , as [men]368-men are accustomed to move in the neighbourhood of [those whom no sound can arouse or disturb]1812-those whom no sound can arouse or disturb . [He]1809-the stout priest spoke softly at some length to [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman , who , having listened and nodded , turned to [William]99-william and told [him]99-william that if [he]99-william would like to go to [her]1771-the englishwoman â€” â€” [He]99-william followed [the priest]1770-the priest down [the passage]229-the passage to [a room at the back of [the house]641-the house]1816-a room at the back of the house ; wherein , on a table , and covered by a sheet , [they]1818-they had laid the body of [[his]1809-the stout priest wife]654-his wife . There were long candles burning around the table and on either side of [her]1771-the englishwoman a little metal vase filled with roses . [The priest]1770-the priest stood aside in the doorway for [William]99-william to enter , bowed [his]1770-the priest head in a prayer and went out ; when [he]1770-the priest had gone [William]99-william crept to the table , turned the sheet from [her]1771-the englishwoman face and looked down â€” on [Griselda]104-griselda dowered with a grave dignity that had never been [hers]1771-the englishwoman while [she]104-griselda lived .... [Some one]2838-some one had washed away the stains of [the road]731-the road and arranged the disordered rags that had once been a dress ; the hair was smoothed out of its three - day tangle and [her]1771-the englishwoman poor hands crossed on [her]1771-the englishwoman breast . [He]99-william stayed with [her]1771-the englishwoman till dusk had thickened into darkness , sometimes standing at [her]1771-the englishwoman side to look down on [her]1771-the englishwoman face , sometimes bowed to [his]99-william knees by the burden of the years without [her]1771-the englishwoman . When [the priest]1770-the priest came back to rouse [him]99-william [he]99-william was crouched in the attitude of prayer ; but [his]99-william prayer ( if such it might be called ) was only the eternal petition of [the bereaved]1824-the bereaved , " Would God that [I]99-william had died instead ! "[99-william] [The village sexton]1825-the village sexton was of [those who had already fled at the rumour of [the oncoming German]1827-the oncoming german]1826-those who had already fled at the rumour of the oncoming german ; so that night [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman , who had acquired in [a west - country garden]1829-a west - country garden some skill in the handling of a spade , took turns with [a bent old peasant]1830-a bent old peasant in digging a grave for [Griselda]104-griselda . When daylight failed [them]1831-them [they]1831-them dug by the shine of a lantern ; [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman was not over - imaginative or nervous but [she]1771-the englishwoman found the job an eerie one â€” the more so since [the square - walled cemetery , like [French graveyards in general]1834-french graveyards in general]1833-the square - walled cemetery , like french graveyards in general , lay well away from [its village]1835-its village â€” and [she]1771-the englishwoman was glad when the moment came to pay off [[her]1771-the englishwoman companion]1664-her companion and return to [[her]1771-the englishwoman quarters in [the little HÃ´tel de la Gare]1838-the little hÃ´tel de la gare]1837-her quarters in the little hÃ´tel de la gare . Other formalities in connection with the funeral there were none â€” for the reason that [the maire]1839-the maire and [[his]1839-the maire clerk]1222-his clerk , who [in ordinary seasons would have devoted much time and stationery to the subject]1841-in ordinary seasons would have devoted much time and stationery to the subject , had departed that evening , bearing with [them]1831-them [the archives of [the commune]1843-the commune]1842-the archives of the commune . [William]99-william , for [his]99-william part , spent the night on [the priest]1770-the priest 's horsehair sofa , next door to [the room where the candles burned around the body of [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife]1845-the room where the candles burned around the body of his wife . From weariness of the flesh [he]99-william dozed now and again ; but for the greater part of the night lay wakeful and staring at darkness . There were moments when the horsehair sofa shook beneath [his]99-william sobbing ; and there were others when it seemed to [him]99-william impossible that a horror so brutal and so undeserved should have mangled [his]99-william harmless life . At one such moment [he]99-william crept from [his]99-william couch , felt [his]99-william way across [the room]778-the room and into [the passage]229-the passage â€” possessed by some wild and unconfessed thought that [he]99-william might not find [Griselda]104-griselda on the sheeted table with [her]104-griselda hands crossed over [her]104-griselda breast . The door , when [he]99-william tried it , was locked and the key withdrawn â€” fastened by [the priest]1770-the priest or [[his]99-william housekeeper]1850-his housekeeper before [they]1851-they retired for the night ; but when [he]99-william knelt down to peer through the keyhole [he]99-william could see two of the tall church candles and the vase with its bunch of white roses that [some one]2838-some one had placed near [her]104-griselda head . [He]99-william crept back , knowing that [she]104-griselda lay there indeed , and sat down to stare at the darkness till it softened from black into grey . The morning was still flushed in [the east]1853-the east when [the old woman]608-the old woman came to [him]99-william with bread and a bowl of coffee ; the coffee was hot , aromatic and sweet , after the fashion of that which had once been brewed by [Madame Peys]117-madame peys â€” and , remembering breakfasts not eaten alone , [his]99-william tears dropped into it thickly . While [he]99-william ate , sitting humped on the edge of the horsehair sofa , [the street outside]1855-the street outside was already astir with traffic , [nomad and military]1856-nomad and military ; [those fugitives who had rested in [the village]720-the village for the night]1857-those fugitives who had rested in the village for the night were once more taking to [the road]731-the road , [other fugitives from [the neighbourhood]973-the neighbourhood]1860-other fugitives from the neighbourhood were dribbling in to join [them]1857-those fugitives who had rested in the village for the night , [troops]1862-troops were moving up and to - day was even as yesterday . When [he]99-william had finished [his]99-william bread and coffee [the old woman]608-the old woman signed [him]99-william to the kitchen sink , where [she]608-the old woman furnished [him]99-william with soap and a towel ; and , the process of washing completed , [she]608-the old woman produced a clothes - brush , led [him]99-william out into [the garden]760-the garden and attacked with vigour the mud and stain on [his]99-william garments . [He]99-william was standing passively while [she]608-the old woman scoured at [his]99-william shoulders when [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman came up , and , looking anywhere except at [his]99-william face , put [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife 's rings into [his]99-william hands . There were two of [them]1867-them â€” the new gold band , with a month 's wear behind it , and the little engagement half - hoop â€” and at sight of [them]1867-them [the housekeeper]1789-the housekeeper ceased to scour and crept away with [her]608-the old woman brush . [He]99-william looked down at them lying in [his]99-william palm till the tears veiled them , and knotted them slowly and tightly in a corner of [his]99-william handkerchief . [[His]99-william companion]260-his companion cleared [her]260-his companion throat and , still looking anywhere except at [his]99-william face , told [him]99-william that [the train]2869-the train to [Paris]42-paris â€” very probably [the last one to run]1871-the last one to run â€” would be starting that morning . " Yes ? "[99-william] [he]99-william said vaguely , conscious that [she]260-his companion expected a reply . [She]260-his companion explained that what [she]260-his companion had meant was , the funeral must take place immediately .... Chiefly for the sake of breaking the silence [she]260-his companion supposed that [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife was not [a Roman Catholic]1873-a roman catholic ? [He]99-william answered " No , "[99-william] staring at a row of hollyhocks and a butterfly that quivered above them . [She]260-his companion asked , [she]260-his companion explained , because in that case [the priest]1770-the priest would have read the proper service . As it was ... [She]260-his companion hoped [he]99-william would understand that [they]1875-they had done [their]1875-they best to â€” be reverent . But there were difficulties â€” [so many of [the tradesmen]1877-the tradesmen]1876-so many of the tradesmen were leaving or had left already . [Carpenters]1878-carpenters and so on .... [He]99-william listened stupidly with [his]99-william eyes on the quivering butterfly , dumbly rebellious at the cruelty that tore [him]99-william even from the body â€” and it only dawned on [him]99-william what [she]260-his companion meant by [her]260-his companion stumbling hints when [she]260-his companion led [him]99-william through [the house]641-the house to the front door where [a cart]1880-a cart stood waiting with [the priest]1770-the priest at the horse 's head . It was [a farm - cart , borrowed by [the priest]1770-the priest from [a neighbour]1884-a neighbour]1882-a farm - cart , borrowed by the priest from a neighbour ; and on the floor of [it]1882-a farm - cart , borrowed by the priest from a neighbour that which had been [Griselda]104-griselda lay coffinless and wrapped in a sheet . There were roses scattered on the folds of the sheet and [the old Frenchwoman]1885-the old frenchwoman was waiting at the gate with a shapeless little wreath of [her]260-his companion own manufacture which [she]260-his companion pressed into [William]99-william 's hand . [They]1886-they set out , a funeral procession of three , which at other times would have drawn many curious glances ; [the priest]1770-the priest leading [the horse]1888-the horse and [William]99-william and [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman walking side by side at the rear of [the cart]1670-the cart . [The cemetery]1891-the cemetery lay outside [the village]720-the village , a half - mile or so from [their]1886-they starting - point , and [they]1886-they passed [wayfarers]1893-wayfarers enough on [the road]731-the road , of whom [some]1895-some bared [their]1895-some heads and crossed [themselves]1895-some , and [others]234-others were too busy with [their]234-others own sorrows to give even a thought to [the dead]1897-the dead . The gate of [the graveyard]1898-the graveyard was narrow and it was with difficulty that [the cart]1670-the cart was manoeuvred between [its]1670-the cart posts . At an ordinary funeral [the hearse]1900-the hearse would have remained in [the road]731-the road ; but this was no ordinary funeral nor ordinary day , and it was as well not to tempt [the footsore]1902-the footsore fugitive by the sight of [a vehicle]1903-a vehicle unguarded . Accordingly , [the cart]1670-the cart was manoeuvred through the gate before [the priest]1770-the priest , [William]99-william and [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman lifted out the body of [Griselda]104-griselda and carried [it]1907-it to the grave in the corner . [The bent - backed old labourer]1908-the bent - backed old labourer was sitting beside it on the mound that would shortly fill [it]1907-it ; [he]1908-the bent - backed old labourer rose when [he]1908-the bent - backed old labourer saw [them]1909-them , leaning on [his]1908-the bent - backed old labourer spade and bared [his]1908-the bent - backed old labourer grey hairs to the dead . [The grave]876-the grave was shallow â€” but , shallow as [it]876-the grave was , the body , being coffinless , was lowered with difficulty and [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman led [William]99-william a little way aside that [he]99-william might not watch while [the priest]1770-the priest and [the peasant]1913-the peasant performed the last service [Griselda]104-griselda would require of [man]428-man ; [he]99-william understood what [she]1771-the englishwoman meant and stood with [his]99-william back to [the group]726-the group round [the grave]876-the grave , staring at a granite tombstone bedizened with massive bead wreaths . When [she]1771-the englishwoman touched [him]99-william on the shoulder , as sign that [he]99-william might turn , [the priest]1770-the priest was crossing [himself]1770-the priest at [his]1770-the priest prayers and [the old man standing by the heap of new turned earth]1918-the old man standing by the heap of new turned earth . [He]99-william went to the edge of [the grave]876-the grave , looked down at the crumpled sheet and then stupidly round at [[his]99-william neighbour]1920-his neighbour . [He]99-william said nothing , but [she]1771-the englishwoman thought [he]99-william was expecting something ; so , as [the priest]1770-the priest still prayed with closed eyes in silence , [she]1771-the englishwoman struggled with the racial shyness where things of the spirit are concerned and , swallowing [her]1771-the englishwoman tears , spoke the funeral words for [Griselda]104-griselda . " [I]1771-the englishwoman am [the Resurrection and the Life]2985-the resurrection and the life , saith [the Lord]210-the lord : [he]99-william that believeth in [Me]1771-the englishwoman , though [he]99-william were dead , yet shall [he]99-william live ... "[1771-the englishwoman] " Blessed are the dead that die in [the Lord]2987-the lord ... [they]2988-they rest from [their]2988-they labours . "[1771-the englishwoman] " [Man that is born of woman]2989-man that is born of woman hath but a short time to live ... [He]2989-man that is born of woman cometh up and is cut down ... "[1771-the englishwoman] " [Lord]2990-lord have mercy upon [us]1922-they ! "[1771-the englishwoman] It was all [she]1771-the englishwoman could remember ; and when [William]99-william had whispered Amen [they]1922-they left [the old peasant]1923-the old peasant to [his]99-william work . At the gate of [the cemetery]1891-the cemetery [they]1922-they parted from [the priest]1770-the priest , who had charged [himself]1770-the priest with the immediate return of the haycart which [he]1770-the priest had borrowed from [a neighbouring farm]1926-a neighbouring farm ; [he]1770-the priest shook hands with [them]1922-they , nodded kindly to [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman 's thanks , climbed into [the cart]1670-the cart and drove off along [the dusty road]1317-the dusty road . [They]1922-they saw [him]1770-the priest no more and often wondered what became of [him]1770-the priest when the wave of Teutonic invasion swept over [[his]1770-the priest parish]1930-his parish and [himself]1770-the priest . [Their]1922-they own way lay in the opposite direction â€” first back to [the village inn]1931-the village inn , where [the Englishwoman]1771-the englishwoman picked up [her]1771-the englishwoman bag and a package of provisions for the journey , and then on to [the station]541-the station to await the arrival of [the train]2869-the train . [William]99-william followed [her]1771-the englishwoman incuriously , without question or comment ; and when [she]1771-the englishwoman broke silence to explain what [they]1922-they were doing [he]99-william assented , speaking with an effort and hardly knowing to what [he]99-william assented . [The train]2869-the train to [Paris]42-paris had been announced by [[the station]541-the station authorities]1937-the station authorities for an early hour in the morning , but morning dragged on and became afternoon before it put in an appearance . [They]1922-they waited through long and shadeless hours â€” till two o'clock and after â€” at [the most insignificant of [railway stations]1939-railway stations]1938-the most insignificant of railway stations with [a crowd of would - be passengers]1940-a crowd of would - be passengers ; [a crowd that swelled as the hours]1941-a crowd that swelled as the hours crawled on until it flowed from [the platform far along the line]1942-the platform far along the line , and it seemed doubtful if [any train]1943-any train , however capacious , could absorb its swarming multitude . [It]2869-the train sat in families about [the platform]652-the platform and camped and shifted as an untidy fringe to [the track]1945-the track ; it was querulous , weeping , apathetic â€” it was also , in patches , malodorous . At midday it picknicked , squalidly enough , out of bottles and bulging handkerchiefs , finding momentary distraction in the process ; for the rest it had nothing to do but exchange its miseries , stare at the curve which [the train]2869-the train must round , listen uneasily to the echo of artillery and assail [the station - master]1947-the station - master with complaining queries whenever [he]1947-the station - master dared to show [his]1947-the station - master face . For the most part [that hapless and harried official â€” whose subordinates had been reft from [him]1947-the station - master by mobilization and who was only too conscious that [his]1947-the station - master time - table]1948-that hapless and harried official â€” whose subordinates had been reft from him by mobilization and who was only too conscious that his time - table was a snare and a mockery â€” lay low in [[his]1947-the station - master miniature office]1949-his miniature office ; whence [he]1947-the station - master peered out now and again to make anxious estimate of the numbers that blackened and overflowed [[his]1947-the station - master platform]1950-his platform . As time went on and [the throng]1951-the throng grew denser , [he]1947-the station - master gave up [his]1947-the station - master attempts to reconcile the extent of [the crowd]1761-the crowd with the cubic capacity of [a highly problematical train]1953-a highly problematical train , and retiring to [[his]1947-the station - master sanctum]1954-his sanctum , in despair and for good , locked the door on intrusion and complaint . Whenever â€” as happened not once , but often â€” an engine was sighted rounding the curve to the northward , there was instant bustle and expectation on the part of [the waiting multitude]1955-the waiting multitude . Makeshift luggage was collected and clutched at , [mothers]1956-mothers screamed to [[their]1956-mothers straying young families]1957-their straying young families and herded [them]1957-their straying young families together in anxious preparation for the formidable struggle ahead ; but not once but often the alarm was a false one , the preparations in vain , as [the train]2869-the train sped by without halt . The first to run past was [a Red Cross train with [bandaged men]1960-bandaged men showing at the windows ; as [it]2869-the train slid between [the platforms]1961-the platforms [the crowd]1761-the crowd buzzed [its]1761-the crowd disappointment and then â€” with the exception of [some few determined souls who vented [their]1963-some few determined souls who vented their annoyance in raps on the station - master 's door annoyance in raps on [the station - master]1947-the station - master 's door]1963-some few determined souls who vented their annoyance in raps on the station - master 's door]1959-a red cross train with bandaged men showing at the windows ; as it slid between the platforms the crowd buzzed its disappointment and then â€” with the exception of some few determined souls who vented their annoyance in raps on the station - master 's door â€” settled down in dejection to continue [its]2869-the train weary waiting . Another half - hour of sweltering impatience and again [the mothers]1965-the mothers screamed and rounded up [[their]1965-the mothers families]1966-their families , with the same result as before ; this time [the relentless and undelaying train]1967-the relentless and undelaying train was packed , not with [wounded soldiers]1968-wounded soldiers , but with [refugees from higher up the line]1969-refugees from higher up the line â€” like unto [themselves]1969-refugees from higher up the line but more fortunate . [It]1970-it was packed to the doors and beyond the doors â€” since [men]368-men were hanging on the footboards . For many reasons [William]99-william and [[his]99-william guardian]1972-his guardian avoided the platform where [the crowd]1761-the crowd was thickest and sat under the hedge by the line . During the first hour or two of [their]1974-their weary sojourn [she]1972-his guardian judged [him]99-william past rousing and left [him]99-william to [his]99-william own thoughts ; and [he]99-william sat by [her]1972-his guardian side with [his]99-william hands hugging [his]99-william knees and seemingly unconscious of [her]1972-his guardian presence . Later , about midday , when [she]1972-his guardian fed [him]99-william from the store of provisions [she]1972-his guardian had brought for the journey , [she]1972-his guardian essayed to rouse [him]99-william by telling [him]99-william how [she]1972-his guardian had come [there]527-there and who [she]1972-his guardian was . [Her]1972-his guardian name was [Haynes]139-edith haynes , [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes ; [she]1972-his guardian had been some weeks in [the neighbourhood]973-the neighbourhood , staying in [the country house of [some distant French cousins]1978-some distant french cousins]1977-the country house of some distant french cousins . [They]1979-they had been warned , soon after hostilities broke out , that proximity to [the frontier]1980-the frontier might be dangerous , but had been unable to leave owing to the illness of [one of [the family]201-the family]1981-one of the family . [Yesterday]140-yesterday [the invalid]1983-the invalid , partially recovered , had been got off with [[her]1983-the invalid mother]1984-her mother in [a car procured with difficulty]1985-a car procured with difficulty ; as it had [other occupants]1986-other occupants and could not carry [the whole party]1987-the whole party , [she]1972-his guardian â€” [Miss Haynes]141-miss haynes â€” had volunteered to remain behind and follow to [Paris]42-paris by rail . [William]99-william listened , occasionally nodding to show that [he]99-william listened ; in a way [he]99-william was grateful for [her]1972-his guardian presence , but nothing seemed to matter ... and , seeing that it was as yet too early to help [him]99-william to other thoughts , [she]1972-his guardian left [him]99-william again to [his]99-william silence . It was after two when [a nearing train]1988-a nearing train slowed down as [it]1988-a nearing train reached [the station]541-the station â€” slowed down and came to a standstill to a tumult of pushing and shouting . It was [a train]564-a train of more than ordinary dimensions â€” a couple of engines to an interminable line of [third - class carriages and vans]1991-third - class carriages and vans â€” but long as it was , it was none too long for the needs of [the would - be passengers]1992-the would - be passengers . [Vans]1993-vans and [carriages]1994-carriages alike were already well stocked with humanity ; but the other humanity on [the platform]652-the platform , rendered desperate by its waiting , hurled itself at the doors and pressed and fought a way in . The sight was not pleasant â€” there was trampling , expostulation , threats . [The angry , frightened crowd]1996-the angry , frightened crowd was past minding its manners , and at times the rush for the doors was carried on almost with savagery ; [women]338-women were buffeted â€” and buffeted back â€” and [children]1998-children swept away in the press . [William]99-william and [[his]99-william friend]1999-his friend â€” [she]1972-his guardian was the sturdier as well as [the taller of [the two]2001-the two]2000-the taller of the two â€” clambered up the steps of [a covered truck]2002-a covered truck and were thrust through its opening by the weight of those pressing behind [them]2001-the two . [The truck]2003-the truck , when [they]2001-the two gained [it]2003-the truck , was close , evil - smelling and crowded ; so crowded that [many]2004-many had to keep [their]2004-many feet for lack of the floor space to sit . When the struggle for [places]2005-places was over â€” and it was not over quickly â€” [the train]2869-the train was packed end to end with [sweating and exhausted travellers]2007-sweating and exhausted travellers . There followed a journey that to [those who endured it]2008-those who endured it seemed endless , a crawl punctuated with halts . [The halts]2009-the halts were lengthy as well as frequent ; sometimes in [sidings where [refugees]2011-refugees perforce gave place to [troop trains]2012-troop trains]2010-sidings where refugees perforce gave place to troop trains , sometimes in junctions where [they]2012-troop trains pulled up indefinitely at [a platform]2013-a platform and where [worn - out officials]2014-worn - out officials could give no information as to when a fresh start would be made . The waits , wearisome as [they]2012-troop trains were , were by far more endurable than the wretched stages in between ; which were stages of sweating heat and smells , of stifling and cramped discomfort . On [the platform]652-the platform , at least , it was possible to stretch and breathe ; in the vans it was aching backs and bones and a foulness that thickened with the miles . [Children]1998-children wept and sickened as the hours crawled by and all through the darkness [their]1998-children crying was never stilled ; as wretched little wailing or angry howl , it mingled always with the throb and clank of [the train]2869-the train . The delicate chill of morning was as nectar after the stench of the crowded night . By special mercy , just as dawn broke [they]2001-the two drew up in [a siding with fields to the right and left of [them]2001-the two]2018-a siding with fields to the right and left of them ; neither [William]99-william nor [[his]99-william friend]1999-his friend was asleep when [the train]2869-the train stopped , and , crawling over recumbent bodies on the floor of [the van]2021-the van , [they]2001-the two dropped down stiffly from [their]2001-the two pen and stood breathing in the clean , cool wind . With [their]2001-the two damp clothes sticking to [their]2001-the two heated bodies , [they]2001-the two sucked the air into [their]2001-the two lungs â€” even [William]99-william , blind with [his]99-william misery , conscious of the calm loveliness of morning on stretches of green after the reek of [the lantern - lit van]2022-the lantern - lit van . [[His]99-william companion]260-his companion , shuddering at the sight of [her]260-his companion hands , went in search of water and discovered a tap on [the platform]652-the platform ; whereat [William]99-william , in [his]99-william turn , drank thirstily and soused hands and face before [they]2001-the two settled down in a field at the side of the line . There , on [the good green turf]2025-the good green turf , [they]2001-the two shared the last remnants of [their]2001-the two package of food , some bread and an apple apiece . for all the hours [they]2001-the two had spent on [the train]2869-the train [they]2001-the two had accomplished only some half of the distance to [Paris]42-paris ; and as [refreshment rooms]2027-refreshment rooms â€” closed or cleared out by [the troops]2028-the troops â€” could no longer be counted on to supply the needs of [the traveller]2029-the traveller , [they]2001-the two had little prospect of further sustenance till [they]2001-the two reached [their]2001-the two journey 's end . [They]2001-the two ate [their]2001-the two small meal sitting as far as [they]2001-the two deemed safe from [the train]2869-the train and [the crowd [it]2869-the train had disgorged]2031-the crowd it had disgorged â€” ate it in silence , for [William]99-william had not yet found speech . [[His]99-william world]2032-his world , for the time being , was formless and void , and , as such , incapable of expression . All day [they]2001-the two travelled , as [they]2001-the two had travelled on the day before : in [jolted crowds]2033-jolted crowds , in squalor , in heat , to the sound of the misery of [children]1998-children . [They]2001-the two ached , [they]2001-the two wearied , [they]2001-the two sweated , [they]2001-the two thirsted â€” [they]2001-the two halted and lurched on again ; too wearied even for impatience , [they]2001-the two endured without complaint until even [the children]1434-the children were past crying . The sun was low on the horizon when [William]99-william , drowsily stupid , raised [his]99-william head from [his]99-william knees as [[his]99-william friend]1999-his friend touched [him]99-william on the arm . [He]99-william looked up stupidly â€” [the train]2869-the train was plodding through [forest]2038-forest ; [he]99-william had ceased to hope for the journey 's end and sat for the most part with [his]99-william head on [his]99-william knees in a dull , half - dozing resignation . " If [we]2039-we do n't stop again , "[1999-his friend] [she]1999-his friend told [him]99-william , " [we]2039-we ought to be in fairly soon . [I]1999-his friend think that 's [Chantilly]51-chantilly [we]2039-we 've run through . [We]2039-we 're only half an hour from [Paris]42-paris â€” in ordinary times , that 's to say . "[1999-his friend] The times were not ordinary and they took more than half an hour â€” very much more â€” to get over the twenty odd miles . [They]2039-we slowed to a crawl for the last stretch of the journey , and outside [Paris]42-paris , between [Paris]42-paris and [St. Denis]52-st. denis , [they]2039-we halted and waited till well after night had fallen . But at long last the interminable wait was ended and [they]2039-we creaked and crept forward to [a platform of the Gare du Nord]2040-a platform of the gare du nord â€” where [William]99-william for the first time set foot in [the capital of [France]40-france]2041-the capital of france . As [he]99-william did so [he]99-william remembered a fact that had hitherto slipped [his]99-william memory â€” that [Heinz]126-heinz and [[his]126-heinz companions]244-his companions , when [they]244-his companions took [his]99-william pocket - book , had left [him]99-william without a penny . So far the loss of [his]99-william purse had not troubled [him]99-william ; [he]99-william had lived as [the beasts]2043-the beasts live and been cared for even as [they]2043-the beasts ; but [Paris]42-paris was civilization where money would be needed for [a lodging]2044-a lodging . [He]99-william had no resource but [[his]99-william companion]260-his companion , and , as [they]2046-they drifted along with the slow - moving mass on [the platform]652-the platform , [he]99-william appealed perforce to [her]260-his companion . " [I]99-william 'm afraid , "[99-william] [he]99-william stammered , " [I]99-william 've got no money . [They]2991-they took it away from [me]99-william â€” [the Germans]108-the germans . "[99-william] [She]260-his companion reassured [him]99-william briskly with : " Do n't worry about that â€” [I've]260-his companion got plenty . [I]260-his companion 'll settle [the hotel]2992-the hotel and the journey â€” [you]99-william can pay [me]260-his companion when [we]2046-they get back to [London]1-london . Stick close to [me]260-his companion , whatever [you]99-william do ; if [I]260-his companion once lose [you]99-william in [this crowd]2993-this crowd [I]260-his companion shall never find [you]99-william again . "[260-his companion] [He]99-william replied with a mutter of thanks , and , obeying [her]260-his companion injunction to stick close , was crushed , in [her]260-his companion wake , past the barrier at the end of [the platform]652-the platform , past [the heated officials who were striving to deal with the needs of the influx of [refugees]2011-refugees , and finally out of [the station]541-the station]2049-the heated officials who were striving to deal with the needs of the influx of refugees , and finally out of the station . There , in [the open space before [the Gare du Nord]53-the gare du nord]2052-the open space before the gare du nord , [he]99-william stepped back suddenly from the world of nightmare into [the world]312-the world as [he]99-william had always known it . [The wide , lit street in front of [the station]541-the station]2054-the wide , lit street in front of the station was filled with [a moving and everyday crowd]2056-a moving and everyday crowd , in [his]99-william ears were the buzz of [the taxi]481-the taxi and the warning clang of [the tram]2058-the tram . The change from the horrible to normal surroundings â€” from brutality and foulness to the order of [a great town]2059-a great town â€” was so sudden and complete that it took away [his]99-william breath like a swift plunge into cold water ; and as the life of [the city]301-the city enwrapped [him]99-william and claimed [him]99-william for its own , for one crazy moment it seemed to [him]99-william that the last few days were impossible . [Their]2061-their fantastic cruelty was something that could not have been ... and [he]99-william almost looked round for [Griselda]104-griselda . [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes knew [her]139-edith haynes way about [Paris]42-paris ; and [the little hotel in [a quiet side - street]2063-a quiet side - street]2062-the little hotel in a quiet side - street , where [a taxi]2853-a taxi deposited [herself]139-edith haynes and [[her]139-edith haynes companion]1664-her companion , was one that had sheltered [her]139-edith haynes in days less eventful and strenuous , and where [Madame]117-madame peys , in consequence , was compassionate and not contemptuous at being asked to shelter [two late arrivals in the last stage of dirt and untidiness]2066-two late arrivals in the last stage of dirt and untidiness . [William]99-william , before [he]99-william sat down to eat , had exchanged [his]99-william torn garments for the suit of [an absent son , called up on the first day of mobilization]2067-an absent son , called up on the first day of mobilization ; and for all [his]99-william ache and dull stupor of sorrow , [he]99-william knew something of the blessing of bodily relief when [he]99-william washed in hot water and was clean . [He]99-william had had no real sleep since the night before [Griselda]104-griselda died ; now the need for it came down on [him]99-william like a heavy cloud and , great as was also [his]99-william need for food , [he]99-william could hardly keep [his]99-william eyes open through supper . When [he]99-william woke next morning it was nearing midday and [he]99-william had more than slept the clock round . [He]99-william pressed the bell as [he]99-william had been told to do when [he]99-william woke ; and with the coffee and rolls that arrived at the summons came a pencilled note from [[his]99-william mentor]2068-his mentor .
