[She]2068-his mentor had gone out to look up [[her]2068-his mentor relatives]2069-her relatives , and also to inquire about the time and manner of the journey from [Paris]42-paris to [London]1-london ; [she]2068-his mentor wrote that [she]2068-his mentor might not be back at [the hotel]2992-the hotel for some hours , but the envelope that enclosed [her]2068-his mentor communication enclosed likewise a tactfully proffered loan for the immediate needs of [[her]2068-his mentor fellow - traveller]2071-her fellow - traveller 's wardrobe . But for the reminder it would have hardly occurred to [him]99-william that [his]99-william wardrobe was in need of renewal ; [he]99-william had grown so accustomed in the last long days to being ordered , guided , or driven that [he]99-william had lost the habit of directing [his]99-william own doings . As it was , [he]99-william breakfasted , dressed [himself]99-william again in the suit of [[Madame]117-madame peys 's absent son]2072-madame 's absent son , and was instructed by [Madame]117-madame peys [herself]117-madame peys where to find [a barber]2073-a barber for an overdue shave and an outfitter capable of English . Thither [he]99-william went , made [his]99-william purchases mechanically and returned to [the hotel]2992-the hotel with [his]99-william new suit of black in a parcel . It seemed to [him]99-william , as [he]99-william walked [the [Paris]42-paris streets]2075-the paris streets , as [he]99-william bought and paid and spoke of things that did not matter , that [his]99-william sense of loss and [his]99-william longing for [Griselda]104-griselda was stronger even than in the first hours after [her]104-griselda death . It was accentuated by [his]99-william contact with [the civilized]2076-the civilized , [the normal]2077-the normal ; by the sights and sounds of the everyday world to which [Griselda]104-griselda belonged . [She]104-griselda had had no place in [the strange French village where]2078-the strange french village where [she]104-griselda died , [no place]2079-no place in [the misery and dirt of [the crowded truck]2081-the crowded truck]2080-the misery and dirt of the crowded truck ; but here where life , to all seeming , was as usual , where [the streets]2082-the streets were like enough to [English streets]2083-english streets to produce , after country solitude and the savagery of bloodshed , the illusion of dear familiarity : here [she]104-griselda should have walked with [her]104-griselda arm in [his]99-william . Here [she]104-griselda would have chatted , have gazed in shop windows and bargained ... and long years faced [him]99-william with [their]2084-their deadly never as [he]99-william went [his]99-william way without [her]104-griselda . Later , when [he]99-william had returned to [the hotel]2992-the hotel and changed into [his]99-william new black suit , a wild fit of useless rage came over [him]99-william â€” and alone in [[his]99-william third - floor bedroom]2086-his third - floor bedroom [he]99-william cursed [the devils who had killed [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife]2087-the devils who had killed his wife , the devils who had made the war . Under [his]99-william breath , lest [he]99-william should be heard in [the corridor]2089-the corridor , [he]99-william called down the vengeance of [God]101-god on [their]2090-their evil heads , breaking inevitably , as [his]99-william own store of invective gave out into lyrical reminiscence of that Biblical lore with which [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother had imbued [him]99-william through Sunday after Sunday of [his]99-william childhood ; believing in [the God whose existence [he]99-william had usually ignored ( and often doubted ) because of [his]99-william need of [an avenger]2093-an avenger and a present help in [his]99-william trouble]2092-the god whose existence he had usually ignored ( and often doubted ) because of his need of an avenger and a present help in his trouble . In that moment the God whom [he]99-william sought â€” and it may be found â€” was [the Lord God of Hosts]2094-the lord god of hosts , [the Mighty One of [Israel]54-israel]2095-the mighty one of israel , [Who was wo nt to strike the wicked and spare not]2096-who was wo nt to strike the wicked and spare not ; and the desire of [his]99-william shaken and rebellious soul was even as the desire of [him]99-william who sang out [his]99-william hatred by [the alien waters of [Babylon]55-babylon]2097-the alien waters of babylon . [The hotel chambermaid]2098-the hotel chambermaid put an end to [his]99-william whispered prayer and anathema by tapping on the door to inform [him]99-william that lunch was waiting on the table . [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes , when [she]139-edith haynes returned in the late afternoon with news that the journey could be made on the following day by way of [Dieppe]56-dieppe and [Folkestone]57-folkestone , found [him]99-william clad in [his]99-william new - bought mourning for [Griselda]104-griselda and poring over English newspapers . [His]99-william eyes were still haggard and moved [her]139-edith haynes to pity , but [she]139-edith haynes took it as a good sign that [his]99-william stupor of grief had passed and that [he]99-william had begun ( as [his]99-william first question told [her]139-edith haynes ) to feel a need for more information which might bridge the month 's gap in [his]99-william knowledge of [the outer world]2099-the outer world . [She]139-edith haynes gave [him]99-william , with such detail as [she]139-edith haynes had in [her]139-edith haynes possession , the story of the outbreak of war and the causes thereof : and from [her]139-edith haynes [he]99-william learned for the first time of the ultimatum to [Servia]41-servia , and the tension thereby created ; of the political consequences of the invasion of [Belgium]37-belgium , and the feverish days of hesitation in [England]10-england that had ended , on the Fourth of August , with the formal declaration of war . [He]99-william listened , sometimes puzzled but always intent , from time to time putting a question that revealed [his]99-william blank ignorance of the network of European politics ; to which [she]139-edith haynes replied as clearly as [she]139-edith haynes could , showing [him]99-william maps and talking on in the hope of distracting [him]99-william from the thoughts behind [his]99-william haggard eyes . By degrees [she]139-edith haynes gleaned , from [his]99-william hesitating queries and disconnected comments , some understanding not only of [his]99-william profound ignorance of the forces that had brought about the war , but of the upheaval of [his]99-william mind and soul which was the direct and inevitable consequence of the loss of [his]99-william former faith . Once or twice as [they]2100-they talked [he]99-william quoted [her]139-edith haynes scraps and jerks of anti - militarist propaganda â€” from [Faraday]100-faraday , from [orators of [the Trades Union Congress]2102-the trades union congress]2101-orators of the trades union congress , from a speech of [Philip Snowden]142-philip snowden 's in Parliament urging the reduction of the Navy â€” and [she]139-edith haynes saw that [he]99-william was trying to justify to [himself]99-william [his]99-william attitude and creed of yesterday . In the midst of a quotation from [Faraday]100-faraday on the general strike as a certain preventive of war , [he]99-william broke off suddenly to appeal to [her]139-edith haynes with : " [Every one]2994-every one thought [he]99-william was right . [He]99-william seemed so sure . [I]99-william did n't see how [he]99-william could be wrong ! "[99-william] [She]139-edith haynes noticed that , wherever [their]2100-they talk might stray , [he]99-william came back , time and again , to [his]99-william central fact â€” that the blankly impossible had happened and the jest was a brutal truth . That , in the beginning , was all [his]99-william mind had laid hold of ; now , the first stage of amazement over , [he]99-william was groping instinctively , and perhaps unconsciously , after rights and wrongs of quarrel , and striving to understand how the impossible had come into existence . [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes had not passed [her]139-edith haynes life in the atmosphere of Internationalism , and would have been more than human had [she]139-edith haynes been [an impartial guide to [him]99-william where the causes of war were concerned]2103-an impartial guide to him where the causes of war were concerned â€” just as [he]99-william would have been more than human had [he]99-william been capable of impartial guidance . What [he]99-william lacked in patriotism [he]99-william made up in personal suffering ; [he]99-william hated the German because [he]99-william had been robbed of [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife , and it added but little to the fire of [his]99-william hatred to learn of faith broken with [Belgium]37-belgium . If [he]99-william listened intently when [she]139-edith haynes told of it , if [he]99-william pored over newspaper paragraphs dealing with German cruelty to the conquered , it was because they fitted with [his]99-william mood and justified the loathing in [his]99-william soul . It was [his]99-william persistent poring over English newspapers that brought [him]99-william in the end the salvation of a definite purpose . An article in The Daily Chronicle â€” some days old â€” described the beginning of the recruiting campaign for the raising of [Kitchener 's Army]58-kitchener 's army ; [he]99-william read it as [he]99-william read everything else that explained or described the war . At first the article was nothing but news to [him]99-william , a mere statement of facts ; but as [he]99-william read further a meaning flamed into the news . Bereft as [he]99-william was of guidance , [his]99-william mind swinging rudderless in chaos , [he]99-william was waiting unconsciously for [the man]281-the man or the impulse that could seize on [his]99-william helpless emotion and give purpose and direction to [his]99-william life ; thus [the journalist]2106-the journalist 's vigorous appeal to [the nation]2107-the nation 's patriotism was driven home by the force of [his]99-william own experience and became an appeal to [himself]99-william . [The writer]2108-the writer had illustrated [his]2108-the writer argument in the obvious manner , by reference to the condition of [invaded Belgium]37-belgium and the suffering of [[her]2107-the nation people]2109-her people under the hand and heel of [the enemy]2110-the enemy ; [he]2108-the writer wrote of [women]338-women outraged , of [hostages]2112-hostages killed , of [cities]2113-cities laid waste , and of [houses]2114-houses fired with intention . [He]2108-the writer was spurred by indignation , by pity and a natural patriotism , and had laid on [his]2108-the writer colours â€” to all but [William]99-william â€” with a vivid and forcible pen . To [William]99-william , as [he]99-william read , the result seemed lame and pitiful , an inadequate babbling of the living horrors that had burned themselves into [his]99-william soul ; but for all its weakness â€” perhaps because of it â€” the article gave [him]99-william the impulse for which [he]99-william had been waiting in torment . It may have been [his]99-william very sense of the inadequacy with which it described what [he]99-william had known that set [his]99-william imagination to work , that drove home its purport and made of it a lead to [his]99-william blind and whirling emotions . [He]99-william read and re - read while [he]99-william quivered with impatience at its failure ; if [the man]281-the man had seen what [he]99-william had seen , if [the man]281-the man had lost what [he]281-the man had lost , [he]281-the man could not have argued so tamely . [His]99-william pen would have been dipped in fire ; [he]99-william would have written so that [all men reading [him]99-william]2117-all men reading him would have rushed to arms . The paper dropped from [his]99-william hands to the table and [he]99-william sat staring at a picture of [his]99-william own making â€” of [a crowd bitter and determined , moved by the tale of wrongdoing to a righteous and terrible wrath]2118-a crowd bitter and determined , moved by the tale of wrongdoing to a righteous and terrible wrath . [He]99-william saw it setting forth to execute justice and avenge innocent blood ... and [himself]99-william one of it , spurring and urging it on . So [he]99-william first visualized [himself]99-william as [a soldier]2909-a soldier â€” [an unscientific combatant of the Homeric pattern]2120-an unscientific combatant of the homeric pattern , but nevertheless [a soldier]2909-a soldier . The vision thrilled and inspired [him]99-william , and out of the deep waters of [his]99-william impotent misery [he]99-william clutched at the knowledge that [he]99-william could act , resent , resist ; that , ceasing to suffer as [the slave]2122-the slave suffers , [he]99-william could give back blow for blow . There was enough of the old leaven in [him]99-william to bring [him]99-william up suddenly , and with something like a round turn , as [he]99-william realized that the act of striking blow for blow against [the German]123-the german would involve the further act of enlistment and the wearing of [the King]2123-the king 's uniform . [His]99-william first mental vision of [[his]99-william warrior crowd]2124-his warrior crowd had been vague as well as Homeric ; [he]99-william had only seen [faces uplifted by courage]2125-faces uplifted by courage , not the khaki and buttons below [them]2125-faces uplifted by courage â€” seeing [himself]99-william rather as [an avenger of [Griselda]104-griselda]2126-an avenger of griselda than as [a soldier of [the British Empire]59-the british empire]2127-a soldier of the british empire . But it was only for a moment that [he]99-william shied Like a nervous horse at the bogey of [the " hired assassin]2995-the " hired assassin . "[2130-prophets] [The prophets from whom [he]99-william had learned [his]99-william one - time contempt for [the soldier]877-the soldier]2128-the prophets from whom he had learned his one - time contempt for the soldier were no longer [prophets]2130-prophets to [him]99-william , and [his]99-william conversion was the more thorough from [his]99-william ingrained and extremist conviction that the opposite of wrong must be right . Conversion , in the sense in which the word is employed by [the religious]2131-the religious , describes most clearly the process through which [he]99-william had passed : conviction of ignorance , the burden of [Christian]144-christian ; a sense of blind longing and humiliated confusion â€” and now , at the end , light flashed on [him]99-william suddenly , salvation figured by the sword .... It was , so to speak , but a partial salvation . [He]99-william had lost [his]99-william capacity for absolute faith , for the rapture that comes of infallibility ; but [he]99-william was of all men [the last who could live without guidance]2132-the last who could live without guidance , and [his]99-william new creed had at least this merit â€” it was supported by [his]99-william own experience . [Its]2133-its articles , had [he]99-william formulated them , would have been negative rather than assertive â€” [I]0-i have ceased to believe in the old , rather than [I]0-i believe in the new ; but it gave [him]99-william that working hypothesis without which Life to [him]99-william was impossible . When [he]99-william took [his]99-william seat , next morning , in [the train]2869-the train bound for [Dieppe]56-dieppe , [his]99-william mind was made up â€” made up fiercely and definitely â€” on [his]99-william future course of action ; and as a result something that was by comparison peace had succeeded to the chaos and dazed rebellion of [his]99-william first few hours of loss . [[His]99-william companion]260-his companion noticed the change in [his]99-william manner and bearing ; it was not that [he]99-william seemed more resigned , but that [he]99-william had ceased to drift â€” [his]99-william eyes were as haggard as yesterday , but not so vague and purposeless . So far during [their]2136-they brief but close acquaintance [she]260-his companion had treated [him]99-william perforce as [she]260-his companion would have treated [a child]259-a child â€” providing for [his]99-william bodily and mental needs and giving [him]99-william kindly orders ; now , ignorant and obedient as [he]99-william still was in the matter of foreign travel , [he]99-william was once more [a reasonable being]2138-a reasonable being . [He]99-william was still for the most part sunk in [his]99-william own thoughts , but not helplessly and endlessly so ; [he]99-william was capable of being roused and at intervals [he]99-william roused [himself]99-william . Once when [they]2136-they halted [she]260-his companion was struck by the intentness with which [he]99-william gazed at a trainload of [soldiers in khaki]2139-soldiers in khaki â€” new come from [England]10-england and moving up from [Havre]60-havre to the front . [They]2136-they crossed at [a wayside station]2140-a wayside station , and [the two trains]2141-the two trains stood side by side for some minutes while [William]99-william craned out of the window to stare at the brown young faces that were thrust from [the opposite carriages]2142-the opposite carriages . The sight moved [him]99-william , if not in the same fashion as it moved [[his]99-william companion]260-his companion ; [he]99-william felt no tightening of the throat and no pride in [the men]1309-the men [themselves]1309-the men . What kept [his]99-william head at the window till [the train]2869-the train moved off was chiefly the thought that soon [he]99-william would be even as [these sunbrowned men of war]2146-these sunbrowned men of war , the personal desire to know what manner of [men]368-men [they]1309-the men were , how [they]1309-the men lived and moved and had [their]1309-the men daily military being . Hitherto [a soldier of the home - grown variety]2148-a soldier of the home - grown variety had been to [him]99-william nothing more definite than an impression of uniform , khaki and occasionally red ; now , with the eyes of [his]99-william newborn interest , [he]99-william became aware of detail that had formerly escaped [him]99-william , and compared [him]99-william in figure , in face and garment , with [Heinz]126-heinz and [[Heinz]126-heinz 's companions]2149-heinz 's companions . [These hot - faced lads smoking pipes and calling jests]2150-these hot - faced lads smoking pipes and calling jests would be [[his]99-william own comrades]2151-his own comrades in days to come ; thus [he]99-william studied [their]2150-these hot - faced lads smoking pipes and calling jests features , [their]2150-these hot - faced lads smoking pipes and calling jests dress , [their]2150-these hot - faced lads smoking pipes and calling jests manner , as [a small boy]2152-a small boy scans and studies the bearing of [[his]99-william future schoolfellows]2153-his future schoolfellows . If [he]99-william did not thrill at the sight of [young men about to die]2154-young men about to die , [he]99-william sent with [them]2154-young men about to die ( remembering [Griselda]104-griselda ) [his]99-william strong desire for [their]2154-young men about to die great and terrible victory . Those were the days just before [Mons]61-mons was fought , when [France]40-france ( and others with [her]40-france ) was hopeful of a war that would end at [[her]40-france frontier]2155-her frontier and beyond it ; when , whatever [[her]40-france wiser soldiers]2156-her wiser soldiers may have known , [[her]40-france people]2109-her people in general had no premonition of the coming retreat of [the Allied Armies]2158-the allied armies and the coming peril of [the capital]2159-the capital . There were still some ignorant and optimistic days to live before [France]40-france as [a whole]2160-a whole would be stunned by the curt official admission that [the enemy]2110-the enemy was well within [[her]40-france borders]2162-her borders â€” since [his]99-william battle - line stretched across [the country]535-the country from [the Vosges mountains]2164-the vosges mountains to [the Somme]62-the somme . As for railway communication on the western lines , the rush of [returning tourists that had followed on the outbreak of war]2165-returning tourists that had followed on the outbreak of war was over , and the rush from [Paris]42-paris that began with the new threat of [Kluck]145-kluck 's advance was as yet a thing of the future . Thus [William]99-william and [[his]99-william companion]260-his companion , though [they]2167-they travelled slowly and with lengthy halts , travelled in comparative comfort â€” finding in unpunctuality and a measure of overcrowding but little to grumble at after [their]2167-they journey by [cattle - truck]2168-cattle - truck to [Paris]42-paris . [Rouen]63-rouen kept [them]2167-they waiting an hour or two , and there was another long , purposeless halt on [the boat]560-the boat in [Dieppe Harbour]64-dieppe harbour ; so that it was nigh upon sundown when [they]2167-they slipped into [the Channel]65-the channel and headed north - westward for [Folkestone]57-folkestone . The day , very calm with the stillness of perfect summer , was even as that day but a month ago when [William]99-william and [[his]99-william little bride]2170-his little bride had steamed away from [Dover]15-dover , sitting deck - chair to deck - chair , touching hands when [they]2167-they thought [no one]204-no one saw [them]2167-they . And remembering the fading of [those other white cliffs]2172-those other white cliffs , [William]99-william 's heart cried out against [God]101-god . It was well past midnight when [they]2167-they slid into [Folkestone Harbour]66-folkestone harbour where again there were long delays ; so long that morning was red over [France]40-france when [the train]2869-the train drew away from [the pier]2174-the pier . It was during the two - hour journey to [Charing Cross]67-charing cross that [William]99-william first spoke to [[his]99-william friend]1999-his friend of [his]99-william purpose of becoming [a soldier]2909-a soldier ; [they]2167-they were not by [themselves]2167-they in [the carriage]2177-the carriage , but [the other occupants]2178-the other occupants nodded off to sleep soon after [the train]2869-the train had left [Folkestone]57-folkestone , and for all practical purposes [he]99-william and [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes were alone . [She]139-edith haynes was surprised by the announcement , more surprised perhaps than [she]139-edith haynes should have been â€” less on account of [his]99-william previous record than because [his]99-william appearance and manner were so utterly unmilitary . [The British soldier of pre - war days]2180-the british soldier of pre - war days was a type , [a man of a class apart]2181-a man of a class apart ; it was a type and class to which [William Tully]99-william was far from approximating , and [she]139-edith haynes found it impossible to picture [his]99-william essentially civilian countenance between a khaki collar and cap . [Her]139-edith haynes surprise must have shown in [her]139-edith haynes manner , for [he]99-william began to explain in jerks . " It seems the only thing to do , "[99-william] [he]99-william said . " [You]139-edith haynes ca n't sit down and let it go on ; when [you]139-edith haynes 've seen what [I]99-william 've seen , [you]139-edith haynes 've got to do what [you]139-edith haynes can . And [they]2996-they want [men]368-men â€” [they're]2996-they asking for [them]368-men . The papers say [they]2996-they want [all the men [they]2996-they can get]2998-all the men they can get ... it 's got to be stopped â€” that devilry â€” somehow or another ... and there does n't seem any other way ... "[99-william] [His]99-william voice tailed off and [he]99-william turned [his]99-william eyes away â€” to [the flying fields]2182-the flying fields where the dew was still wet and the shadows still long upon the grass . When , a few minutes later , [he]99-william told [her]139-edith haynes suddenly , " It was just as pretty as this â€” where it happened , "[99-william] [she]139-edith haynes knew that [he]99-william was mentally transforming the peace and greenery of [a Kentish landscape]2183-a kentish landscape into the background of such an imitation of hell as [he]99-william had lived through in [the Forest of]22-the forest of [Arden]23-arden . It was not till [they]2184-they were well on [the [London]1-london side of [Tonbridge]68-tonbridge]2185-the london side of tonbridge that [he]99-william turned again to [[his]99-william companion]260-his companion . Something that [she]139-edith haynes had said in appreciation of [his]99-william decision â€” a kindly meant phrase that commended [his]99-william courage â€” had seemingly been held in [his]99-william mind . " [I]99-william do n't want [you]139-edith haynes to think it 's courage , and [I]99-william do n't want [you]139-edith haynes to think [I]99-william 'm making any sacrifice â€” [I'm]99-william not . [I]99-william 'm enlisting because [I]99-william want to enlist â€” and there is n't anything else for [me]99-william to do . Everything 's gone now â€” [I]99-william have n't anything to go back to . No duties or ... [I]99-william do n't see how [you]139-edith haynes can call it a sacrifice . "[99-william] [He]99-william swallowed and halted again and [she]139-edith haynes could only nod in silence . [She]139-edith haynes knew enough of [him]99-william by this time to know that what [he]99-william said was truth , having learned in the course of [their]2187-their days of acquaintanceship that [he]99-william had lost even more than [[his]99-william newly made wife]2188-his newly made wife , [his]99-william hopes of [a home]2189-a home and [children]1998-children . In very deed [he]99-william had nothing to go back to , neither [home]247-home nor daily occupation ; in losing [his]99-william cocksure , infallible creed [he]99-william had lost the interests wherewith [his]99-william days had been filled . [His]99-william meetings , [his]99-william busy committees , the whole paraphernalia of [[his]99-william agitator]2192-his agitator 's life , were with yesterday 's seven thousand years . Even if [Griselda]104-griselda had not died [he]99-william , knowing what [he]99-william knew , would have had to begin life again . Near [Chislehurst]69-chislehurst , reminded of the nearness of [London]1-london , [he]99-william put an apologetic question . " [You]104-griselda 'll think [me]99-william very ignorant , "[99-william] [he]99-william said , " but [you]104-griselda see [I]99-william 've never had anything to do with [soldiers]2883-soldiers . Have [you]104-griselda any idea how [you]104-griselda set about joining [the Army]70-the army ? "[99-william] [She]104-griselda explained that [he]99-william had only to offer [himself]99-william , and turned up an English newspaper bought the day before at [Dieppe]56-dieppe to point out a paragraph giving the situation of [the various [London]1-london recruiting stations]2193-the various london recruiting stations . [He]99-william studied it with interest and showed [her]104-griselda that the nearest to [Charing Cross]67-charing cross was [a station on [the Horse Guards Parade]71-the horse guards parade]2194-a station on the horse guards parade . [She]104-griselda had not understood that [his]99-william intention was to enlist at the moment of arrival in [London]1-london , and suggested a delay of a day or two for rest if not for reflection : the life before [him]99-william was a hard one physically , and [he]99-william had been passing through a week of exhaustion both physical and mental . To [her]104-griselda arguments [he]99-william shook [his]99-william head , stubbornly impatient ; [he]99-william was so urgent to translate [his]99-william new convictions into immediate action that it was with difficulty [she]104-griselda prevailed on [him]99-william to delay at [Charing Cross]67-charing cross for breakfast , and only manoeuvred [him]99-william into [the hotel]2992-the hotel by assuring [him]99-william â€” whether rightly or wrongly [she]104-griselda knew not â€” that it was as yet far too early in the day for [any recruiting official]2196-any recruiting official to be at [his]99-william post . On that assurance [he]99-william yielded , and [they]2197-they took [their]2197-they last meal together . [She]104-griselda had contracted an odd species of affection for [the little bereft and destitute man whom chance had thrown on [her]104-griselda hands in [his]99-william hour of need]2198-the little bereft and destitute man whom chance had thrown on her hands in his hour of need ; it was difficult for [her]104-griselda to rid [herself]104-griselda of a sense of responsibility for [him]99-william and [his]99-william doings : and as [they]2197-they disposed of [their]2197-they eggs and bacon [she]104-griselda found [herself]104-griselda wondering , with tears in [her]104-griselda throat , how [he]99-william could come through the discipline and hardship for which [his]99-william soft life had done so little to prepare [him]99-william . It was pathetic and even ridiculous to think of [him]99-william as [a soldier]2909-a soldier , [this wisp of [a town - bred talker]2201-a town - bred talker]2200-this wisp of a town - bred talker ; to think of [him]99-william marching and bearing arms in defence of such as [herself]104-griselda â€” who topped [him]99-william by a good two inches and had treated [him]99-william almost as [a child]259-a child . [She]104-griselda coaxed [him]99-william to eat a good breakfast , dawdling over [her]104-griselda own that [he]99-william should sit and rest the longer ; and when [he]99-william suddenly remembered to ask [her]104-griselda how much [he]99-william owed [her]104-griselda for the expenses of the last few days , [she]104-griselda gave [him]99-william , with the hastily invented amount , [her]104-griselda address in [Somerset]72-somerset and made [him]99-william promise to write and keep [her]104-griselda informed of [his]99-william doings . [He]99-william , on [his]99-william part , shrinking instinctively from [those who had shared [his]99-william errors in the old life]2203-those who had shared his errors in the old life , clung to [her]104-griselda as [the one person who understood the new world into which [he]99-william had so lately entered]2204-the one person who understood the new world into which he had so lately entered â€” understood it because [she]104-griselda was part of it ; thus [neither]649-neither was unmoved when [they]2206-they shook hands as [friends]1651-friends and parted at the door of [the hotel]2992-the hotel . [She]104-griselda entered [a taxi]2853-a taxi for [Paddington]73-paddington and [he]99-william turned [his]99-william face to [Whitehall]74-whitehall and [the tent on [the Horse Guards Parade]2211-the horse guards parade]2210-the tent on the horse guards parade . As [he]99-william walked down [Whitehall]74-whitehall [his]99-william heart thudded loudly on [his]99-william ribs . [He]99-william remembered , with a sudden tremor of rage , how [Heinz]126-heinz had boasted of [his]126-heinz Kaiser at [Westminster]75-westminster and a German entry into [London]1-london . The very thought made [London]1-london dearer and finer to [him]99-william , and [he]99-william had a vision of [himself]99-william driving [Heinz]126-heinz before [him]99-william â€” [Heinz]126-heinz and that other , [the round - faced young man with black eyebrows who had worked [his]2212-the round - faced young man with black eyebrows who had worked his will on griselda will on [Griselda]104-griselda]2212-the round - faced young man with black eyebrows who had worked his will on griselda . [He]99-william saw [himself]99-william striking and stabbing at [the round - faced young man]2213-the round - faced young man â€” beating [him]2213-the round - faced young man down while [he]99-william prayed in terror for a mercy that was not granted . [His]99-william lips were a hard white line and [his]99-william fingers clenched and unclenched . [London]1-london ! by [God]101-god , it should be not [London]1-london but [Berlin]76-berlin ! [He]99-william had never dreamed of rejection ; [he]99-william knew vaguely that [recruits]2214-recruits were required to pass some sort of medical examination , but the idea that [his]99-william proffered services might be refused had never entered [his]99-william head . [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes , like [himself]139-edith haynes , had seen few English newspapers for weeks ; thus [he]99-william did not know till [he]99-william came to enlist that the standard of measurement for [recruits]2214-recruits had been raised since the outbreak of war , and that [he]99-william , standing under five foot five , was not up to [the Army]384-the army 's requirements in the matter of breadth and inches . The knowledge took [him]99-william like a blow between the eyes , and [he]99-william stood with dropped jaw , incredulous â€” it was inhuman , it was monstrous that [they]2217-they should take from [him]99-william [his]99-william right to strike back . For a moment [he]99-william had no words ; [he]99-william dressed mechanically , stupid with the shock â€” while [the round - faced man]2218-the round - faced man grinned damnably over [Griselda]104-griselda dead by [the roadside]971-the roadside .... And when , in the end , [his]99-william speech came back and [he]99-william tried to stammer an appeal , [some one]2838-some one patted [him]99-william good - naturedly on the shoulder , put [his]99-william hat into [his]99-william hand , and turned [him]99-william loose into a world that had no meaning for [him]99-william . There were many parallels to the case and conversion of [William Tully]99-william in the first few weeks of the war . There is , and always will be , the self - centred temperament that can shut its eyes to the fact and tread the pathways of the paradise of [fools]2221-fools , even if it treads [them]2221-fools alone ; but on the whole humanity is reasonable and , given a fact , however surprising and savagely unpleasant , accepts it because it must . [Those who struggled hardest against the acceptance of the War - Fact of 1914]2222-those who struggled hardest against the acceptance of the war - fact of 1914 were , naturally enough , [those who had fiery little battles of [their]2222-those who struggled hardest against the acceptance of the war - fact of 1914 own]2223-those who had fiery little battles of their own to fight , and whose own warfare was suddenly rendered null and incompetent by a sudden [diversion of energy and interest in the face of the national danger]2224-diversion of energy and interest in the face of the national danger . The war was [the successful rival of [their]2222-those who struggled hardest against the acceptance of the war - fact of 1914 own]2225-the successful rival of their own , [their]2222-those who struggled hardest against the acceptance of the war - fact of 1914 sectional strife , overshadowing its importance and sucking the life from its veins . Hence instinctively [they]2222-those who struggled hardest against the acceptance of the war - fact of 1914 sneered at it and strove to ignore its existence ; hating [it]2226-it as [a minor and incompetent artist]2227-a minor and incompetent artist may hate [the greater professional rival who sings or acts [him]99-william off the stage]2228-the greater professional rival who sings or acts him off the stage . Only by some such reasoning can one account for the fact that [the aggressive and essentially militarist type of political enthusiast]2229-the aggressive and essentially militarist type of political enthusiast so often runs to pacifism where the quarrels of others are concerned . But for the bitter mischance of a honeymoon spent in [the Forest of Arden]77-the forest of arden and the consequences thereby brought about , such would , very certainly , have been the mental attitude of [William Tully]99-william in the August of 1914 . [His]99-william own battles would have absorbed [his]99-william aggressive instincts , and , never having seen a shot fired in anger , [he]99-william would have continued , for quite a long time , to think of other battles as enlarged street riots which were thoroughly enjoyed by [the bloodthirsty soldiery who provoked [them]2221-fools]2230-the bloodthirsty soldiery who provoked them . [He]99-william would have pooh - poohed the possibility of a war until the war actually broke out ; and then , insisting that it was avoidable and should not have been , have clung angrily to [his]99-william customary interests and done [his]99-william small energetic best to keep [[his]99-william comrades]202-his comrades from straying into that wider and bloodier field where [they]202-his comrades and [their]202-his comrades services would be lost to the sectional conflict . Such , very certainly , would have been [his]99-william course of action had [he]99-william made [his]99-william wedding journey to [Torquay]78-torquay . [Fate]146-fate and not temperament had willed [it]2232-it that [he]99-william should be driven to enlist under [the rival banner of nationality]2233-the rival banner of nationality ; but there were [others of [his]99-william kidney]2234-others of his kidney whom fate had not driven so brutally , and who , unable to effect , as [William]99-william had done , a rapid transfer of allegiance and antagonisms , struggled desperately to uphold , in despite of war , [their]2235-their partially deserted standard . Of such was [Faraday]100-faraday , dogged and fiercely indefatigable ; though [the man]281-the man had soul and brain enough to feel the ground rock beneath [him]281-the man . [His]99-william ignorance of European politics was a thought less profound than [William]99-william 's , but sufficiently profound to have bred in [him]99-william a complete disbelief in the possibility of European war ; hence [his]99-william surprise at the international earthquake was almost as great as that of [[his]99-william former disciple]2237-his former disciple . When the unbelievable happened [he]99-william , as was but natural , was angry â€” [all men]2238-all men are angry when the habit of years is interfered with ; and in the first flush of [his]99-william annoyance ascribed the falsification of [his]99-william every prediction not to [his]99-william own blundering , but to the sins of those who did not think as [he]99-william did . [Those who prophesied war]2239-those who prophesied war â€” so [he]99-william argued â€” had prophesied what [they]2239-those who prophesied war desired .... All the same , [he]99-william was not , like [William]99-william , devoid of the imaginative faculty ; but the war was as yet a great way off and [his]99-william hatred of [the Government of [[his]99-william [own country]2242-own country]2241-his own country]2240-the government of his own country was real . With time [he]99-william , too , came to understand that [a people]2243-a people may have other foes than [those of [its]2243-a people own household]2244-those of its own household and be threatened with death from without ; when [he]99-william was called up under the Conscription Act [he]99-william went without protest , made [an excellent soldier]2245-an excellent soldier and died fighting in a night raid near [Hulluch]79-hulluch ; but in the beginning the habit and association of years was too strong for [him]99-william and [his]99-william bitter dislike of [[his]99-william neighbour]1920-his neighbour overpowered [his]99-william fear of [the German]123-the german . During the first few weeks of the war [he]99-william held peace meetings at considerable personal risk , which , as became [a good fighter]2247-a good fighter , [he]99-william took , even with enjoyment ; distributed printed appeals to pacifist and anti - British sentiment and wrote passionately , if with less than [his]99-william usual clarity , in The Torch . [He]99-william could not in honesty bring [himself]99-william to defend every action of [[his]99-william country 's enemies]2248-his country 's enemies and was conscious of occasional difficulty and a sense of thin ice underneath [him]99-william ; at the same time it was against [his]99-william tradition and principles to admit that the statesmanship of [the land [he]99-william was born in]2249-the land he was born in could ever have right on its side . Tradition and principles might have won hands down , making [him]99-william ardently and happily pro - German , had it not been for the complication introduced by the attitude of [other nations which , foreign even as [Germany]11-germany was foreign]2250-other nations which , foreign even as germany was foreign , had chosen to range [themselves]2250-other nations which , foreign even as germany was foreign with [England]10-england . Hence a difficulty in indiscriminate condemnation and a momentary confusion of thought and outlook of which [Faraday]100-faraday [himself]100-faraday was quite clear - brained enough to be conscious ; it irritated [him]100-faraday and [he]100-faraday was sensible of failure and uncertainty . On the day that [William]99-william arrived in [London]1-london and was refused for [the British Army]80-the british army , [Faraday]100-faraday held a small meeting in [a hall in [a Bloomsbury side street]2252-a bloomsbury side street]2251-a hall in a bloomsbury side street . The object of the meeting was to consider suitable methods of influencing for the better the existing and lamentable condition of popular opinion ; the gathering was not open to [the general public]2253-the general public , only [the initiated]2254-the initiated being present . [Some thirty to forty of [the initiated]2254-the initiated]2255-some thirty to forty of the initiated , chiefly [secretaries]2257-secretaries , [chairmen]2258-chairmen and [other branch officials of [the advanced socialist group of which [Faraday]100-faraday was leading [light and president]2261-light and president]2260-the advanced socialist group of which faraday was leading light and president â€” for the most part [men]368-men , but with a sprinkling of [women]338-women among [them]368-men]2259-other branch officials of the advanced socialist group of which faraday was leading light and president â€” for the most part men , but with a sprinkling of women among them . The moment came when [he]99-william could no longer suffer [its]2307-its company and went out into [the street]983-the street to avoid it . Other purpose in walking [he]99-william had none â€” and thus it happened that , mechanically and without intent , [he]99-william drifted into [the [Bloomsbury]4-bloomsbury side - street where [Faraday]100-faraday held [his]100-faraday meeting]2309-the bloomsbury side - street where faraday held his meeting . [The important doorkeeper]2310-the important doorkeeper would have greeted [him]99-william with more than a nod â€” would gladly , in fact , have detained [him]99-william after [his]99-william four weeks ' absence to exchange comments and views on the European situation ; but [William]99-william , in entering , made no response to [his]99-william " Hallo , back again ! Time , for a moment , turned back in its traces and yesterday unrolled before [his]99-william eyes . [He]99-william gazed at it and sat down slowly â€” by [himself]99-william in the last row of chairs .... [Edwardes]147-edwardes , [the Central London secretary]2315-the central london secretary , was hugging [his]99-william ankle as [he]99-william always hugged it , and [Mrs. Jay - Blenkinsop]148-jay - blenkinsop , [the formidable treasurer of [the Golder]149-the golder 's Green branch]2316-the formidable treasurer of the golder 's green branch , frowned through [her]148-jay - blenkinsop pince - nez at [the speaker]464-the speaker with [her]148-jay - blenkinsop chin uplifted as of old , wore the same capacious sandals â€” [her]148-jay - blenkinsop crossed knees showed them â€” and the same cold - gravy - coloured robe . And [[her]148-jay - blenkinsop son]221-her son , young [Jay - Blenkinsop]148-jay - blenkinsop , as [his]221-her son habit was , sprawled sideways on one chair and curled [his]221-her son long limbs round another . It was all as it had been ; and [Faraday]100-faraday , on [the platform]652-the platform , was speaking with the accents of yesterday . [The important doorkeeper]2310-the important doorkeeper was not the only comrade who had noticed [William]99-william 's return : one or two heads were turned as [he]99-william came in , but for the most part [the audience]463-the audience was intent on the words of [the speaker]464-the speaker . The heads that turned made some sign of pleased recognition to which [William]99-william responded automatically , unknowing that [he]99-william did so . From [his]99-william seat near the door [his]99-william eyes wandered slowly over [the platform]652-the platform , [the hall]2270-the hall and [its occupants]2325-its occupants â€” slowly and with a dull and detached curiosity . What [he]99-william saw there and heard was unreal , like a scene in an unconvincing play ; [he]99-william had a sense of looking at [these people]2326-these people from a great way off , of hearing [their]2326-these people voices from a distance . Something separated and held [him]99-william removed from [them]2326-these people .... [He]99-william had great difficulty in giving [his]99-william attention to what [the speaker]464-the speaker was saying ; yet in the old days [Faraday]100-faraday had always stirred [him]99-william and to - night [he]100-faraday was speaking well . From thirty to forty convinced [adherents assembled at a private conference]2328-adherents assembled at a private conference are not the material upon which [a public orator]2329-a public orator usually throws away [his]2329-a public orator best endeavours ; but [Faraday]100-faraday that night was speaking not so much to [[his]100-faraday audience]212-his audience as to [himself]100-faraday . Unadmitted , even to [his]100-faraday secret soul , [he]100-faraday had great and fierce need of conviction ; it was with [his]100-faraday own doubts that [he]100-faraday wrestled , at [his]100-faraday own head that [he]100-faraday flung both [his]100-faraday jeers and [his]100-faraday arguments . [He]100-faraday was of a finer because more intelligent mould than [the Edwardeses]150-the edwardeses and [Jay - Blenkinsops]151-jay - blenkinsops who heard [him]100-faraday and who were still thinking of the European tragedy as a red herring drawn by [the cunning politician across the path of progress]2331-the cunning politician across the path of progress . Not for [him]100-faraday was [their]212-his audience happy imperviousness to the new idea , and , looking down from [his]100-faraday platform on [their]212-his audience assembled faces , it may have struck [him]100-faraday , not pleasantly , that [these people]2326-these people were in part of [his]100-faraday making ; [they]2326-these people were , at any rate , the product of a system of which [he]100-faraday , in common with [politicians of every creed]2333-politicians of every creed , had not scrupled to make full use . Be that as it may , [he]100-faraday spoke feelingly and well that night ; far better and more feelingly than was needed by the numbers , the attitude and calibre of [[his]100-faraday audience]212-his audience , which was comfortably and stubbornly determined to agree with [him]100-faraday before [he]100-faraday opened [his]100-faraday mouth . [He]100-faraday had not come to the meeting with intent to be so lengthy and urgent ; [he]100-faraday had planned to be nothing more than brief and business - like , to give and invite suggestions for a vigorous prosecution of the anti - war campaign ; but when [he]100-faraday rose to open the discussion [he]100-faraday was carried away by [his]100-faraday own doubts and emotions ; and the " few remarks "[100-faraday] [he]100-faraday had thought to make flared out into a veritable speech . [He]100-faraday fought with and poured scorn on [himself]100-faraday in the name of [others]234-others , rallying [his]100-faraday feebleness with argument and sneering at [his]100-faraday own hesitations . Thus [he]100-faraday spoke eloquently and deserved the applause which greeted [him]100-faraday when [he]100-faraday sat down . [Edwardes]147-edwardes followed [him]100-faraday , in response to the invitation for suggestions : [a little be - spectacled Labour man whose ideal was a world of committees]2336-a little be - spectacled labour man whose ideal was a world of committees . There had been something alive about [Faraday]100-faraday 's outpouring ; it was the speech of [a man who , however resentfully , understood that [the world]312-the world had moved]2337-a man who , however resentfully , understood that the world had moved . But as [Edwardes]147-edwardes quacked earnestly about branch propaganda as an antidote to militarism and a means of diffusing the international idea , the sense of unreality descended again upon [William]99-william . Branch propaganda â€” little leaflets and meetings â€” when guns made a pulp of flesh and blood , and [men]368-men were being shot against walls ! Resolutions in minute - books against wrongs like [Griselda]104-griselda 's and [his]100-faraday own ! For the first time for many days [he]100-faraday felt a desire to laugh , and , if it had not been for [his]100-faraday sense of the distant unreality of the proceedings , perhaps [he]100-faraday would have been moved to actual expression of perverted and unmirthful mirth . It was [young [Jay - Blenkinsop]148-jay - blenkinsop who made the proceedings real to [him]100-faraday]2340-young jay - blenkinsop who made the proceedings real to him ; and , but for [his]100-faraday intervention at the end of the discussion , it is probable that [William]99-william [himself]99-william would have taken no part in it . [He]99-william would have listened for a little , perhaps to the end , and then crept out to [his]99-william loneliness ; but [Jay - Blenkinsop]148-jay - blenkinsop roused [him]99-william and swept [him]99-william out of [himself]100-faraday ... ( In the dark ages that had ended a week ago [William]99-william thought highly of [Edgar Jay - Blenkinsop]152-jay - blenkinsop , esteeming [him]152-jay - blenkinsop [a youth of great promise]2343-a youth of great promise . ) With [his]100-faraday hands in [his]100-faraday pockets , [his]100-faraday broad shoulders lolled against the wall and [his]100-faraday hair , as usual , drooped over an eyebrow , [he]100-faraday drawled out fine scorn upon [the leaders of [the Labour Party]686-the labour party]2344-the leaders of the labour party for [their]2344-the leaders of the labour party treachery to the cause of [the People]375-the people and [their]2344-the leaders of the labour party lack of the sense of [Brotherhood]153-brotherhood . There was no particular purport in [his]100-faraday vaguely scathing remarks , which ( the meeting being nominally for business purposes ) might well have been ruled out of order ; but [he]100-faraday was enjoying the sound of [his]100-faraday own full voice and [[his]100-faraday mother]190-his mother gazed up at [him]100-faraday admiringly . It was more [himself]100-faraday than [his]100-faraday vague remarks that made [William]99-william flare and see red â€” [his]99-william six feet of conceited boyhood propped sprawlingly against the wall . "[2356-every head in the room] [Every head in the room]2356-every head in the room went round with indignation to [William]99-william â€” whom most of the gathering , [Faraday]100-faraday included , now noticed for the first time . [He]99-william was on [his]99-william feet , stiffened and pallid with passion ; but after the cry that had cut short [Jay - Blenkinsop]152-jay - blenkinsop [he]99-william stood silent , with [his]99-william lips apart and [his]99-william hands clutching at a chair - back .
