"[100-faraday] [His]2389-his message of comfort cost [Faraday]100-faraday something to deliver ; it was the sheer wretchedness of [the broken little man beside [him]100-faraday]2390-the broken little man beside him that moved [him]100-faraday to deny [his]100-faraday principles , by implication if not in so many words . The only audible reply that [he]100-faraday received was a sniff , but even in the darkness [he]100-faraday knew that [his]100-faraday inconsistency had not been wasted , and that [William]99-william had gained from it some measure of help and consolation . [He]100-faraday said no more , and [they]2391-they parted with constraint on [the pavement outside [the flat]2296-the flat]2392-the pavement outside the flat â€” to tread through the future ahead of [them]2391-they [their]2391-they separate and several ways . [Faraday]100-faraday did not go back to [[his]100-faraday meeting]2394-his meeting ; [he]100-faraday left it to break up or pursue as it would , while [he]100-faraday walked [the streets]2082-the streets restlessly alone . Between the uttering and fulfilment of [Faraday]100-faraday 's prophecy [William]99-william 's way , for the next few weeks , was the way of drift and uncertainty ; it was also the way of great loneliness , an experience entirely new to [him]100-faraday . Loneliness not only by reason of the loss of [[his]100-faraday wife]654-his wife , but because of the gap that the war had made between [himself]100-faraday and [[his]100-faraday former associates]2397-his former associates . With the ending of [his]100-faraday platform and committee career [he]100-faraday was cut off , automatically and completely , from the fellowship of [those who had been [[his]100-faraday co - workers]2399-his co - workers in the various causes and enthusiasms [he]100-faraday had once espoused and advocated]2398-those who had been his co - workers in the various causes and enthusiasms he had once espoused and advocated . It was not that [all of [[his]100-faraday former co - workers]2401-his former co - workers]2400-all of his former co - workers would have disagreed with [his]100-faraday altered point of view ; [his]100-faraday was not the only perversion to militarism [the stalwarts]2402-the stalwarts had to deplore ; it was merely that [he]100-faraday ceased to meet [them]2402-the stalwarts . All the same the new isolation in which [he]100-faraday lived was largely due to [his]100-faraday own initiative or lack of it , since [many]2004-many , even among [the stalwarts]2402-the stalwarts would have given [him]100-faraday kindly welcome and done [their]2004-many best to be of help to [him]100-faraday personally ; but after the meeting in [Bloomsbury]4-bloomsbury [he]100-faraday felt small desire to seek [them]2402-the stalwarts out . On the contrary , [he]100-faraday shrank into [himself]100-faraday and avoided , as far as possible , any contact with those whose very presence would remind [him]100-faraday of the busy , self - satisfied life [he]100-faraday had passed in [their]2402-the stalwarts company , of the vanished , [theoretical world where [he]100-faraday had met [Griselda]104-griselda and loved [her]104-griselda]2405-theoretical world where he had met griselda and loved her . It was a real misfortune that [his]100-faraday small private income , though to a certain extent affected by the war , was yet sufficient to keep a roof over [his]100-faraday head and supply [him]100-faraday with decent necessaries of food and clothing . Thus , [he]100-faraday was not driven to the daily work of hand or brain that might have acted as a tonic to the lethargic hopelessness of [his]100-faraday mood . Nature had not made [him]100-faraday versatile and [he]100-faraday had lived in [a groove]2406-a groove for years ; and , [his]100-faraday occupation as [a public speaker]2407-a public speaker gone , [he]100-faraday was left without interest as well as without employment . More than once , goaded into spasmodic activity by some newspaper paragraph , [he]100-faraday offered [himself]100-faraday vaguely for war - work â€” only to be discouraged afresh by the offer of an entirely unsuitable job or by delays and evasions which might have discouraged [[men]368-men more competent and energetic than [himself]100-faraday]2409-men more competent and energetic than himself . In one respect fortune was kind to [him]100-faraday ; [he]100-faraday was able , within a week or two of [his]100-faraday return to [London]1-london , to get rid of the lease of [the haunted little flat in [Bloomsbury]4-bloomsbury]2410-the haunted little flat in bloomsbury . [The place]594-the place was dreadful to [him]100-faraday , with [its]594-the place empty demand for [Griselda]104-griselda , and [he]100-faraday left [it]594-the place thankfully for [a lodging in [Camden Town]86-camden town]2412-a lodging in camden town . There for some weeks [he]100-faraday lived drearily in [two small rooms]2413-two small rooms , with no occupation to fill up the void in [his]100-faraday life , passing hermit days in the company of newspapers and poring over cheap war literature ; [he]100-faraday bought many newspapers and much war literature and aroused the sympathy of [[his]100-faraday elderly landlady]2414-his elderly landlady by [his]100-faraday helplessness and continual loneliness . What kept [him]100-faraday alive mentally was [his]100-faraday thirsty interest in the war ; anything and everything that dealt with it was grist to [[his]100-faraday mill]2415-his mill , and [he]100-faraday acquired necessarily in the course of [his]100-faraday eager reading some smattering of European history and the outlines of European geography . The pamphlet and journal soon ceased to satisfy , and [he]100-faraday felt the need of supplementing [their]2416-their superficial comments and sketchy allusions by reading that was not up - to - date . A newspaper denunciation of the Silesian policy of [Frederick the Great]158-frederick the great led [him]100-faraday to [Macaulay]159-macaulay and [others]234-others on [the Kaiser]2418-the kaiser 's ancestor , and references to the Franco - German War resulted in the borrowing from [the nearest Free Library]2419-the nearest free library of a volume of modern French history . One volume led on to [others]234-others and [the local librarian]2421-the local librarian came to know [him]100-faraday as [a regular client]2422-a regular client . [His]100-faraday reading was haphazard , but perhaps , for that reason , all the more informative and illuminating . So far [he]100-faraday had acquired such small learning as [he]100-faraday possessed on a definite and narrow plan , assimilating only such facts as squared with [his]100-faraday theories and rejecting all the others ; where [his]100-faraday new studies were concerned the very blankness of [his]100-faraday ignorance was a guarantee of freedom from prejudice . [He]100-faraday stumbled amongst facts and opinions , making little of them and yet making much â€” since for the first time in [his]100-faraday life there was [no glib mentor]2423-no glib mentor to guide [him]100-faraday and [he]100-faraday was thrown on [his]100-faraday own resources . With [his]100-faraday theories demolished and [his]100-faraday mind blank as [a child]259-a child 's , [he]100-faraday became aware of phases of human idea and striving of which [he]100-faraday had known nothing in the past , and the resulting comprehension of the existence of spheres outside [his]100-faraday own increased [his]100-faraday sense of the impossibility of [his]100-faraday previous classification of [mankind]424-mankind into the well - intentioned and the evil . [His]100-faraday own experience had shown [him]100-faraday that there might be at least [a third class]2426-a third class â€” [the ignorant]2427-the ignorant , the mistaken , to which [he]100-faraday , [William Tully]99-william , belonged â€” and [his]100-faraday reading , by its very vagueness , confirmed that personal experience . As [he]100-faraday floundered through histories , bewildered and at random , [he]100-faraday realized dizzily , but none the less surely , something of the vast and terrifying complexity of these human problems upon which [he]100-faraday had once pronounced [himself]100-faraday with the certainty of absolute ignorance . The Free Library , though [he]100-faraday knew it not , was a salve to [his]100-faraday wounded heart ; all unconsciously [he]100-faraday had done the best for [himself]100-faraday in applying [his]100-faraday mind to matters of which [[his]100-faraday little wife]2428-his little wife had known nothing . Bismarckian policy and the Napoleonic Wars were topics [he]100-faraday had not discussed and interests [he]100-faraday had not shared with [her]2428-his little wife ; hence they tended to come between [him]100-faraday and [her]2428-his little wife memory and distract [him]100-faraday from lonely brooding . Without [his]100-faraday new studies [he]100-faraday might have drifted into sheer melancholia and helplessness ; as it was , [he]100-faraday burned midnight gas over [his]100-faraday books and kept [his]100-faraday brain alive . In a measure [his]100-faraday interest in [his]100-faraday new studies was personal ; the craving to strike back was always with [him]100-faraday and [his]100-faraday reading fed and fanned it ; beginning without system [he]100-faraday was naturally enough attracted by the drama and movement of [the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic epoch]2429-the french revolutionary and napoleonic epoch , read avidly all that [the librarian]2430-the librarian could give [him]100-faraday on the subject and moulded [his]100-faraday ideas of [a soldier]2909-a soldier 's life and military science on the doings of [men of those days]2432-men of those days . The seed of hope that [Faraday]100-faraday had implanted did not die , and [he]100-faraday thought of [himself]100-faraday as [a soldier]2909-a soldier to be , while queer little ambitions flamed up in [his]100-faraday barren heart . [He]100-faraday read of [Ney]160-ney and [Murat]161-murat , who had carried [marshals]2434-marshals ' batons in [their]2434-marshals knapsacks â€” until , the fervour of [his]100-faraday obsession growing , [he]100-faraday dreamed of [himself]100-faraday as [an avenging leader]2435-an avenging leader , and , with a half - confessed idea of fitting [himself]100-faraday for [the office]199-the office , applied hours to the study of the art of war through the medium of an obsolete volume on military lore picked up from a second - hand bookstall in [the Charing Cross Road]2437-the charing cross road . By [its]2438-its aid â€” it had been published in the early ' fifties â€” [he]100-faraday attempted to work out the strategy of [Kluck]145-kluck and [Joffre]162-joffre , and spent long evenings poring over diagrams explanatory of the tactics of [Napoleon]163-napoleon at [Montereau]87-montereau or [the Archduke Charles at [Essling]88-essling]2439-the archduke charles at essling . For a time [his]100-faraday only real human intercourse , and that by letter , was with [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes ; [he]100-faraday had written to [her]139-edith haynes telling of [his]100-faraday rejection for [the Army]70-the army and [she]139-edith haynes wrote to [him]100-faraday more than occasionally . [She]139-edith haynes was fixed busily in [[her]139-edith haynes Somersetshire home]2440-her somersetshire home , looking after [the property of [a brother]2442-a brother fighting in [Flanders]89-flanders]2441-the property of a brother fighting in flanders , acting as [bailiff]2443-bailiff and [herself]139-edith haynes taking a hand in farm - work . For the first few weeks after [Griselda]104-griselda 's death [she]139-edith haynes remained [[William]99-william 's only friend]2444-william 's only friend in the new world of war , and it was not until [he]100-faraday had been settled for nearly two months in [[his]100-faraday Camden Town lodging]2445-his camden town lodging that [he]100-faraday discovered that [some at least of [[his]100-faraday former associates]2397-his former associates]2446-some at least of his former associates had seen fit , like [himself]100-faraday , to reconsider [their]2446-some at least of his former associates views and take up arms for [[their]2446-some at least of his former associates country]2448-their country . [He]100-faraday ran against [one of [them]2446-some at least of his former associates]1602-one of them â€” [Watson]164-watson , in the old days [a fiery committee - member of [[his]100-faraday branch]2451-his branch]2450-a fiery committee - member of his branch â€” in the garb of the [London Scottish]90-london scottish ; and [he]100-faraday did not know how lonely [he]100-faraday had been until [he]100-faraday spent an evening in [[the convert]2452-the convert 's company]2453-the convert 's company , talking [his]100-faraday heart out , talking of the war and [himself]100-faraday . With the first announcement of the reduction in the standard of height for [recruits]2214-recruits [he]100-faraday tried to enlist again and was again refused â€” this time by [the doctor who seemingly had doubts about [his]100-faraday heart]2455-the doctor who seemingly had doubts about his heart . On the way [home]247-home [a fool woman]2457-a fool woman , arrogating to [herself]2457-a fool woman the right to make [men]368-men die for [her]2457-a fool woman , offered [him]100-faraday a white feather as [he]100-faraday stood waiting for [his]100-faraday ' bus â€” whereupon [he]100-faraday turned and swore at [her]2457-a fool woman using filthy words that were strange to [his]100-faraday lips till [her]2457-a fool woman vapid little face grew scarlet . That day , for the first time , [his]100-faraday books were no comfort to [his]100-faraday soul and [he]100-faraday thrust them away and sat brooding â€” understanding perhaps how personal and revengeful had been [his]100-faraday interest in the lore of the past , understanding how strong had been the dreams and ambitions [he]100-faraday had cherished in [his]100-faraday empty heart . [Watson]164-watson , dropping in for a final chat before starting on foreign service , found [him]100-faraday sullen and inert before [his]100-faraday fire , and , casting about for a method of comfort , suggested application to [another recruiting station]2459-another recruiting station ; [he]164-watson knew , [he]164-watson said , of more than [one man who , refused at a first medical examination]2460-one man who , refused at a first medical examination , had been passed without trouble at a second . [Hope]165-hope was beaten out of [William]99-william and [he]100-faraday shook [his]100-faraday head ... all the same , next morning [he]100-faraday tubed to [the other end of [London]1-london]2461-the other end of london , there to make [his]100-faraday third attempt . [He]100-faraday asked [his]100-faraday way to [the townhall]2462-the townhall and in a species of dull resignation stood waiting [his]100-faraday turn for the ordeal of medical inspection . When it came [he]100-faraday went listlessly through the now familiar process , stripped , was weighed and measured , was pummelled , showed [his]100-faraday teeth , answered questions . It was the stethoscope that had done the business yesterday , and would do it again to - day ; not that there was anything the matter with [him]100-faraday or [his]100-faraday heart â€” it was just the blind cruel stupidity that was always and in everything against [him]100-faraday .... While [the doctor]2463-the doctor bent to listen [he]100-faraday was wondering what [he]100-faraday should do with to - morrow , what [he]100-faraday should do with the next day , what [he]100-faraday should do with [his]100-faraday life ! [He]100-faraday had made so sure of a third rejection that [he]100-faraday could hardly believe [his]100-faraday ears when [he]100-faraday heard [he]100-faraday was up to the physical standard required of [a soldier of [the King]2123-the king]2464-a soldier of the king . " [You]100-faraday 've made a mistake , "[100-faraday] was on the tip of [his]100-faraday tongue , and though [he]100-faraday checked the words before they were uttered , [he]100-faraday stood dazed and staring , much as [he]100-faraday had done on the day [he]100-faraday was first refused . [He]100-faraday could not remember clearly what happened to [him]100-faraday next or what [he]100-faraday did ; [he]100-faraday went where [he]100-faraday was told , [he]100-faraday sat and waited , [he]100-faraday repeated words which [he]100-faraday knew must have been the oath ; [[his]100-faraday fellows]1322-his fellows talked to [him]100-faraday and [he]100-faraday answered back ... but all [he]100-faraday was conscious of was the stunning fact of [his]100-faraday acceptance . It seemed to [him]100-faraday [Griselda]104-griselda must know and rejoice â€” and [he]100-faraday had thoughts of [her]104-griselda watching [him]100-faraday , of [her]104-griselda white soul blessing [him]100-faraday to victory . A pencilled scrawl despatched from [a mushroom camp]2467-a mushroom camp in [the Home Counties]2468-the home counties told [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes that [William]99-william was at last [a soldier]2909-a soldier ; it was brief , written shakily by [a man tired in body but uplifted in spirit]2470-a man tired in body but uplifted in spirit , informed [her]139-edith haynes that [he]99-william had just been absorbed into [a [London]1-london battalion]2471-a london battalion , that [he]99-william had not yet got [his]99-william uniform , was sleeping in [a barn]2472-a barn and drilling hard and concluded with the words " Thank [God]101-god ! "[139-edith haynes] [She]139-edith haynes answered the scrawl by return of post and a few weeks later , hearing nothing , wrote again ; but , in spite of [her]139-edith haynes request for further news , for month after month [she]139-edith haynes waited in vain for a successor to the shaky scribble . When it came the war had been in progress a couple of years and the address was a procession of letters â€” whereof the three last were the B.E.F. that denoted service over - Channel . It was a restrained and correct little letter , on the face of it uninteresting and not much longer than the last , but differing from it in that it was written in ink and in the tidy , clerical hand which [William]99-william had acquired in the days of [his]99-william boyhood for the use of [the insurance office]2473-the insurance office . [It]2474-it expressed regret for [his]99-william lengthy silence , but did not attempt to explain it ; and went on to relate that before coming to [France]40-france [he]99-william had been [an orderly - room clerk]2475-an orderly - room clerk , that [he]99-william was at present at an advanced base â€” [he]99-william must not of course give its name â€” where [he]99-william was employed in office work , principally the typewriting of letters . It concluded with an assurance that [he]99-william had not forgotten [her]139-edith haynes kindness and a hope [she]139-edith haynes would write to [him]99-william again ... and [she]139-edith haynes read and re - read the polite little missive , half - guessing what lay between its lines . It had been written in an interval of that typing of local official communications which was [Private Tully]166-private tully 's daily contribution to the waging of the European War ; and it had not been written earlier because [Private Tully]166-private tully was too sullen of heart to write . For a few weeks only [he]99-william had known what it was to be [a soldier of [England]10-england in the making]2476-a soldier of england in the making ; [he]99-william had drilled , [he]99-william had marched , [he]99-william had learned to hold a rifle and [his]99-william body had ached with the discipline . [He]99-william had lain down at night so weary that [he]99-william could not sleep , and [he]99-william had risen giddily in the morning in fear of the day that was coming . [Other men]3003-other men filled out and hardened with [their]3003-other men training , grew healthy , muscular and brown â€” and [he]99-william set [his]99-william teeth and argued with [himself]99-william that this stage of sick exhaustion was only a stage and in time [he]99-william would be even as [they]3003-other men . What [he]99-william lacked in strength [he]99-william made up in fiery willingness , overtaxing [his]99-william energy by dogged efforts to keep level with [broader shouldered , tighter muscled men]2478-broader shouldered , tighter muscled men , and steadfastly refusing to admit that [his]99-william bodily misery was more than a passing discomfort . More than once [a good - natured comrade]2479-a good - natured comrade suggested a visit to [the doctor]2463-the doctor â€” whereat [William]99-william would flush as at an insult and turn on [the meddler]2481-the meddler almost savagely . [He]99-william held on longer than [he]99-william could have done unaided , by virtue of much kindly help . Once , in a sudden need for sympathy [he]99-william had told to one of [[his]99-william fellows]1322-his fellows the story of [Griselda]104-griselda and [his]99-william own conversion to militarism ; and , unknown to [himself]99-william , the story went the round of [his]99-william mess . From the beginning [the men]1309-the men had treated [him]99-william with the instinctive kindness that the stronger feels for [the weakling]2484-the weakling , but from that time forth [their]1309-the men kindness was more than instinctive ; [they]1309-the men ranged [themselves]1309-the men tacitly on [the weakling]2484-the weakling 's side in [his]2484-the weakling struggle with [his]2484-the weakling own deficiencies . Little odd jobs of cleaning and furbishing were done for [him]99-william â€” often secretly , [he]99-william knew not by whom â€” and [no man]1398-no man was ever too weary to take on work that would spare [him]99-william . [They]1309-the men were in a conspiracy to save [him]99-william from blunders â€” to warn [him]99-william or shield [him]99-william from consequences , and as far as camp life permitted [they]1309-the men coddled [him]99-william , with something of the sweet roughness wherewith [Nelson]167-nelson was coddled by [[his]99-william captains]2487-his captains . All the same , and in spite of coddling , the breakdown came as it was bound to do in the end ; [the doctor who refused]2488-the doctor who refused had been wiser than [the man who passed [him]99-william]2489-the man who passed him . There was nothing urgently or seriously wrong with [his]99-william health ; but [he]99-william was not made soundly enough to stand the violent and sudden change from a sedentary life to a life of unceasing exertion . [He]99-william had never taken much out - of - door exercise ; had always trained or ' bussed it rather than travel afoot ; and of late [his]99-william days had been spent entirely between the four walls of [[his]99-william Camden Town sitting - room]2490-his camden town sitting - room . It was on the homeward stretch of a route march that [his]99-william strength failed [him]99-william suddenly and [he]99-william knew that [he]99-william could do no more ; [his]99-william pack was a mountain , [his]99-william body was an ache , and a blackness closed upon [his]99-william eyes . [He]99-william fought very gallantly to save [himself]99-william and , by the dogged effort of [his]99-william will , kept going for a few minutes more . " [I]99-william can do ten steps , "[99-william] [he]99-william told [himself]99-william and counted each step as [he]99-william took it ; then , the first ten accomplished , " Now [I]99-william can do ten more . "[99-william] So [he]99-william kept going for a few yards more and dragged foot after foot till [he]99-william had reached the tale of two hundred ; at which point â€” twenty tens â€” [he]99-william staggered , fell out of the ranks in a faint and was brought back to [camp]2491-camp on [a stretcher]2492-a stretcher . That was the end of [his]99-william soldiering with pack and rifle ; from the day of [his]99-william breakdown on the route march [[his]99-william platoon]2493-his platoon knew [him]99-william no more and when [he]99-william came out of [hospital]2494-hospital , some three weeks later , [he]99-william was put on to clerical duties . As [orderly - room clerk]2495-orderly - room clerk [he]99-william handled a typewriter instead of a bayonet , and handled it steadily as the months lengthened into years . [Others]234-others , [[his]99-william contemporaries]2497-his contemporaries , completed [their]234-others training , left [the camp]2498-the camp , and went off to the front ; [he]99-william remained , at first savagely resentful and later sullenly resigned . [His]99-william conception of soldiering , derived as it was from [his]99-william own brief and fiery experience in [Belgium]37-belgium , from the descriptive articles of [war correspondents]2499-war correspondents and [his]99-william reading of bygone campaigns , had never included [the soldier who was merely [a clerk]1093-a clerk]2500-the soldier who was merely a clerk . [He]99-william had never realized that [a man in uniform]2502-a man in uniform was not necessarily [a man of blood]2503-a man of blood ; the revelation came to [him]99-william only when [he]99-william copied letters and routine orders , filed papers and , for all practical purposes , was back at [his]99-william desk in [the insurance office]2473-the insurance office . [His]99-william daily duties mocked and derided the hopes and ambitions wherewith [he]99-william had joined [the Army]70-the army ; and , ticking at [his]99-william typewriter , [he]99-william contrasted , half - ashamedly , the blank reality with the strenuous and highly coloured dream . One phase of that dream â€” inspiring then , ridiculous now â€” had shown [him]99-william to [himself]99-william as [the hero of some bloody enterprise]2505-the hero of some bloody enterprise and [the central figure of such a scene as [he]99-william had read of in Napoleonic history]2506-the central figure of such a scene as he had read of in napoleonic history ; a scene of be - medalling and public praise in token of duty bravely done . [He]99-william had pictured it often , awake and asleep ... and fancied [Griselda]104-griselda looking down . Slowly , under the benumbing influence of office routine , [his]99-william revengeful ambitions faded , and with them [his]99-william half - acknowledged hope of emulating [Murat]161-murat and [Augereau]168-augereau . [His]99-william interest in the war had been fundamentally a personal interest , and though there had grown up in [him]99-william , by force of circumstance , a tardy consciousness of [[his]99-william Englishry]2507-his englishry , it was hardly strong enough to inspire [him]99-william with pride in a humble and wearisome duty done in [the name of [England]10-england]2508-the name of england . Be it said in excuse for [him]99-william that [few men]2509-few men could feel pride in the labour of dealing with daily official communications â€” the duty of copying out vain repetitions and assisting in the waste of good paper . The stilted uselessness of half the documents was evident even to [William]99-william ; and there were moments when [he]99-william told [himself]99-william , in savage discontent , that [he]99-william would have been less unprofitable in civilian idleness than busied in promoting futility . For a time [he]99-william was jolted out of [his]99-william rut by [his]99-william transfer to [France]40-france in the August of 1916 . [He]99-william was drafted out , at a few hours ' notice , with a batch of [men destined for clerical duties]2510-men destined for clerical duties , and found [himself]99-william planted in [a small French town round which camps]2511-a small french town round which camps were spreading in a fringe of [tent and hutment]2512-tent and hutment , and where [house]1015-house after [house]1015-house was being rapidly annexed for the service of [the British Army]80-the british army . But , save for change of scene and [country]2515-country , [the new rut into which [he]99-william had been jolted]2516-the new rut into which he had been jolted was twin to [[his]99-william old rut in [England]10-england]2517-his old rut in england . It was [the same clerk]2518-the same clerk 's life â€” this time in [the office of [a military department]2520-a military department]2519-the office of a military department â€” but with longer and more irregular hours than fall to the lot of [the ordinary civilian clerk]2521-the ordinary civilian clerk , and with restrictions on personal freedom unknown since [his]99-william days in [the City]301-the city . [The Army]70-the army kept [him]99-william as tightly as [[his]99-william strait - laced mother]2523-his strait - laced mother ; demanded as regular hours and refused , as steadfastly as [she]2523-his strait - laced mother had done , to let [him]99-william wander o ' nights . [He]99-william filed , [he]99-william copied , [he]99-william ate [his]99-william rations â€” and from the beaten track of [his]99-william everyday life , the war seemed very far away . Sometimes in [his]99-william off - hours , afternoon or evening , [he]99-william would tramp up [the hills that held [the little town]2525-the little town]2524-the hills that held the little town as in a cup to a point where , looking eastward , [he]99-william could see the sudden flashes of the guns . The bright , fierce flashes in the evening sky were war , real war made visible and wickedly beautiful ; such war as [he]99-william had seen in [the Ardennes village]2526-the ardennes village , and such as [he]99-william had dreamed of fighting when [he]99-william first donned [his]99-william khaki tunic . And instead a chair and a typewriter in [the Rue Ernest Dupont]2527-the rue ernest dupont , the papers to be filed that [a girl]2528-a girl might have filed , the round of safe and disciplined monotony . That was war as [he]99-william knew it : [an office with flashes in the distance]2529-an office with flashes in the distance . For a few days after [his]99-william arrival in [France]40-france [[his]99-william new surroundings]2530-his new surroundings interested [him]99-william â€” [the cobbled roads]2531-the cobbled roads , the build of [the houses]1712-the houses , the sound of French in [the streets]2082-the streets ; but once [their]2530-his new surroundings strangeness had worn off [he]99-william accepted and ceased to notice [them]2530-his new surroundings . [He]99-william was not sufficiently educated , sufficiently imaginative or observant , to take at anything beyond [their]2530-his new surroundings face - value the various and incongruous types of humanity with which [he]99-william was brought into contact . The strange life of [Northern France]91-northern france affected [him]99-william only where it touched [him]99-william personally , and to [him]99-william the sight of [a turbaned brown trooper]2534-a turbaned brown trooper bargaining in [the market - place]2535-the market - place with [a swift - spoken , bare - headed Frenchwoman]2536-a swift - spoken , bare - headed frenchwoman was an oddity and nothing more ; just as the flamboyant faÃ§ade of [the great church of St. Nicholas]2537-the great church of st. nicholas was an oddity , [a building unlike , in [its]2538-a building unlike , in its mass and its detail of statuary mass and its detail of statuary]2538-a building unlike , in its mass and its detail of statuary , to [the churches [he]99-william knew of in [London]1-london]2539-the churches he knew of in london . [He]99-william came across many such oddities â€” and having no meaning for [him]99-william , they made but a passing impression . After a week or two [he]99-william no longer turned [his]99-william head at the sight of [a gang of [Annamite labourers]2541-annamite labourers]2540-a gang of annamite labourers or the passing of [a detachment of [heavy - booted German prisoners]2543-heavy - booted german prisoners]2542-a detachment of heavy - booted german prisoners marched campwards at the end of [their]2542-a detachment of heavy - booted german prisoners day ; these things , like [the ambulances crawling in [a convoy]2545-a convoy from [the station]541-the station]2544-the ambulances crawling in a convoy from the station , like [the shuttered French houses built squarely round courtyards]2547-the shuttered french houses built squarely round courtyards , became part of the background of [his]99-william daily life and [he]99-william ceased to wonder or reflect on them . Perhaps [his]99-william contact with [alien races]2548-alien races , with [strange buildings]2549-strange buildings and habits once unknown , may have increased [his]99-william vague sense of the impossibility of fitting [all men]2238-all men to one pattern , and of solving the problems of human misgovernment and government by means of the simple and sweeping expedients [he]99-william had once been so glib in upholding ; but on the whole it left [him]99-william unaffected because little interested . [His]99-william course of Free Library reading had placed [him]99-william in possession of certain scattered facts concerning [France]40-france , facts dealing chiefly with the First Napoleon and the German War of 1870 ; but for all the hot interest [they]2551-they had stirred in [him]99-william once , [they]2551-they gave [him]99-william small insight into the forces that had gone to the making of [the country in which [his]99-william life was spent wearily]2552-the country in which his life was spent wearily . [He]99-william was lacking entirely in the historical sense , the sense that makes [dead men alive]2553-dead men alive ; thus , in connection with the doings of present - day Frenchmen , [his]99-william odds and ends of historical reading had little more meaning to [him]99-william than the Late Gothic carving on the ornate portal of [St. Nicholas]92-st. nicholas . The phase of warfare with which [France]40-france familiarized [him]99-william was not only secure and uneventful ; as far as [the native]2554-the native was concerned [it]40-france was likewise prosperous . [The town where [he]99-william plodded through [his]99-william daily toil]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil was blessed as never before in the matter of trade and turnover ; commercially it blossomed and bore good fruit in the deadly shade of the upas tree . [The camps]2556-the camps and [the offices]2557-the offices meant custom to [[its]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil citizens]2558-its citizens , and , whatever the toll in the blood of [[its]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil sons]2559-its sons , [it]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil gained in [its]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil pocket by the war . [The Germans]108-the germans , in 1914 , had threatened but barely entered [it]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil ; [it]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil had neither damage to repair nor extorted indemnity to recoup , and money flowed freely to the palms of [[its]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil inhabitants]2560-its inhabitants from the pockets of [the British soldier]2561-the british soldier . [[Its]2555-the town where he plodded through his daily toil neighbours]2562-its neighbours , [a few miles away]2563-a few miles away , lay in hopeless ruin , [[their]2562-its neighbours industries]2564-their industries annihilated , [[their]2562-its neighbours inhabitants]2565-their inhabitants scattered , [their]2562-its neighbours very outlines untraceable â€” beaten to death by that same chance of war which had spared [the city]301-the city in the cup of [the hills]2567-the hills and exalted [her]301-the city financial horn . [Here]2839-here were neither misery nor shell - holes ; [the local shopkeeper]2569-the local shopkeeper was solidly content , [the local innkeeper]2570-the local innkeeper banked cheerfully and often , [the local farmer]2571-the local farmer sold [his]2571-the local farmer produce to advantage and the volume of trade in [the district]1801-the district expanded and burst new channels . [Eating - houses]2573-eating - houses broke out into English announcements concerning eggs , fried potatoes , and vegetables ; English newspapers were plentiful as French in [the shops]2574-the shops and [small boys]2575-small boys cried [them]2576-them in [the streets]2082-the streets ; and when the weekly market gathered in [the shadow of [St. Nicholas]92-st. nicholas]2578-the shadow of st. nicholas , to the stalls for hardware , fruit and cheap finery were added the stalls that did a roaring business in " souvenirs "[2576-them] for [the English markets]2579-the english markets . [His]2580-he days were steadfastly regular and steadfastly monotonous . Each morning by half - past eight [he]2580-he was seated in [the office in [the Rue Ernest Dupont]93-the rue ernest dupont]2581-the office in the rue ernest dupont ; in [a roomy house]2582-a roomy house , most provincially French , built round [a paved courtyard]2583-a paved courtyard and entered from [the street]983-the street by an archway . A projecting board at the side of the archway bore the accumulation of letters which denoted the department by which [the house]641-the house had been annexed , and on the door of [the room where [William]99-william laboured]2586-the room where william laboured was the legend " Letters and Enquiries . "[2587-his own master] At half - past twelve [he]2580-he knocked off for dinner and was [[his]2580-he own master]2587-his own master till three ; then [the office]199-the office again till supper and after supper â€” with good luck till ten , with bad luck indefinite overtime . On Sundays [he]2580-he was [[his]2580-he own master]2587-his own master for the space of an afternoon , and now and again there were parades and now and again the " late pass "[2587-his own master] that entitled to an evening at liberty . When [he]2580-he first arrived [he]2580-he was fed and roofed in [one of [the camps]2556-the camps on [the borders of [the little city]2593-the little city]2592-the borders of the little city]2590-one of the camps on the borders of the little city ; later , with [half - a - dozen fellows]2594-half - a - dozen fellows , [he]2580-he slept and messed in [the upper rooms of [the building in which [he]2580-he did [his]2580-he daily work]2596-the building in which he did his daily work]2595-the upper rooms of the building in which he did his daily work .... It was a life of bleak order and meticulous , safe regularity , poles apart from [his]2580-he civilian forecast of the doings of [a man of war]2597-a man of war . There was small thrill of personal danger about [its]2593-the little city soldiering ; [the little city]2593-the little city at [the " Front "]3034-the " front "[2580-he] was far less exposed to the malice of enemies than [London]1-london or [the East Coast of [England]10-england]2599-the east coast of england : and almost the only indication of possible peril was the occasional printed notice displayed in [a citizen]2600-a citizen 's window to the effect that within was a cellar " at the disposition of [the public]3035-the public in case of alarm"â€”from[2580-he] aircraft . Once or twice during the first year that [William]99-william dwelt [there]527-there [the anti - aircraft section]2602-the anti - aircraft section grew clamorous on [[its]2602-the anti - aircraft section hills]2603-its hills and spat loudly at specks in the blue â€” which , after a few minutes , receded to the east while [the city]301-the city settled down without injury . [The men in [the town]2606-the town and quartered in [the camps outside [it]2606-the town]2607-the camps outside it]2605-the men in the town and quartered in the camps outside it were for the most part office - workers , [men of the A.S.C.]2608-men of the a.s.c. , of [Labour companies]2609-labour companies or [Veterinary service]2610-veterinary service ; to whom the monotony of daily existence was a deadlier foe than [the German]2611-the german . [His]99-william life had been unusually clean ; partly , no doubt , from inclination to cleanliness , but partly through influence of circumstance . While [[his]99-william mother]190-his mother lived [he]99-william had small opportunity for dissipation even of the mildest variety ; and hard on [her]190-his mother death had come the great new interests which [his]99-william friendship with [Faraday]100-faraday opened to [him]99-william . Those interests had been so engrossing that [he]99-william had little energy to spare from them ; all [his]99-william hopes and pleasures were bound up in [his]99-william " causes , "[104-griselda] and the very violence of [his]99-william political enthusiasms had saved [him]99-william from physical temptation . Thus [he]99-william had come to [Griselda]104-griselda heart - whole and sound , and , even when [his]99-william causes and [[his]99-william wife]654-his wife were lost , the habit of years still clung to [him]99-william and the follies that came easily to [others]234-others would have needed an effort in [him]99-william . Once or twice , in the soddenness of [his]99-william discontent , [he]99-william was tempted to turn to the gross pleasures of drink and worse in which [others]234-others found distraction from [their]234-others dullness ; but the temptation was never an urgent one and there was no great merit in [his]99-william resistance . One night [he]99-william overdrank [himself]99-william in a deliberate attempt at forgetfulness â€” whereupon [he]99-william was violently sick , crawled to bed throbbing with headache , and did not repeat the experience . [He]99-william felt [himself]99-william drifting mentally , and , to [his]99-william credit , made efforts to save [himself]99-william ; tried to awaken an interest in the French language , bought a dictionary and phrase - book and attended bi - weekly classes in [a neighbouring Y.M.C.A. hut]2616-a neighbouring y.m.c.a. hut . [He]99-william spent a certain amount of [his]99-william leisure in [the Y.M.C.A. hut]2617-the y.m.c.a. hut ; borrowing books from [[its]2617-the y.m.c.a. hut library]2618-its library , listening to [its]2617-the y.m.c.a. hut concerts , and now and again making one at a game of draughts . [He]99-william made [no real friends]2619-no real friends â€” probably because [he]99-william was not in the mood for making any ; with [[his]99-william comrades of [the office]199-the office]2620-his comrades of the office [he]99-william got on well enough , but there was no such tie between [him]99-william and [them]2620-his comrades of the office as had existed between [him]99-william and [the men of [his]99-william mess]2622-the men of his mess in the days when [he]99-william first donned [his]99-william uniform . The hope deferred that had sickened [his]99-william heart had driven [him]99-william in upon [himself]99-william ; then [his]99-william desk - work was obviously well within [his]99-william powers and outwardly there was nothing about [him]99-william to call for special sympathy and kindliness . [[His]99-william fellows]1322-his fellows mostly looked on [him]99-william as [a harmless , uncompanionable chap who preferred to be left to [himself]99-william]2624-a harmless , uncompanionable chap who preferred to be left to himself . By [degrees William Tully]99-william was moulded to the narrow little life departmental and lived through its duties and hours of leisure taking not much thought for the morrow ; in [the Rue Ernest Dupont]93-the rue ernest dupont the war seemed much smaller , much farther away , than it had seemed at [home]247-home in [England]10-england , and , absorbed in [its]2626-its minor machinery , [he]99-william could no longer consider it as a whole . [The office]199-the office and the daily details of [the office]199-the office , [the companions [he]99-william worked with , disliked and liked]2629-the companions he worked with , disliked and liked , loomed larger in [his]99-william eyes than the crash of [armies]2630-armies or the doings of [men at the front]2631-men at the front . As [a civilian]2632-a civilian [he]99-william had wrestled with strategy and pored over maps ; as [a soldier of [England]10-england]2633-a soldier of england [he]99-william could not see the wood for the trees . And if [he]99-william did not fall mentally to the level of [that species of surgeon to whom war is an agency for the provision of interesting cases]2634-that species of surgeon to whom war is an agency for the provision of interesting cases , it was merely because , unlike [the surgeon]2635-the surgeon , [he]99-william had little enthusiasm for [his]99-william work . Inevitably , with the passing of month after month , the memory of [Griselda]104-griselda grew less poignant ; and with the soothing of [his]99-william sense of loss there came about , also inevitably , a cooling of [his]99-william fury for instant and personal revenge . [He]99-william had not forgiven and would never forget , but [he]99-william no longer agonized at [his]99-william helplessness to strike a blow ; in part , perhaps , because the discipline under which [he]99-william lived had weakened [his]99-william power of initiative . Though [he]99-william chafed under discipline [he]99-william learned to depend on it and became accustomed to the daily ordering of [his]99-william life ; and [his]99-william early training in [the insurance office]2473-the insurance office stood [him]99-william in good stead , so that [he]99-william performed [his]99-william duties with the necessary efficiency and smartness .... What remained with [him]99-william , long after the memory of [[his]99-william dead wife]2637-his dead wife had ceased to be an ever - present wound , was the sense of having been fooled by [he]99-william knew not whom , of having been trapped and held by false pretences . The fact that [his]99-william grievance was vague did not lessen its bitterness ; it lay too deep for the grousing that [he]99-william heard from [others]234-others , and for the most [he]99-william nursed it in silence , the silence of smouldering rebellion . There were moments when [his]99-william face must have been more communicative than [his]99-william tongue ; for one Sunday , an early spring Sunday as [he]99-william sat on [a hill above [the town]2606-the town]2639-a hill above the town and stared vaguely at the skyline , [a man]397-a man addressed [him]99-william with , " Are [you]99-william feeling like that , [mate]3036-mate ? " These last few days it 's been almost beyond holding in ; it 's the spring , [I]99-william suppose , the good road weather and the sun . "[99-william] Lying stretched on [his]99-william elbow [he]99-william began to talk about [himself]99-william . After that came [a farm]2644-a farm â€” to [his]99-william thinking but a shade less narrow than [the office]199-the office ; to be left for the rolling , the shifting life , the only life worth living . [He]99-william had had [his]99-william ups , [he]99-william had had [his]99-william downs â€” but always with [his]99-william eyes on the distance . And then , in the summer of 1914 , a fancy to see [the Old Country]2648-the old country . [Permanent base]2654-permanent base now , with a cushy job at [the office of the D.D. of Works]2655-the office of the d.d. of works . It 's the devil â€” [this compound]3060-this compound â€” but even if [I]2666-i were out of [it]3060-this compound , [I]2666-i 'm a lame thing . When the war ends [I]2666-i 'm a lame thing . "[2666-i] [I]0-i ca n't remember exactly the feeling [I]0-i had about it when [I]0-i enlisted â€” what made [me]0-i do it . So many things have happened since then . But [I]0-i know [I]0-i did n't think about it long ; so far as [I]0-i remember [I]0-i did n't hesitate , not for a minute . [I]0-i went straight off the morning after war was declared . The war was well past its third anniversary when [William]99-william again met [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes . The silence once broken between [them]2677-them [they]2677-them had corresponded with a fair regularity , and , leave being due to [him]99-william , [he]99-william wrote to ask if [he]99-william should be likely to meet [her]139-edith haynes in [London]1-london ; receiving in answer a hearty invitation to pass as much of [his]99-william leave as [he]99-william could spare â€” the whole of it if [he]99-william would â€” with [[her]139-edith haynes mother]1984-her mother and [herself]139-edith haynes in [Somerset]72-somerset . The reply was an eager acceptance ; hitherto [his]99-william leave , if a respite from [the office]199-the office , had been dreary enough in comparison with the home - comings of [other men]3003-other men â€” it was a suspicion of the loneliness in which it was usually passed that had prompted [Edith]139-edith haynes 's invitation . [She]139-edith haynes met [him]99-william at [the station]541-the station and drove [him]99-william [home]247-home , and [they]2683-they picked up [their]2683-they odd friendship at the point where [they]2683-they had left it off . [The only other member of [the family]201-the family with whom [he]99-william made acquaintance]2684-the only other member of the family with whom he made acquaintance was [a delicate , pale mother]2686-a delicate , pale mother , given , since [[her]2686-a delicate , pale mother firstborn]2687-her firstborn was killed at [Thiepval]97-thiepval , to long silences and lonely brooding ; [a younger son]2688-a younger son had been [a prisoner]2689-a prisoner since the surrender at [Kut]98-kut , and [Edith]139-edith haynes ran [[her]139-edith haynes mother]1984-her mother as well as [the house]641-the house and [the estate]2692-the estate . [She]139-edith haynes looked older , and by more than the passing of three years ; the iron of war had entered into [her]139-edith haynes soul , for [the brother killed in [France]40-france]2693-the brother killed in france had been [[her]139-edith haynes darling]2694-her darling as well as [[her]139-edith haynes mother]1984-her mother 's ; but in other ways [she]139-edith haynes was just what [William]99-william remembered [her]139-edith haynes , [a kindly and capable good comrade]2696-a kindly and capable good comrade . [The delicate , pale mother]2697-the delicate , pale mother kept much to [[her]2697-the delicate , pale mother room]2698-her room , and [the pair]285-the pair , in consequence , were left often to each other 's company â€” sometimes tramping the [home farm]2700-home farm with [Edith]139-edith haynes bent on [bailiff]2443-bailiff 's duties , sometimes sitting by the evening fire . For the first day or two [he]99-william was not communicative â€” engrossed , perhaps , in mere pleasure in [his]99-william new surroundings ; but even through the stiffness and restraint of [his]99-william letters [she]1984-her mother had guessed at something of the change that had come over [him]99-william , and when [he]99-william showed signs of emerging from [his]99-william shell [she]1984-her mother took pains , on [her]1984-her mother side , to draw [him]99-william out and discover [his]99-william attitude of mind . By degrees , from [his]99-william silences as much as from [his]99-william speech , [she]1984-her mother learned of the weariness that had settled like a mist on [his]99-william soul , the aimlessness with which [he]99-william plodded the pathway of [his]99-william disciplined life . [She]1984-her mother knew [him]99-william for [a man disillusioned , in whom the imaginings of [his]99-william pre - soldier days had died as completely as [his]99-william faith in [his]99-william pre - war creed]2702-a man disillusioned , in whom the imaginings of his pre - soldier days had died as completely as his faith in his pre - war creed . Had the lot fallen to [him]99-william [he]99-william would not have shrunk from [his]99-william turn in the trenches , and at the bottom of [his]99-william heart , for [Griselda]104-griselda 's sake , there was always a smoulder of hatred ; but [he]99-william had seen much of the war machine , had realized keenly [his]99-william own unimportance therein , and [he]99-william blushed when [he]99-william remembered that [he]99-william had once imagined that [his]99-william one small arm and [his]99-william private vengeance might be factors , and important factors , in the downfall of [the German Empire]2703-the german empire . And the first mad impulse of agony , the impulse which would have sent [him]99-william into battle single - handed , had passed as it was bound to pass . If [she]1984-her mother suspected [him]99-william at first of a drift towards [his]99-william former " pacifism "[1984-her mother] [she]1984-her mother soon discovered [her]1984-her mother mistake ; the one rock on which [he]99-william stood fast was that conviction of error which had come to [him]99-william in [the Forest of [Arden]23-arden]2704-the forest of arden . [He]99-william hated the war as it affected [himself]99-william , was weary of the war in general ; all [he]99-william longed for was its ending , which meant [his]99-william release from imprisonment ; but neither hatred nor weariness had blinded [his]99-william eyes to the folly of that other blindness which had denied that war could be . [His]99-william contempt for [his]99-william past dreams of [a field - marshal]2705-a field - marshal 's baton was as nothing to [his]99-william contempt for those further past dreams wherein fact was dispelled by a theory ; and [he]99-william had , in [his]99-william own words , " no use for "[2706-a pacifist party which had never , as he had , made confession of its fundamental error] [a pacifist party which had never , as [he]99-william had , made confession of its fundamental error]2706-a pacifist party which had never , as he had , made confession of its fundamental error . [The one]409-the one concerned matters of detail only ; the other [his]99-william fundamental faith .... So much [Edith Haynes]139-edith haynes understood from [their]2710-their intimate fragmentary talks . One change in [himself]99-william [he]99-william had not noticed till [Edith]139-edith haynes , half jestingly , spoke of it : an affection that was almost a tenderness for [the actual soil of [England]10-england]2711-the actual soil of england . "[139-edith haynes] " What shall [you]99-william do when the war is over ? "[99-william] For a week before [William]99-william left [England]10-england there had been expectation of coming developments at the front , and the papers had spoken of " considerable aerial activity , "[99-william] on [the enemy]2110-the enemy 's side as on [ours]2718-ours . The developments commenced in earnest on the day of [his]99-william return from leave ; but [his]99-william first personal experience of the increase in aerial activity was not for a few days later , when , as [he]99-william was passing through [the square in [the centre of [the town]2606-the town]2720-the centre of the town]2719-the square in the centre of the town , a gun thudded out â€” and then another . [He]99-william [himself]99-william could see nothing but a drift or two of smoke , but [he]99-william gathered from [the sharper - sighted corporal]2724-the sharper - sighted corporal that there were [two Fritz planes overhead]2725-two fritz planes overhead , and [he]99-william stood cricking [his]99-william neck and blinking upwards in the strong sunlight while [passers - by]2726-passers - by made groups on [the pavement]475-the pavement and [shopkeepers]2728-shopkeepers issued from [their]2728-shopkeepers doors . [He]99-william had seen the same thing happen before and quite harmlessly ; [no one around]2729-no one around [him]99-william seemed alarmed or disturbed , and in a few minutes the guns ceased firing as [the aeroplanes]2730-the aeroplanes passed out of range . " Photographing , "[2731-the corporal] said [the corporal]2731-the corporal , as [they]2732-they walked away to [the office]199-the office . " [He]99-william 's been over quite a lot the last week or two , and some time or other [I]2731-the corporal suppose [we]2732-they shall have [him]99-william in earnest . "[2731-the corporal] " Yes , "[99-william] agreed [William]99-william , " [I]99-william suppose it would . "[99-william] [He]99-william was not in the least alarmed as [he]99-william settled down to [his]99-william files ; since [he]99-william joined [the Army]384-the army [he]99-william had never been exposed to danger , and security had become with [him]99-william a habit . That night there was a heavy post , and [the office]199-the office was kept working late ; it was close on eleven when [William]99-william was called [upstairs]255-upstairs to take down some letters from dictation . "[2737-the officer who had sent for him] [He]2737-the officer who had sent for him went out grumbling , and [William]99-william followed [him]2737-the officer who had sent for him , feeling [his]99-william way by the banisters , for the electric light was turned off while [he]99-william was still on [the upper landing]2739-the upper landing ; [other men from all over the warren of [a building]1483-a building]2740-other men from all over the warren of a building were descending likewise , and [they]2740-other men from all over the warren of a building bumped and jostled [each other]351-each other in the sudden darkness on the stairs . There were jests as [they]2740-other men from all over the warren of a building bumped and much creaking of boots â€” through which , while [William]99-william was still a flight from [the ground floor]1169-the ground floor , came the first rapid thudding of " Archie . "[351-each other] On it , a moment later , an unmistakable bomb and the pattering outburst of machine - guns .... [William]99-william listened curiously ; it was [his]99-william first experience of an air raid , and though the pace of [his]99-william heart quickened , as yet there was no real fear in [him]99-william ; but [a man pressed against [him]99-william [by the descending stream]2745-by the descending stream]2744-a man pressed against him by the descending stream gasped audibly and clawed round [William]99-william 's arm with [his]2744-a man pressed against him by the descending stream fingers . [They]2749-they had turned into [a room on [the ground floor]1169-the ground floor]2750-a room on the ground floor â€” there were [no cellars]2752-no cellars , but [it]2750-a room on the ground floor was esteemed [the safest place in [the building]251-the building]2753-the safest place in the building by reason of the comparative absence of glass â€” and [the pair of [them]2749-they]1604-the pair of them stood backs against the wall . [He]172-wright spoke of it unceasingly ; whenever the sounds without died down [William]99-william could hear [him]172-wright whispering â€” now of the night when [he]172-wright was bombed in [hospital]2494-hospital and now of [the building [they]2749-they were in]2759-the building they were in . It was no good as [a shelter]2760-a shelter â€” would crumble like [a house of cards]2761-a house of cards . Nothing was any good but [a cellar]2762-a cellar or [trenches]2763-trenches â€” there should have been trenches . And [they]2749-they were so damnably close to [the station]541-the station , and [the station]541-the station was just what [those devils]2766-those devils were trying to hit . There came a moment when [William]99-william could bear it no more , and wrenched [himself]99-william free of the clawing fingers on [his]99-william sleeve ; [he]99-william dared not feel them longer , lest [his]99-william heart also melted within [him]99-william . [His]99-william nervousness took the form of a difficulty in keeping still , and [he]99-william fidgeted about [the darkened room]2767-the darkened room ; but [the room]778-the room was fairly full , and [he]99-william could not move far â€” after a step or two this way and a step or two that , [he]99-william was brought up by a solid group that stretched from the wall to a table . [He]99-william came to a standstill on the edge of [the group]726-the group and tried to listen to [their]726-the group talk ; forced [himself]99-william to listen to it â€” and all the time straining [his]99-william ears through the murmur for the droning of the Gotha engines . [He]99-william fought with [himself]99-william and fought more manfully than [he]99-william knew ; striving to thrust out of [his]99-william mind [Wright]172-wright 's phrase about the " beastly bits of flesh , "[172-wright] and to fasten [his]99-william hearing , to the exclusion of all else , on the voice of [a man]397-a man , [[his]99-william neighbour]1920-his neighbour in the darkness , who had lately seen [a German aeroplane brought down]2772-a german aeroplane brought down , and , having apparently some mechanical knowledge , was describing its points and its engines . [They]2773-they , the engines , were first - rate , [he]99-william said , waxing technical ; but even if [he]99-william had not been told it , [he]99-william should have guessed from the fittings of [the plane]2774-the plane that [Jerry]174-jerry was getting a bit scarce in [his]174-jerry stock of rubber and leather . What [he]99-william was using â€” â€” Here the windows rattled loudly and drowned [him]99-william . " That 's pretty close , "[2838-some one] [some one]2838-some one commented , and [William]99-william moved a restless step away . Once it had seemed to [him]99-william an easy thing to follow [Griselda]104-griselda and die ; now all the moral strength [he]99-william possessed went into the effort not to shrink , to be master of [his]99-william body , to behave decently and endure . That was all that seemed to matter â€” to be steady and behave decently â€” so that , for all [his]99-william fear of instant death , [he]99-william never turned [his]99-william thoughts to [God]101-god .... [He]99-william had not known how beautiful silence could be till it came almost suddenly , like a flood of clear , cool water ; when [some one , muttering that it seemed to be over]2776-some one , muttering that it seemed to be over , opened the door and went out into [the courtyard]2777-the courtyard , [he]99-william followed and stood there feeling the silence as something clean , exquisite and grateful . [His]99-william hands were wet and hot , and [he]99-william stretched them out to the air ; if [he]99-william had not prayed when [he]99-william was under the spell of fear , [his]99-william heart , at [his]99-william release from it , was filled with something like praise . " Listen , "[172-wright] said a voice in [his]99-william ear . It was [Wright]172-wright , [his]172-wright face uplifted in the moonlight and disfigured by ugly twitchings . " Listen , "[172-wright] [he]172-wright said , " [they]2780-they 're coming back . "[172-wright] ... [William]99-william shrank from [him]172-wright irritably , but [the man]281-the man had not spoken particularly to [him]99-william , and , having spoken , turned swiftly and went back into [the house]641-the house . [He]99-william had been the first to catch the double - noted drone which as [they]2780-they stood and listened grew nearer . " That 's [him]172-wright , sure enough , "[2838-some one] another voice agreed . " Coming up in relays . [He]172-wright 'll be out to make a night of it â€” [I]2838-some one thought [we]2780-they 'd got rid of [him]172-wright too quickly . "[2838-some one] A searchlight wheeled and [the anti - aircraft]2781-the anti - aircraft spoke on the word ; [some one]2838-some one cried , " Got ' [i]2838-some one m , "[2838-some one] and pointed , and for an instant [William]99-william had sight of [a wicked thing caught in the ray and rushing upwards]2783-a wicked thing caught in the ray and rushing upwards . [Battery]175-battery and machine - gun gave tongue at the sight , but in a flash [the climbing devil]2784-the climbing devil had vanished and the searchlight wheeled after it fruitlessly . The first attack had lasted not much over half an hour ; this time the ordeal by darkness and waiting was longer . [William]99-william held [himself]99-william tightly , ashamed of the weakness with which [Wright]172-wright had infected [him]99-william and keeping it doggedly at bay ; [he]99-william talked when [he]99-william could think of anything to talk about â€” odd irrelevant fragments of whatever came into [his]99-william head , anything to keep [himself]99-william from listening . At one time [he]99-william made a conscious and determined effort to turn [his]99-william talk and [his]99-william mind with it to something unconnected with air - raids ; but always [his]99-william speech , like that of [[his]99-william companions]244-his companions , came back to the thought of the moment . "[99-william] The beetle simile caught [his]99-william fancy oddly , and [he]99-william found [himself]99-william contrasting it with [his]99-william old idea of [a soldier]2909-a soldier . There [he]172-wright lay till long after the bell of [St. Nicholas]92-st. nicholas had rung an " All Clear "[172-wright] to [the town]2606-the town â€” until long after [the ambulances telephoned for from [the hospitals outside]2803-the hospitals outside had loaded up in [the streets across which cordons had been drawn by [military police]2805-military police and [French firemen]2806-french firemen]2804-the streets across which cordons had been drawn by military police and french firemen]2802-the ambulances telephoned for from the hospitals outside had loaded up in the streets across which cordons had been drawn by military police and french firemen . [Men]368-men and [fragments of [men]368-men]2808-fragments of men were taken from [the ruins]2810-the ruins , some speedily , some after much search ; and among [them]2811-them [Private Tully]99-william , past terror , but breathing , still alive but only alive . [He]172-wright spoke but a few times after the explosion had broken [him]172-wright , and [the men who lifted [him]172-wright on a stretcher to [the ambulance]1390-the ambulance and out of it]2812-the men who lifted him on a stretcher to the ambulance and out of it could see that [he]172-wright suffered not at all ; the shifting and handling that was torture to [others]234-others left [his]172-wright maimed and mauled body unaffected . The injury to the spine that was killing [him]172-wright had bereft [him]172-wright of the power of pain as well as of the power of movement , and in [the hospital]2815-the hospital , where a few minutes ' drive from [the ruins]2810-the ruins landed [him]172-wright , [he]172-wright lay quietly alive for a day or two , for the most part dumb and unconscious , but with intervals of sense and lucid speech . Once , in such an interval , [he]172-wright whispered to [the nurse]2817-the nurse that [[his]172-wright wife]654-his wife , too , was buried in [France]40-france ; whereby [she]2817-the nurse saw that [he]172-wright knew [he]172-wright was about to die .
